loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
This is Marivic, 34, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is a mother of 3 children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marivic operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Marivic sells supplies at wholesale prices and by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 13,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Marivic hopes to be able to expand soon. She also hopes to send her children to school so they can graduate from college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items and products for her business

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Don Juan sigue con su negocio de billares y la venta de fritanga que hace por las tardes, su esposa, ya que por el día, tiene su trabajo fijo como recaudadora de impuesto, siempre apoyando a su familia. 
Para él, las mejoras a su casa, es la prioridad, hoy que cuenta con el respaldo del financiamiento, ha logrado avanzar a corto plazo en su vivienda. Con este nuevo préstamo embaldosará la sala y cuarto logrando mejor higiene y comodidad a sus hijos. Comprara arena, cemento, piedrín para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Juan continues with his billiard business and the sale of fried snacks that he makes in the afternoon.  Since his wife has a permanent job as a tax collector by day, [he is] always helping his family.  

For him, improvements to his home are the priority.  Now that he has the help of financing, he has been able to make short-term advances in his house.  With this new loan, he will tile the living room and bedrooms, [in order] to achieve better hygiene and comfort for his children.  He will purchase sand, cement, and gravel in order to start the project.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, and gravel to tile [his] living room and bedrooms.

loans.name: Alva Luz

texts.es:
Alva desde los 15 años de edad se encuentra dedicada a la actividad de la confección, pues la aprendió de su familia y gracias a esto ha logrado generar ingresos con los cuales contribuía económicamente en su familia para tener una mejor calidad de vida. Actualmente se encuentra casada y tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 13 años de edad, y durante mucho tiempo trabajó para empresas de confección donde podía generar ingresos para contribuir económicamente en su hogar, pero desde que nació su hijo menor, hace unos 4 años, se vio en la obligación de dejar su trabajo ya que siempre ha estado con dificultades de salud. Fue así como se vio en la obligación de dejar su empleo y desde entonces montó el taller de confección en su casa para así poder estar al pendiente de su hijo al mismo tiempo que puede trabajar para generar ingresos con los cuales puede contribuir a una mejor estabilidad económica del hogar. Debido a que su taller fue montado con muy bajo capital solo cuenta con las máquinas básicas para la confección, pero ahora se ha estado viendo perjudicada debido a que por la baja capacidad de producción que tiene no puede recibir los encargos de sus clientes y así su negocio se ha visto afectado. Es por esto que busca un préstamo para comprar una máquina fileteadora y así aumentar su capacidad de producción para poder recibir mayores encargos por parte de sus clientes.

De esta manera las ventas en su taller de confección aumentarán considerablemente y los ingresos para la familia podrán ser mejores, permitiendo que en su hogar sus 2 hijos y su esposo tengan una mejor calidad de vida. Su sueño es sacar sus 2 hijos adelante y que su hijo menor recupere su salud y pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Since she was 15 years old, Alva has been sewing. She learned how from her family, and thanks to that she has been able to generate an income with which she contributes financially to her family in order to improve their quality of life. 

She’s married and has two children aged 4 and 13 years old. For a long time she sewed in a factory where she was able to earn money to contribute financially to her household. But when her youngest was born, who’s now 4 years old, she saw the need to leave her job since he had always had health problems. That was how she saw the need to leave her employer and then establish her sewing shop in her home in order to be able to look after her child while being able to work and earn money with which to improve the financial situation at home. Since she started her shop with very little money, she only has basic machines to sew. But now she is hampered by limited production capabilities. She can’t fill customer orders, and her business is being affected. It’s for this reason that she seeks a loan in order to buy a filleting machine as well as increase her production capabilities in order to be able to take more of her customers’ orders. 


In this way her sewing shop's sales will increase considerably, and the income for her family will increase, allowing her two kids and husband a better quality of life. Her dream is that her kids will be successful, that her youngest will get better, and that she can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a filleting machine and increase production capabilities in order to take more customer orders.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Dambae district of Cambodia, Chan is 46 years old and married, with five children, who are still in school.  He and his wife are hardworking farmers who earn a living through farming rice and cassava. To gain more income and better support the family, they also plant cashews. He and his wife have been in this business for almost twenty years. 

Chan has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for five loan cycles.  He successfully paid back all five loans. The loans from VisionFund have helped the family’s business prosper and enabled Chan to have a better house.  Currently, he is able to earn about US$10 per day. 

Now he is requesting a loan of US$1,000.  He will use this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland and a portion of it to spend on labor. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase his business to make more income, so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland and to hire labor.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto se encuentra casado y tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 17 años de edad a quienes siempre les ha querido brindar una buena calidad de vida, es por esto que trabaja fuertemente desde hace mucho tiempo en una empresa de cultivos de flores y con su salario puede aportar los ingresos que se requieren en su hogar. Gracias a que ha adquirido una gran experiencia en el trabajo, ahora busca tener su propio proyecto de cultivos de flores con el que siempre ha soñado, y por esto busca un préstamo que le permita comprar abonos y riegos para sacar adelante su propio cultivo de flores.

Hace aproximadamente 10 días sembró las primeras flores en un terreno que alquiló y gracias al buen manejo que le ha dado este ya viene presentado favorables resultados. Su mayor sueño es llegar a tener su propio cultivo y poder generar más ingresos que los que genera actualmente con su empleo y así pueda progresar con su familia. También tiene el sueño de tener su casa propio y brindar así a su familia una estabilidad en el hogar.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is married and has 2 children of 3 and 17 years of age. He has always wanted to bring to them a good quality life and to do this he has worked hard in the  business of growing flowers. With his salary he can contribute the required earning for his house. Thanks to having acquired a lot of experience in his work, he now is seeking to have his own flower business, something that he has always dreamed of. For this reason, he is seeking a loan that allows him to buy fertilizer and hoses to get ahead by growing his own flowers.

About 10 days ago he planted his first flower seeds in a plot of land that he rented. Thanks to the good handling that he has given the flowers, favorable results are already presenting themselves. His greatest dream is to have his own crops and be able to generate greater earnings than what he currently makes with his job and be able to move his family forward. He also has the dream of having his own house and bringing his family home security.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and hoses to get ahead with his own flower crops.

loans.name: Pok

texts.en:
Pok is 23 years old, living in Ornlong Veng district. He is married and has two lovely young kids. To raise his family, Pok, together with his wife, work hard in the field, growing rice, potatoes, and beans on their inherited farmland. He has been engaged in this type of business for three years. Pok can manage his business very well because he has enough farm supplies and laborers to help in his farm work. From this business, Pok is able to provide basic necessities to the family, and he plans to send to send all of his children to school

To ensure a high production in the coming season, Pok would like to take out a loan of KHR 1,000,000 to purchase pesticides and spare parts for the maintenance of his plowing machine. Hopefully, his first loan will contribute to his higher income.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and spare parts for his plowing machine.

loans.name: Yon's Group

texts.en:
Yon is a 41-year-old married woman. She lives in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province and has two children (one daughter and one son). To make a living, she has been planting cassava (an edible root) for 20 years, earning about 44000 KHR per day. 

Yon leads a group of four women applying for a loan with VisionFund Cambodia. She's been with VisionFund for one cycle while her fellow members have been with VisionFund from one to three cycles. Yon used the first loan successfully to better support her family. 

As the group's leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay for labor. She hopes to increase her crop yield and earn additional income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose noticed at the young age of 15 that obesity was on the rise in his home country of Venezuela.  He had family members that suffered numerous respiratory health problems due to their weight.  Jose’s interest in working in the health profession to combat obesity began at home and was quickly transferred to the United States when he arrived in Miami in 2005.  He began to look into the best obesity support equipment available at hospitals in Miami and throughout Florida.  The lack of equipment sparked Jose’s desire to sell the right equipment to doctors both in the United States and in his home country.  Realizing the difference the right respiratory equipment had on members of his family, a business idea was born.

Jose initially worked two jobs to build up the savings needed for his business.  He also asked family and friends to invest in his business idea.  The demand for his business has grown in just one year of operation.  He needs a loan to be able to purchase inventory.  

Help Jose expand his business to provide supportive medical services needed for overweight men and women.

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
This is Wilma, who is 42 years old and a resident of Cavite City, Philippines. She is married and the mother of three children.  Her husband is Menardo, who is an electrician.  Together with her husband and children, Wilma manages their household while operating a variety store. 

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one packet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Wilma makes money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 39,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory and for the maintenance of her sewing machine. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Wilma hopes her business would grow into a mini-grocery, and she dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of theiir work every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy various grocery items to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Sreul's Group

texts.en:
A married mother of seven children, Sreul is 62 years old and living in a rural village of the Dambae district in Cambodia. Of her seven children, she still has two dependent children to take care of. To support her big family, she and her husband farm rice and plant cassava as a main source of the family’s income. They have been farmers for thirty years. 

Sreul is in her second cycle with VisionFund while her group member has just started with VisionFund for this loan. Sreul completely paid back the first loan, which has helped relieve her family’s burden. Now she currently earns about 40,000 KHR per day and is able to save about 14,000 KHR every day. 

Sreul is leading her group of two to apply for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labor. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income to make living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Since he was 14 years old, Jeffrey has been around barbers. Jeffrey’s father owned the barbershop that Jeffrey has since taken over. Jeffrey keeps the original sign on the store in his father’s name out of respect for his father and his clients who still come to the shop. His father taught him all he knew about being a barber and running a business and Jeffrey has followed in his father’s footsteps ever since, keeping the family business alive.  The barbershop, Jeffrey’s Barbershop & Salon, became his in 2011. Jeffrey prides himself on maintaining his father’s clientele and gaining new business through word of mouth. The barbershop is a place where his family and friends come together to socialize and stay connected.  The business is a centerpiece in his community.  

With this loan, Jeffrey hopes to be able to expand his business by acquiring more equipment and generating business through advertising. He employs four others in the shop, who cut hair and do styling for other clients.  This loan can help Jeffrey’s business grow, so he can provide the same services for the growing demand in his community for his services.

loans.use: to purchase new chairs for his barber shop

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 30 years old and is a private nursery school proprietor in Kilifi. She is a married mother of one child. Fatuma has been running this business for the past nine years. Her business is doing well.

This is Fatuma’s fourth loan from KADET LTD. She plans to set up more classes and buy new desks. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and improve her nursery school.

Fatuma hopes to develop her nursery school into a primary school.

loans.use: to set up more classes and buy new desks

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 53 years old and lives in Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena. She is married with three children. 

Lourdes works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for thirteen years. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase more different kinds of fish to sell. 

Lourdes has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to repair and improve their house.

loans.use: to purchase more different kinds of fish to sell.

location.town: Plaridel-Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occide

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch, who is 45 years old, is a rural villager from the Dambae district. She earns a living by planting cassava, which is her family's main source of income, and she has been in this business for twelve years. She has three children who are dependent and are still in school. 

Touch’s group consists of three members who are all female. This is her third loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she has completely paid back her previous loans. They have helped her to better support her family. Now Touch is leading her group to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. She will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion to pay for labor and land plowing. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yields and to sell them for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Isaak

texts.en:
Isaak is 48 years old.  He is married to Violah, and they are blessed with three children, aged nine, five and three years. 

Isaak is a boda boda operator (motorcycle transportation) in Nandi hills town, and he has been in business for one year.  He earns a monthly income of KES 20,800 from the business. 

This is his first loan, for KES 100,000, from KADET LTD, and he intends to use it on purchasing another motorcycle for hs business. With the anticipated profits from the business, he plans to purchase another motorcycle and use the remaining amount to pay his children's school fees. 


His hopes and dream is to become a renowned boda boda operator in his town.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his transportation business.

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha is 46 years old, a tailor in Mombasa. She is a married mother of two children in school. She has been sewing clothes for her customers for the past twenty-six years. Her business is doing great.

This is Agatha’s first business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase a new sewing machine, sewing threads, and cloth for her business.  


She will use the anticipated profits to purchase more cloth materials and repay her loan. She hopes to have a bigger, successful business.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, sewing threads and cloth for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity used her last loan to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Her business has grown and become successful. 

Now she is taking her motorcycle transport service business. She is asking for a new loan to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. Positively, she hopes to be able to grow her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Mao is a 48-year-old father of six children, five of whom (three daughters and two sons) are dependents and still in school. Cassava planting has been the only source of income for his family for ten years. The main challenge for his family’s business is the low crop yield during harvest season. Farming earns him about 26,700 KHR per day. 

Mao’s group consists of five members who live in the same village, and this is Mao's first loan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. He is leading his group to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each, and he will use his portion to buy fertilizers for his farmland and to pay for labor. He hopes to increase his crop yield so he can make a better living and keep his children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his farmland.

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita is 50 years old and a resident of Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Elioterio, a teacher.  She and Elioterio have four children.  Together with her husband and children, Nelita manages their household while operating her business.

Nelita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one packet of shampoo, PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She makes money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 13,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory and for the maintenance of her sewing machine. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Nelita hopes her business would grow into a minigrocery and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week.  It is also where she can  draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma, aged 42, is a resident of Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband, Domingo, is an electrician, and she is the mother of four children.  She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business.

Alma operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil or an egg. Alma earns an income by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 600 PHP in sales every day.

To help her to continue operating her business, Alma is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory and to pay for maintenance of her sewing machine. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Alma hopes her business will grow into a mini grocery and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to sell and to pay for maintenance of her sewing machine

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok, aged 39, is a married woman who has been living in Ornlong Veng district. She works as a local farmer, cultivating rice crops on a few lots of a farm. She particularly grows rice and beans alongside her husband during the two seasons of the years. For additional income, Sok operates a small grocery store from her home, earning an average of USD 4.00 per day to satisfy her living needs.

In this coming season, Sok is growing beans but due to the inadequate capital, she would like to receive a loan in the sum of KHK 2,000,000 to purchase pesticides and pay for labor. Also, with the rest of the funds, she will purchase grocery items such as shampoo, powders, soft drinks, and canned products to increase her merchandise.  Sok said that, with the loan's help, she will be able to make her businesses become viable and profitable for the family.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and pay for labor.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
This is Sonia, who is 46 years old and a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, in the Philippines. She is married to Joel who is a technician and a driver, and she is the mother of their children. By the grace of God, she has managed to pay for her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Sonia oversees the operation of their L300 van transportation business. They have one van that they use as a school service for some of the students in their community. She earns a minimum of 5,000 PHP weekly.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy air conditioning, a radiator and a power-steering pump. It will also be used for the maintenance of the van. She expects to have a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Sonia's dream is to be able to give her children a high quality of education through all of her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their van.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is 41 years old. She is a married mother of two. She has owned rental houses for the past 14 years and her business is doing well. 

This is Khadija’s second loan from KADET LTD. She plans to renovate her rental houses and will use the anticipated profits to build more houses for rent. She hopes to own several rental houses in Mombasa and to have a happy, settled family.

loans.use: to renovate her rental houses

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
As a married parent of 2 children, Trinidad works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Trinidad is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell in her rice business.

Trinidad has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 42 years old and married with 4 children.

Wilma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Wilma has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from renting a sound system.

Wilma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more secondhand shirts, skirts, blouses, and trousers

loans.name: Lodegario

texts.en:
Lodegario is a 39-year-old fisherman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. He is married to a teacher and they have two children aged eight and one. When he is fishing, Lodegario finds it hard to use his worn fishing nets. 

He is asking for a loan to buy a fishing net and gasoline for his boat. Once this is taken care of, he knows that this will help him to become more productive. A sturdy and new fishing net will allow him to catch more fish. Through the availability of gasoline, the loan will also ensure that Lodegario will be able to fish continuously. His income will provide his family with a healthy diet, milk and nappies for his baby, and savings.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and gasoline for his boat

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 42 years old and married with 10 children.

Brenda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Brenda has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending and raising livestock.

Brenda aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Emily runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock for her general store.

Emily has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, salt, milk, canned goods, snack foods, etc.. 

In the future, Emily would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock for her general store

loans.name: Lkhagvasuren

texts.en:
Mr. Lkhagvasuren, who is 38 years old, has a freight transportation business with his old truck. For four years he has been in this business, and he has gained experience during this time. Now he lives with his wife and his two children in the ger district (ger is a Mongolian nomadic traditional yurt) in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. 

He bought his plot of land in 2008 after his family moved in the city. Since then, he has been building his family's house. But it still is not finished yet, and there isn't enough money to cover the cost of the building materials for installing insulated windows, flooring and wall insulation. He needs cement, rock wool and foam to make them. He plans to have a well-insulated house which does not have any heat loss or emissions during the winter. In Mongolia, heat loss and emissions are big issues around the households in ger district. It is very harmful for your health and money. 

Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world.  This is due to the long and cold winters where temperatures frequently go below -40C (-40F) even in the cities.  Also, in the winter, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snow storms.  Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm.  In addition, the extremely toxic smoke from the cars is one of main reasons why Mongolia has hard air pollution. In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss, improve heating systems and buy cars that run on natural gas.  The loan Mr. Lkhagvasuren is taking will be used to buy insulation materials to build his new family home.

loans.use: To buy insulation materials to build his new family house.

loans.name: Badarmaa

texts.en: Mr. Badarmaa, 54, has worked as a tractor driver for a company since 2000. His wife works as a janitress in a clinic. In addition to her job, she makes woven clothes and sells them to shops or consumers at a low price. He has five children and most of them have moved out of their parents’ home. Now, he lives with his wife and younger children in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. This coming August, one of his daughters will move out and start her own life with her boyfriend. But first, she needs to buy an apartment with one room. Badarmaa decided to help his daughter to cover the remaining cost of purchasing her apartment. Almost all of his relatives and friends have helped him to collect money for his daughter to start her individual life. His loan will be dedicated to covering the cost of a new apartment for his daughter.

loans.use: To cover the cost of a new apartment for his daughter.

loans.name: Benjamin Sr.

texts.en:
Benjamin, aged 43, is a married man with six children aged 20, 18, 16, 15, 13 and 11. He has had a sari-sari store (a convenience store found in the Philippines) and a fishing business for 15 years. 

Benjamin sells items like canned goods, snack foods, rice, etc. He fishes while his wife attends to their sari-sari store business. Benjamin is requesting a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy fishing net and merchandise to sell like canned goods, sodas, meat, vegetables, etc. 

In the future, Benjamin aims to improve his sari-sari store and fishing business to generate more income to help meet their needs especially supporting their children's education. He dreams of seeing his children as professionals someday.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and merchandise to sell like canned goods, sodas, meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca  is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 12 children. Rebecca has been selling dried fish and sausages (longganisa and chorizo) in their local community for 12 years. 

Rebecca has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to to buy dried fish, longganisa and chorizo to sell. She  has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Rebecca hopes to improve her business to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy dried fish and sausages (longganisa and chorizo) to sell

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 42 years old and married with three children.

Estelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store.

Estelita has borrowed, and repaid, seven  loans from NWTF before this one. She has run her general store for seven years, and she also earns an income from fish vending.

Estelita aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Altanbagana

texts.en: Mr. Altanbagana, 50, has been running a taxi for a decade. It has been the main income source of his family for many years. He lives with his family in the ger district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. He runs his business with his old Korean car, which is marked “Sonata V”. Lately, it has been bad and it started to use a lot of fuel to run. In addition, he pays too much for fuel. He thinks that it is harmful for him and the environment. For the above reasons, he decided to replace his old car with a better one that runs on natural gas. Lately, Mongolians have been starting to use cars with natural gas engines for their health and for the environmental welfare. The loan he is taking will be used to cover the cost of purchasing a car that uses natural gas.

loans.use: To cover the cost of purchasing a car that uses natural gas.

loans.name: Yadamdorj

texts.en: Mr. Yadamdorj, 33, is an auto repairman and driver. Currently he works as a repairman in the auto service business. His co-workers always say, “He is a very hardworking and fair man.  And hopefully he is one of our skillful employees”. He lives with his wife and his daughter in a ger (a ger is a Mongolian traditional nomadic yurt in the ger district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia). He has been building a house for his family with his brother. It will be 5 х 7 meters and will have two rooms. As of today, the house basement and frame have been completed. Now he needs some money to cover the cost of windows and wall insulation materials for his new house.

loans.use: To purchase windows and wall insulation materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy flour for a bread-making business

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Salvacion works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling charcoal. 

Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. Salvacion is now borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase vegetables to sell in her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Duch

texts.en:
Duch, a local farmer and livestock raiser, resides in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. Duch spends six months to mainly focus on her rice farming business while she devotes the rest of time to raising livestock. From the two businesses, she can generate income to cover her daily expenses and allowances for her school-aged children. She is now 53 years old. She became a single mother of three children, one of whom helps her with an income by working in a small restaurant in the province.

She would like to borrow additional capital to purchase pigs for fattening and breeding purpose. With the remainder of the loan, she will purchase a battery for household use. With the help of these funds, Duch believes that she will be able to make improvements in her business and thereby increase her income. For her business goal, she wants to own a big farm for raising pigs and poultry in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs to raise

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James, aged 52, is married to Julia with three children aged between 18 and 13 years of age. He supports a family of six people and his wife also contributes to the family's upkeep by doing casual work in the neighborhood. 

James is a carpenter and has been in this business for 29 years, earning approximately KES 5,000 monthly. This loan of KES 40,000 is his fourth loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying his previous loans. James will use the loan to buy timber, plywood and blockboard. 

He will use the profits to buy modern machinery for his business. His hopes and dreams are that his business will grow into a big company in future.

loans.use: To purchase timber, plywood and blockboard.

loans.name: Merylyn

texts.en:
Merylyn is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Merylyn has had a business selling ready-to-wear (RTW) clothing in their local community for the past six years. 

Merylyn has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of clothes like blouses, pants and t-shirts to sell. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Merylyn hopes to improve her business to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy stocks of blouses, t-shirts and pants to sell

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Noralyn is 42 years old and is married with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. Noralyn has been running a charcoal retail business in the Philippines for the past eight years and also earns an income from a general store.

Noralyn has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She is now requesting a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell. Noralyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 47 years old and is separated with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. Edna has run a general store in the Philippines for the past five years and also earns an income from selling food.

Edna has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She is now requesting a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store. Edna aspires to build and expand her business to secure its financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Leonico

texts.en: Leonico lives in Bliss, Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He makes a living by providing transportation services, which he has done for 10 years to support the needs of his three children. Leonico earns a monthly income of 15,000 PHP from this business. For a 65-year-old father, there’s nothing more that can make him happy except to see his children successful in their studies. Without hesitation, Leonico borrows 18,300 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to repair his transport vehicle used in his business and to provide his children a better education. He became a part of GDMPC in 2011. His plan in the future is to hopefully improve his business.

loans.use: to repair his transport vehicle used in his business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
Haide is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell ready to wear (RTW) clothing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional stock of RTW to sell for her business. Haide has been in this business for two years. She earns additional income from raising livestock and direct selling of Avon products.

Haide has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of ready to wear clothes to sell

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna is married with three children. She is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. Elna is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for six years. She has requested a loan to pay for piglets, feed and vitamins.

Elna has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Elna hopes to have enough savings for her family.

loans.use: to pay for piglets, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is 56 years old, married and has three sons. All of them do different kinds of works to financially contribute to the family.

Shahnaz is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very good at her work and receives regular orders every month. She has hired three employees at her sewing center to assist her. 

Her husband is a property dealer and deals in different kinds of property.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further expansion of her business. With the loan, she will buy another sewing machine and employ a community lady to expand her business further.

She has been operating her business for many years and is confident about her business success after investing the loan.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
Hillary, aged 25, has been in farming since he was a teenager. He is married with three children and lives with his family in their rural home in Litein, South Rift, Kenya. Hillary produces tea, milk and eggs for the local market and runs his farm with the help of one farmhand.

He has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a chaff cutter at 30,000 KES and to construct a dairy cow unit at 20,000 KES. He says he hopes to raise more income and to improve his family's living standards.

Hillary says harsh weather conditions and poor market prices are the major challenges in his farming business.

loans.use: To buy a chaff cutter and construct a dairy cow unit

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is the mother of two children aged 13 and 7 years and has been actively farming for five successive years at her rural home in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya. Her farm produces coffee, maize, beans and bananas for the local market. She is a teacher by profession.

Emily has requested a loan of 30,000 KES (being her third loan after the first and second ones of 15,000 KES and 20,000 KES respectively) from Juhudi Kilimo to buy dairy goats. She says she wants to raise dairy goats because of their high nutritional milk and resistance to harsh weather conditions. Emily hopes to raise more income to pay for her children's education. She also plans to install an irrigation system on her farm to mitigate the challenge of low rainfall.

She appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's loan services which have enabled her to acquire more assets for her family.

loans.use: To buy dairy goats

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 64 years old and is married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. Magdalena has run a general store in the Philippines for the past eight years and also earns an income from apartment rental.

Magdalena has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has now requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell in her general store. Magdalena aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ma. Delia

texts.en:
Ma. Delia is 43 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Delia has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her business.

Ma. Delia has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her food-vending business

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is 24 years of age and is not yet married. He owns a retail shop which he has operated for three years earning a monthly income of  KES 14,400.

This is Timothy's second loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD after successfully repaying his first loan. He’ll use the loan to purchase sugar, maize flour and rice to sell. 

He plans to plough the anticipated profits back into his business. Timothy's dreams and hopes are that his business prospers and that he achieves his goals in life.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Chak

texts.en:
Chak is 58 years old. She is married with seven children, four of whom are already settled in marriage and live independently. Chak has spent most of her lifetime dedicated to crop husbandry. She works in this type of business along with her supportive husband, growing rice, potatoes and vegetables for sale in each harvesting season. Through her hard work, she is able to make approximately around USD 4.00 per day, which she spends on her daily food and other household expenses.

In the rainy season, Chak’s family is experiencing difficulties because their present house has decayed and was damaged by the raindrops. To solve this problem, Chak has applied for a loan of USD 600 to purchase timber, wooden boards, and zinc to renovate her house. She is very thankful for the great support from the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase timber, wooden boards, and zinc to renovate her house.

loans.name: Ma. Georgina

texts.en: Ma. Georgina is from Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City. She is 31 years old. Ma. Georgina is single. She cooks and sells daily dishes for their living. Ma. Georgina has been in her business for three years and earns 10,500 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Ma. Georgina joined GDMPC.  Ma. Georgina is requesting a loan of 12,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase food & drinks to expand her services. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase food & drinks to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 32 years old and is married. She lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamis, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Helen used her previous loan to purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business. Her business has grown and become successful. 

Now, Helen is taking out a new loan to purchase ice cream tubes and ingredients for making ice cream. She hopes to be able to further expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ice cream tubes and ingredients for making ice cream.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling jewelry in the Philippines. Miriam has been in this business for four years.

She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional jewelry to sell. In the future, Miriam would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional jewelry to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 52 years old and is married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. Norma has run a general store in the Philippines for the past three years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. Norma is now requesting a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's financial stability.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jwan

texts.en:
Jwan is a 49-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and she is raising one child. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Jwan is one of the many Iraqi women who work from home using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

She has five years experience with the little business, which she is continuously working to improve. In the past, she took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq, which she used to purchase a new over lock machine and some nice, quality fabric. Having successfully repaid the loan, she is now taking a new loan to make further improvements. With the loan in the amount of 1,800 USD, she would like to purchase a small generator to allow her to work even during the hours of the day when the city power is out, renew her work area, and buy some nice quality fabrics, raw materials and an iron.

loans.use: to purchase a small generator, renew her work area, and buy some nice quality fabrics and raw materials.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase an overlock machine and an iron with an iron stand

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa works hard to support her family. She is single and has had a restaurant business in the Philippines for the past four years.

Rosa has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant business. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's financial stability.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her restaurant business

loans.name: Neddie

texts.en:
Neddie is 37 years old and lives in Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one child. 

Neddie has a store that sells a variety of products such as soft drinks, cooking oils, bread, biscuits, candies, and many other items. She has had this business for four (4) years. She requested l0,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Neddie has been a member of PMPC for three years.  In the future, Neddie hopes to own a house & lot someday.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a farmer in Murang’a Central Kenya and is married with three children aged 12, 10 and 5 years old. He has been in farming for 20 years and currently sells his farm produce of milk and coffee to the local markets.

John has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable him to construct a dairy unit for raising a number of dairy cows. He notes that the farming business is generally good though not without the challenge of fluctuation of milk prices in the local market. He hopes to be able to meet his family's daily needs from the improved dairy business.

John adds that Juhudi Kilimo loans have improved smallholder farmers' living standards.

loans.use: To construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Chona

texts.en: Chona is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Chona is married and has two children. To make a living, Chona owns and operates a motorcycle transport service. Chona has been engaged in her business for eight years and earns 12,600 PHP a month from these activities. Chona is requesting a loan of 30,600 PHP, which will be used to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. In 2010, Chona joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Kholikboy

texts.en: A man who has the best qualities of people is named Kholikboy and he lives in a very beautiful and sunny country. The citizens are very kind and glorious. Kholikboy is happy that he lives among such good people. The place where he lives is very good for agriculture business, which is why he has been busy with this kind of business for over 20 years. He grows vegetables and different kinds of corn and sells it to the local people. His sons help Kholikboy in the business. Kholikboy’s wife died seven years ago. He wants to develop his business but he has not enough money to buy mineral fertilizers for the land where he works. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers. He waits for your help. Kholikboy needs your help.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Sonia Edilma

texts.es:
Sonia se encuentra casada y tiene 2 hijos a quienes siempre les ha querido brindar una educación de buena calidad, por esto al ver que los ingresos de su esposo no eran suficientes para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar, decidió iniciar su propio negocio con el cual pudiera contribuir económicamente para tener una mejor calidad de vida en su hogar y una mejor estabilidad económica. Hace año y medio aproximadamente que vende productos de uso personal donde sus clientes son principalmente vecinos y conocidos del sector y gracias a que sus productos son de muy buena calidad ha logrado captar cada vez más clientes para su negocio aumentando sus ventas considerablemente. Debido a que no cuenta con mucho capital disponible no ha podido responder a los pedidos que han hecho sus clientes, por esto busca un préstamo que le permita comprar productos de uso personal para responder a los pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes.

De esta manera seguirá brindando un buen servicio a sus clientes y su negocio le seguirá brindando los ingresos necesarios para que en su hogar sigan teniendo la oportunidad de tener una buena estabilidad económica y sus 2 hijos puedan tener acceso a una educación de buena calidad.
texts.en:
Sonia is married and has 2 children who she has always wanted to provide with a good education. So, when she saw that her husband’s income wasn’t enough to cover the household expenses, she decided to start her own business so she could contribute economically toward having a better quality of life in her home and greater economic stability. For one-and-a-half years she has been selling personal use products and her customers are mainly neighbors and acquaintances from her neighborhood. Since her products are of very good quality, she has gotten more and more customers for her business and grown her business considerably. Because she doesn’t have much capital available, she hasn’t been able to respond to requests her customers have made. This is why she is seeking a loan that will allow her to buy personal use products so she can respond to the requests that her clients have made.

In this way, she will continue providing good service to her customers and her business will continue earning the income that is necessary for her family to have an opportunity at economic stability, and so her 2 children can have access to a good, quality education.

loans.use: to buy personal products to respond to requests her customers have made.

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en: As a 37-year-old mother of six kids living in Ek Phnom district, Sopheap grows rice and beans as the main source of income. Her husband is not only a helper with the family's businesses, but also a fisherman in order to supplement the household's income. They have been with these businesses for 25 years. However, the lack of a water supply remains the main challenge for her current businesses. This is the fifth loan for Sopheap with KIVA's partner, VisionFund. The past four loans have made her a better living and she can earn about 62,000 KHR per day.In a confident manner. She formed a group loan with three other members to apply for a new loan with VisionFund. One member is a third loan client while the other two are new clients. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and a machine for her small boat for fishing. She hopes to grow healthy rice so that she can earn more income to keep improving her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for farming and a machine for her small boat for fishing

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
This is Milagros, 57, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Tranqilino who assists her with the business. She is a mother to their children. Together they work hard for a safe and secure future for their family.

Milagros operates a piggery. She earns by selling live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes they have the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 4,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP12,000 loan. She will using the loan to buy feed and additional hogs. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Milagros hopes that her business will expand and that she will have more workers that she will manage. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more pig feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry and construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Saroun

texts.en:
Saroun (in the photo), age 41, lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh. She is a widow and a mother with one daughter who is a garment worker. 

Saroun runs a small grocery store at home. She is asking for a loan of $600 to renovate the house where she lives.

loans.use: To renovate the house where she lives.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 48 years old and a charcoal dealer in Mikindani, Mombasa. She is a married mother of three school children. She buys and sells charcoal to the residents of Mikindani, a business she has done for the past three years. She is doing great.

This is her first borrowing from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more sacks of charcoal with the loan. 

She will use the proceeds to educate her children and repay her loan. She hopes to have a more profitable business

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is married with 12 children. Perlita is 59 years old and lives in Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental.

Perlita sells a variety of snacks to earn a living and has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase flour, sugar, milk and other ingredients.

Perlita has been a member of PMPC for 11 years. In the future, Perlita hopes to have more savings for house improvements.

loans.use: To purchase flour, cooking oil, milk, and sugar

location.town: Plaridel-Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occide

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon is married with 3 children. He is 53 years old and lives in Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay.

Ramon sells rice and corn to earn a living and has had this business for 20 years. Each month, he earns 200,000 PHP doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase sacks of rice and corn to sell retail.

Ramon has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice and corn to sell retail

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Married with five children, Christina lives in a two-room apartment with her family in  Ntamulung quarters of Mankon, Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon. She joined GHAPE in 2007.

It has really been difficult for her and the family; thus the reason why she joined the program. She has faced the problem of inadequate capital to start a business and low income to sustain the family, with an inability to provide good clothing, a balanced diet, proper education and health care. Because of the above problems she hopes and wishes to receive this loan amount to improve the family situation. She prefers this loan because of the convenient prepayment period, low interest and business/life skill education provided by GHAPE.

She intends to buy three bags of rice, groundnuts, oil, beans, cartons of soap, and two tons of fuel wood and invest the rest in farming. This loan use will serve the community in that it will assist so many people so that they will have goods available on short notice to the community as well as cosmetics products. The profits of this loan will be used to improve the standard of living within her family as better education, health care and nutrition will be offered to them. The rest will be ploughed back into the medicine/cosmetics store.

loans.use: to pay for bags of rice, groundnuts, oil, beans, cartons of soap, and two tons of fuel wood

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a married woman with six young children. She is 41 years old and has been involved in a convenience store business for almost five years now. Luisa sells items like bread and other snack food to the people in her community. This business provides her the income she needs to support her husband in meeting the daily needs of the family and paying the school fees of their children. 

Luisa is requesting a loan of 8000 PHP in order to buy more items to sell, such as rice, bread, canned goods and sodas, among others. She believes that this financial support will enable her to increase her business and eventually provide her a greater income. She wants to augment the stock she has in her business to attract more customers in her locality. 

In the future, Luisa hopes to reinvest in this business and to venture into a more lucrative business. Most importantly, she wants to continually send her children to school so that they will be able to be more successful in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock, such as rice, bread, canned goods and sodas, to sell

loans.name: Lena

texts.en:
Lena is 56 years old and lives in Canal, Siquijor, Siquijor. She is married and has two adult children. To earn a living, Lena has a business selling food inside the school campus. She earns PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of work. Lena has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her  food vending business.

Lena has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for more than one year. In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Than

texts.en:
Than is 44 years old, and her husband, Siphon, is 46 years old. They live in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1990 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. One child is married and lives separately, another is a garment worker, and the other two attend school. 

Than and her husband are rice farmers. She is applying for her first loan in the amount of $500 to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.   

Photo: Than is pictured at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: Jeanne Mahutin

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de trois enfants scolarisés dont le plus âgé a 15 ans et le moins âgé a 06ans, Jeanne Mahutin vend du sable marin depuis plusieurs années. Jeanne Mahutin s'approvisionne dans les lagunes de sa région et sa clientèle large et diversifiée est composée surtout des grands entrepreneurs en bâtiments. Jeanne Mahutin avec ses économies veut participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et épargner. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une grande carrière de sable afin d'aider son mari pour la construction de leur maison.
texts.en:
Jeanne Mahutin is married and mother of three children between the ages of 6 and 15. All of her children attend school. Jeanne Mahutin has been selling sea sand for several years now.

Jeanne Mahutin stocks up at the lagoons in her region, and her large and diverse clientele is mostly made up of big construction entrepreneurs.

With the money that she earns, Jeanne Mahutin wants to help pay for the education of her children, and build up her savings. She wants to open a large sand quarry in order to help her husband construct their house.

loans.use: to buy 10 trips worth of sand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, oil, noodles, shampoo, milk, condiments, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Cesar Esneider

texts.es:
Cesar se encuentra casado y tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 8 años de edad a quienes siempre les ha querido brindar una buena educación, y para generar los ingresos que se requieren en su hogar trabaja como aserrador desde hace aproximadamente 8 años cuando comenzó junto a un amigo trabajando. Gracias a la experiencia que ha adquirido hoy lo contratan de varios municipios para realizar su trabajo y esto le ha permitido tener en su hogar unos buenos ingresos para tener una estabilidad económica. Debido a que no cuenta con mucho capital disponible siempre alquila la sierra con la que realiza su trabajo, pero por esto le están cobrando una gran cantidad de dinero que hace que sus ingresos se vean considerablemente reducidos, por esto busca un préstamo que le permita comprar una sierra y así no tenga que arrendarla, de modo que sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente.

De esta manera su familia tendrá la oportunidad de acceder a mejores ingresos y por ende a una mejor calidad de vida. Su mayor sueño es expandir su negocio a más municipios y así tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar is married and has two children, ages six and eight, for whom he has always wanted to provide a good education.  To generate enough income for his household he has been sawing timber for around eight years, which he started doing with a friend of his.  Thanks to his expertise, now he is hired by many municipalities which has allowed him to earn a good income for economic stability.  Since he does not have much working capital, he rents the saw he uses for work; but because of the high rental fee he pays, his income is considerably reduced.  So he is seeking a loan to buy a saw and not have to rent one, which will increase his income.

This means he can give his family a better lifestyloe.  His goal is to expand his business into other municipalities to increase the family income even more.

loans.use: To buy a saw and not have to rent one, to increase income considerably.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es: Bernardo de 50 años, vive con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 18 a 25 años, en la hermosa ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, lugar ubicado a orillas del Mar Caribe,  uno de los sitios turísticos mas hermosos de Colombia y muy reconocido, pues   tiene una de las principales bases navales del país y  por su patrimonio histórico-artístico, que abarca de vestigios de época cartaginesa, romana, bizantina, edificaciones de carácter militar de época moderna y contemporánea, así como también edificios neoclásicos y modernistas. Este lugar es el escenario donde modestamente habita y tiene su negocio Bernardo y donde ofrece el servicio de alquiler de maquinas para lavar; actividad que inició, después de ver el esfuerzo que hacían las amas de casa, cuando de lavar se trataba, pues en bateas y con un bate en mano golpeaban las prendas de vestir, para soltar el mugre de cada prenda de vestir, bajo el incesante sol del Caribe, haciendo mas difícil la dura tarea. Así fue como comprando su primera lavadora, descargó un poco a su cónyuge de este quehacer y poco a poco fue comprando maquina a maquina, para alquilarla entre sus vecinas. Bernardo también se dedica a la albañilería, oficio que le  que significa otro ingreso para su hogar, para el cual quiere lograr cada vez un mayor bienestar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financieminto que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará 2 lavadoras más y también mejorará las condiciones de su vivienda,  ubicando barandas a su escalera y tubos metálicos a su balcón. Con esta inversión ampliará un poco más sus ingresos y tendrá condiciones de seguridad en la vivienda donde habita, lo cual le da más tranquilidad y la garantía de ofrecer un servicio de calidad e imagen en su negocio y a su familia.
texts.en:
Bernardo, 50, lives with his wife and three children, ages 18 to 25, in the beautiful city of Cartagena de Indias, on the Caribbean coast, one of the most beautiful tourist areas in Colombia.  It is well-known for having one of the main naval bases of the country, and for its historic-artistic heritage that ranges over the Carthaginian, Roman, and Byzantine eras, with military buildings both modern and contemporary, as well as neoclassic and modernist.   This is where Bernardo lives modestly and runs a business renting washing machines.  He started the business to help housewives who were using a baseball bat to beat the clothing to get it clean, working under the hot sun of the Caribbean, making it even more difficult.  So he bought his first washing machine and helped his wife with this chore, and little by little he bought even more machines to rent to his neighbors.

Bernardo is also a bricklayer, brining in extra income to put toward his goal of living a better lifestyle.  He is requesting a CrediKiva loan, his first through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, so he can buy two washing machines and also renovate his house by installing a banister along the stairway and putting up metal railing on the balcony.  With this investment he will be able to increase his income somewhat and give his home the safety it requires, giving him tranquility and the guarantee of offering quality service and corporate image in his business, also beneficial for the family.

loans.use: To buy two washing machines and renovate his house.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario de 41 años de edad viven en casa propia con su esposo y dos hijos desde hace 15 años se a dedicado a la producción de café ya que su padre le heredo las fincas que hasta el día de hoy cultiva junto con su esposo ya que sus hijos solo los ayudaron mientras estaban pequeños porque al crecer se dedicaron a la escuela y por ahora están terminando una carrera universitaria. Rosario es productora de café orgánico ya que le interesa mucho conservar el medio ambiente y no contaminar con fertilizantes químicos por lo cual su meta como productora es crear un invernadero para la producción de plantas de café e involucrar a su familia en tal proyecto para lograr tal meta ella pide un crédito para la compra de planta para reforestar su parcela y para la compra de fertilizantes orgánicos para con ello aumentar su producción  por cosecha. Rosario espera cumplir en un 80 % sus metas con el crédito ya que sabe que si es bien invertido le dejara buenos resultados reflejándose en el aumento en su economía y con ello el cumplimiento de su meta que es la realización de un invernadero para también ser productora de plantas de café.
texts.en:
Rosario, 41, lives in her own house with her husband and two children.  For 15 years she has been growing coffee, since her father inherited the plantation where she and her husband work.  Their children helped out when they were young but now they are finishing their university education.

Rosario produces organic coffee because she is very concerned about the environment and the use of chemical fertilizers, which she avoids so as not to contaminate.  Her goal as a producer is to create a plant nursery to grow coffee plants and include her entire family in the project.  To achieve her goal she is requesting a loan to buy plants for her land and to buy organic fertilizers to increase her production at harvest time.  Rosario hopes to meet at least 80% of her goal with the loan, because she knows if it is invested well it will give her a good profit and increase her economy.  Then she will be able to set up the nursery for her coffee plant production.

loans.use: To hire workers and buy new plants.

loans.name: Rnald

texts.es: Ronald de 30 años, vive con su cónyuge y su hijo  de 3 años de edad , en la hermosa ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, lugar ubicado a orillas del Mar Caribe,  uno de los sitios turísticos mas hermosos de Colombia y muy reconocido, pues   tiene una de las principales bases navales del país y  por su patrimonio histórico-artístico, que abarca de vestigios de época cartaginesa, romana, bizantina, edificaciones de carácter militar de época moderna y contemporánea, así como también edificios neoclásicos y modernistas. Allí en este fantástico lugar, tiene su modesto taller donde realiza mantenimientos preventivos y reparación de motocicletas; negocio con el cual genera el sustento de su familia y también los ingresos de dos empleados, que de esta actividad se derivan. Sus principales clientes son los moto taxistas y trabajadores de empresas,  que utilizan la motocicleta como  su medio de producción de ingresos, a quienes les realiza el servicio de mantenimiento y reparación   de contado. En su taller Ronald cuenta con el equipamiento necesario, para realizar con calidad este oficio. Su meta es tener un almacén de repuestos, donde sus clientes puedan adquirir lo que requieran para que sus vehículos estén en buen estado y  su principal desafío es no tener el capital de trabajo suficiente,  para responder de manera inmediata a esta meta. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual,  Ronald acude a un credikiva, mediante el que comprará una vitrina, aceite, grasa, neumáticos y repuestos en general, inversión que proyecta ser exitosa,  porque genera posibilidad de responde a la demanda,  en tanto a que sus clientes deben ir a otros lugares no muy cercanos, en la búsqueda de los repuestos para que su vehiculo esté en perfectas condiciones y como dicen en la Costa “Como una Uva” .
texts.en:
Ronald, 30, lives with his wife and 3-year-old son in the beautiful city of Cartagena de Indias, on the Caribbean coast, one of the most beautiful tourist areas in Colombia. It is well-known for having one of the main naval bases of the country, and for its historic-artistic heritage that ranges over the Carthaginian, Roman, and Byzantine eras, with military buildings both modern and contemporary, as well as neoclassic and modernist.  In this fantastic place, he has a modest repair shop where he maintains and repairs motorcycles.  Through his business he earns enough to support his family and also pays two hired workers.  His main customers are motorcycle-taxis and workers who use a motorcycle for their job.

In his workshop, Ronald has the necessary equipment to carry out his trade with quality.  His goal is to have a spare parts warehouse where his customers can buy what they need to keep their vehicles in good condition.  His main challenge is not having enough working capital to respond to his immediate needs toward that goal.  This is why Ronald is requesting a CrediKiva loan, so he can buy a display case, oil, grease, tires and spare parts in general.  He believes the investment will be successful because it will allow him to meet the demand and keep his customers from having to go elsewhere to buy parts to keep their vehicles in perfect running order, or as they say on the coast, "Como una Uva"  (to be in shape).

loans.use: To buy a display case, oil, grease, tires and spare parts.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin has been in farming for nine years in his rural home in Nkubu, Central Kenya. He is aged 34 and married with two children aged 10 and two years. His farm produces maize, beans and poultry for the local market. He runs a small retail shop for additional income.

Martin has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to set up an irrigation system on his farm by buying a water tank and irrigation pipes. He says this will mitigate the challenge of inadequate rains and improve his income so he can meet his family needs with the core one being to educate the children. He also plans to buy more acres of land.

Martin appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's loan services.

loans.use: To buy a water tank and irrigation pipes.

loans.name: Osmar Daniel

texts.es: Osmar Daniel, este emprendedor tiene por actividad económica una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion  Osmar es un hombre trabajador, luchador, honrado, con ganas de superación, el inicio con esta herramienta de trabajo para poder sacar a su familia adelante, por la falta de empleo fijo. El financiamiento lo quiere para invertir en el negocio y brindar mejor  servicios a sus clientes y comprar productos de consumo del hogar: aceite, arroz, papel sanico, jabon, detergente,frijoles, hielo, huevo,entre otros.lo cual ha podido sacar adelante gracias al apoyo que leon 2000 y programa kiva que le brinda apoyo al los pequeños negociannte para invertir en sus negocios.
