Taria is has been in farming for over 30 years in her rural home in Kitale, Western Kenya, where she lives with her  husband and three adult children. Her farm produces milk, maize, and beans for the local market. She reiterates she fully depends on farming income for her family upkeep.

Taria has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says this will boost her income to adequately meet the family's needs. She also plans to improve the quality of her breeds in future.

Taria says the major challenge is that of feed, which is quite expensive, especially during dry seasons.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo comenzó trabajando como cortador de café en las fincas de su padre y algunas veces trabajaba para otras personas, con el tiempo fue aprendiendo también a preparar la tierra y a sembrar. Desde hace ya 10 años el se independizó y comenzó a producir su propio café junto con su esposa y sus hijos. Actualmente el es socio de la "Unión Regional de Huatusco" y es allí donde entrega toda su producción de café para que posteriormente sea procesada y exportada. Para la siguiente cosecha él necesita comprar abono para sus plantas y por eso está solicitando un crédito. Pablo y su familia están ahorrando dinero porque tienen planeado comprar en unos meses un terreno el cual les servirá para sembrar más café y así aumentar su producción. Además de dedicarse a producir café, Pablo también es un productor de caña ya que la zona en la que vive también cuenta con las condiciones necesarias para producir este cultivo. Una de las mayores preocupaciones que tienen Pablo y su esposa es la de poder mandar a sus hijos a estudiar una carrera universitaria y saben que si en este momento invierten en sus cultivos de café y caña dentro de unos años tendrán el recurso suficiente para brindarles a sus hijos la oportunidad de una buena educación.
texts.en:
Pablo started working as a coffee cutter on his father’s farms, and sometimes he worked for other people.  In time he was also learning to prepare the land and to plant.  Ten years ago he became independent and started to produce his own coffee with his wife and their children.

He is currently a member of the “Union Regional de Huatusco” [coffee cooperative].  This is where he delivers his entire coffee production to later be processed and exported.

For the next crop he needs to buy fertilizer for his plants, and that is why he is requesting a loan.  Pablo and his family are saving money because in a few months they are planning to buy land to plant more coffee and increase their production.

In addition to producing coffee, Pablo also produces sugarcane.  The area where he lives also has the conditions needed to produce this crop.

One of the biggest concerns that Pablo and his wife have is to be able to send their children to the university.  They know that if they now invest in the coffee and sugarcane crops that in a few years they will have enough resources to provide their children with the opportunity of a good education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee farm.

loans.name: Melida

texts.es: Melida de 44 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 6 a 24 años en la ciudad de Cartagena, lugar ubicado a orillas del Mar Caribe, uno de los sitios turísticos mas hermosos de Colombia y muy reconocido, pues   tiene una de las principales bases navales del país y  por su patrimonio histórico-artístico, que abarca de vestigios de época cartaginesa, romana, bizantina, edificaciones de carácter militar de época moderna y contemporánea, así como también edificios neoclásicos y modernistas. Allí en este fantástico lugar y de manera modesta tiene su tienda de abarrotes, refrescos, bebidas, ranchos, víveres y enlatados. Adicionalmente en su negocio ha incluido útiles de papelería, cosméticos, accesorios femeninos y otras mercancías de muy buena rotación, que complementan el  grueso de sus ventas al detalle, aumentan sus ingresos y ayudan a rotar frecuentemente su capital.  Cuando Melida  decidió desarrollar su idea emprendedora e independiente, lo hizo después de una experiencia que tuvo con su esposo, en una empresa donde vendían cueros y una vez quedaron desempleados, decidieron aprovechar el útil conocimiento de las estrategias de ventas, para emprender su propia aventura de negocio y generar sus propios empleos independientes. Así fue como empezó la tienda, pues esta pareja,  deseaba gestionar ingresos suficientes, que beneficiaran a su familia,  primero vendiendo unos  pocos productos y adicionando cada vez mas otros nuevos,  hasta lograr diversificar  como hasta hoy lo han logrado, porque también ofrecen mercancía a través de guías especializadas, especialmente productos de belleza. Su mayor desafío es no tener un capital de trabajo suficiente, para implementar una estrategia mercadológica, que le permita impactar con precios, promociones y productos, que sus clientes piden constantemente y muchas veces su negocio no soporta esta rotación, dejando insatisfechos a otros. Esta es la razón por la cual acuden a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprarán víveres, abarrotes, cárnicos, enlatados, lácteos y productos de belleza que ofrece su revista con descuentos especiales. Con esta inversión planea aumentar sus ingresos, ofreciendo a buenos precios de productos, resultado del traslado de los precios de oportunidad con el que Melida accede al mercado al comprarle en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Melida, 44, lives with her husband and four children whose ages range from 6 to 24 years in the city of Cartagena, located on the shores of the Caribbean Sea, one of Colombia’s best-known tourist sites because it has one of the country’s main naval bases and its historical-artistic heritage encompasses Carthaginian, Roman and Byzantine military styles from both modern and contemporary ages as well as neo-classical and modern buildings.

In that fantastic place in a modest way she runs her grocery, soft-drinks, beverage, snacks, foodstuffs and canned goods store.  She also sells stationery supplies, cosmetics and women’s accessories as well as other merchandise that sells well and complements the main products she retails increasing her income and helping her capital to turnover frequently.

When Melida decided to develop her enterprising, independent idea she did it after an experience she had with her husband.  They lost the jobs they had at a leather processing firm and decided to apply the useful skills they had in sales to start their own business venture and generate their own independent employment.  This is how the store started out because this couple wanted to generate sufficient income to benefit their family.

At first they sold just a few products adding more new ones every time until they attained the diversity they now have because they also offer merchandise via catalogue especially beauty products.  Her greatest challenge is not having sufficient capital to implement a marketing strategy that will allow her to impress with her prices, special promotions and products her customers constantly request and often are unavailable in stock thus leaving some demand unmet.

This is the reason why they are calling on a Kiva loan, the first financing they get from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo through which they will buy foodstuffs, groceries, meats, canned goods, dairy products and beauty products that are on special in her catalogue.  With this investment she plans to increase income offering products at good prices resulting from her passing down to her customers the special prices Melida gets by being able to buy in quantity.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Mzevinar

texts.en:
Mzevinar is 47 years old. She lives in a small village of Lanchkhuti District with her husband, Avtandil. They earn their living through agriculture. They have 18 beehives with bee colonies. They produce honey and sell it in nearby villages. Mzevinar and Avtandil also have a citrus garden and a plot of land where they grow maize and nuts. They work hard on their plot during the spring and summer seasons to get a good harvest. They sell their harvested products in the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 500 Lari.

Mzevinar requested a loan to purchase feed for the bees. Mzevinar and Avtandil will be able to produce and sell more honey. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income they will be able to reinvest in the family agricultural business in order to expand it and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her bees

loans.name: Libia Ines

texts.es:
Libia se encuentra casada y tiene 9 hijos a quienes siempre les ha querido brindar una buena calidad de vida y para esto tiene un negocio con el cual genera los ingresos para su hogar y contribuye económicamente junto con su esposo para que en su familia puedan tener una buena calidad de vida. Desde hace aproximadamente 25 años se vio desplazada por la violencia junto con su esposo y sus hijos en búsqueda de mejores oportunidades económicas para salir adelante y mayor seguridad para vivir más tranquilamente, y fue vendiendo gaseosas y dulces como comenzó con su propio negocio. Gracias al esfuerzo que ha puesto en su negocio logró salir adelante y cada vez aumentar más sus ventas, hasta el punto en que logró abrir otro local para vender bebidas y dulces el cual administra su esposo. Con su negocio ha podido brindarles educación a sus hijos y aún puede brindar educación a sus hijos menores, por esto siempre cuida de este y busca que cada vez sus ventas aumenten para tener una mejor calidad de vida. Libia busca un préstamo que le permita acceder a la compra de bebidas y otros productos para surtir su tienda y responder a la demanda de sus clientes.

De esta manera seguirá satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes y sus ventas aumentarán considerablemente, permitiendo tener mejores ingresos para su hogar y así tener una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar y salir adelante. Su mayor sueño es ver a todos sus hijos salir adelante y lograr darles una estabilidad económica con su negocio.
texts.en:
Libia is married and has 9 children, for whom she has always wanted to provide a good quality of life. For this she has a business by which income for her home is generated. Along with her husband she contributes economically so in her family they can have a good quality of life.  Approximately 25 years ago, she was displaced by violence along with her husband and their children. In search of better economic opportunities to get ahead and more security to live more tranquilly, she started selling soft drinks and candies and began her own business.  Thanks to the effort that she has put in her business, she was able to get ahead and increase her sales more each time, until the point in which she was able to open another location to sell drinks and sweets, which her husband manages.

With her business she has been able to provide education to her children and she can even provide education for her youngest children.  For this she always looks after her business and strives for her sales to increase each time to have a better quality of life.  Libia is looking for a loan that will allow her to buy drinks and other products to supply her store and respond to the demand of her customers.

In this way she will continue satisfying the needs of her customers and her sales will increase considerably, allowing her to have a better income for her home and like this have a better quality of life and better economic opportunities to progress and get ahead.  Her greatest dream is to see all of her children get ahead and to achieve giving them economic stability with her business.

loans.use: to buy drinks and other products to supply her store and respond to the demand of her customers.

loans.name: Francia

texts.es: Francia  con su credikiva anterior, compró insumos y materiales con los que fabricó bolsos, hamacas y hasta le alcanzó su dinero, para comprar una vitrina. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará hilos y fabricará nuevas hamacas y bolsos,  aprovechando que muy pronto llega la época de vacaciones y sus clientes  al pasa para Cartagena, le compran las tradicionales artesanías de San Jacinto, producto de las manos de mujeres fieles a su tradición. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “ Estoy muy agradecida con los préstamos y espero que me sigan apoyando para poder cumplir con el sueño de tener un local con amplia variedad de artesanías y vender mucho mas. “
texts.en:
Francia used her previous Kiva loan to buy supplies and materials she used to manufacture purses, hammocks and still had enough money to buy a display case.  She’s currently applying for a new Kiva loan she’ll use to buy thread to make new hammocks and purses taking advantage of the soon to arrive vacation season when customers on their way to Cartagena buy traditional San Jacinto crafts from her, products from the hands of women who preserve their traditions.

Her message to Kiva lenders is the following: “I am very grateful for the loans and I hope you will continue supporting me so that I can reach my dream of having a well-stocked crafts store and to sell much more.”

loans.use: to buy thread.

loans.name: Mayrlim

texts.es: Myrlim de 26 años de edad años de edad , vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 10 meses en la ciudad de Cartagena, lugar ubicado a orillas del Mar Caribe, uno de los sitios turísticos mas hermosos de Colombia y muy reconocido, pues   tiene una de las principales bases navales del país y  por su patrimonio histórico-artístico, que abarca de vestigios de época cartaginesa, romana, bizantina, edificaciones de carácter militar de época moderna y contemporánea, así como también edificios neoclásicos y modernistas. Allí en este fantástico lugar y de manera modesta tiene sus dos  negocios uno de distribución de mercancía variada, como pantalones jeans y con el otro complementa sus ingresos, elaborando productos derivados de la harina de trigo o congelados, como empanadas, deditos de queso entre otros. Ella estudiaba educación infantil y cuando se organizó en familia y esperaba su primer hijo, debió retirarse de la universidad  y buscar una forma de generar ingresos, así fue como empezó su actividad de negociante de mercancía y aprovechó el saber de su suegra, quien la enseño a prepara congelados,  para apoyar el bienestar de su reciente hogar. Las mercancías variadas las venden a crédito y las ofrece a su clientela mediante guías especializadas de productos, pues se afilió a una empresa que le proporciona esta forma de hacer negocio y los deditos empanaditas y otros congelados los hace por encargos mediante una preventa a casa de eventos, familiares, vecinos y referidos de sus clientes. Su meta mas adelante,  es aumentar sus ingresos suficientemente para lograr adquirir su propia casa y planearle un futuro prometedor a su hijo. En la actualidad su capital de trabajo es su mayor desafío, porque debe esperar recoger el dinero de los créditos otorgados a sus clientes, para volver a comprar, mientras sus clientes necesitan una respuesta inmediata para volver a solicitarle los productos. Esta es la razón por la cual está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará mercanicas variadas y  harina de trigo en mayor volumen  ya que debe responder a pedidos de congelados de manera oportuna para poder crecer y esto es justamente lo que logrará con su credikiva.
texts.en:
Mayrlim, 26, lives with her spouse and ten-month-old son in the city of Cartagena, located on the shores of the Caribbean Sea, one of Colombia’s best-known tourist sites because it has one of the country’s main naval bases and its historical-artistic heritage encompasses Carthaginian, Roman and Byzantine military styles from both modern and contemporary ages as well as neo-classical and modern buildings.

There in that fantastic place in a modest way she has her two businesses.  One is selling assorted merchandise like jeans and the other one produces extra income.  In the latter she makes items from wheat flour or frozen treats like turnovers and cheese pastries, among others.

She was studying to be a nursery school teacher but when she formed her family and was expecting her first child she had to drop out of the university and find a way to generate income which is how she became a merchant.  She availed herself of her mother-in-law’s skills who taught her to make frozen treats in order to help support her new home’s wellbeing.  She sells the various merchandises on credit and offers them to her customers via specialized product catalogues since she became affiliated with a firm that makes it possible for her to be part of this type of business.  The baked goods and frozen treats she does based on prior orders at events sites, from family members, neighbors or referred customers.

Her goal for later on is to significantly increase her income in order to buy a house of her own and plan a promising future for her son.  Currently, her greatest challenge is working capital because in order to buy more she has to wait to collect payment from her credit customers and her other customers need immediate response to their requests if they are going to reorder from her.  

This is why she’s applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy varied merchandise and wheat flour in large amounts so that she can respond to orders for frozen treats in an opportune way in order to grow which we at the Fundación think is precisely what she’ll accomplish with her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy assorted merchandise and wheat flour.

loans.name: Lucia Wilma

texts.es: La Sra. Lucia tiene 28 años y es casada con 1 hijo de la edad de cinco años, se dedica  a la  venta de leche ya que tiene ganado vacuno, ella vive en la zona de Coqueni, es cliente antigua  de la institución,  Lucia utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de forraje para su ganado,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es no tiene dinero y necesita alimentar bien a su ganado para que le proporcione buena cantidad de leche y así de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos económicos, el dinero lo utilizara en la compra de chala para sus vacas,  Lucia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el forraje que debe comprar cada cierto tiempo, y  utilizara los beneficios mejorar su ganado,  sueña comprar otras vacas lecheras.
texts.en:
Lucia, 28, is married and has a five-year-old son.  She sells milk since she has dairy cows.  She lives in the Coqueni zone and is a longstanding client of the institution.

Lucia will use this loan to buy forage for her cattle.  The reason for requesting the loan is that she does not have any money and she needs to feed her cows well so that they will produce good amounts of milk and she can improve her income this way.

She will use the money to buy corn husks for her cows.  The business challenge Lucia faces is that she has to buy forage every so often and she’ll use profits to improve her cattle.  She dreams with buying more dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy corn husks for her cows.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José es un hombre pensionado desde hace algún tiempo y su esposa se dedica al hogar y vive con  ellos un hijo que los apoya con un porcentaje de los gastos familiares. En la casa tiene viviendo mas de veinte años, por lo que ya requiere cambiar el cableado de la electricidad y teme le vaya a quemar algún aparato o consumir mucha energía, por lo que necesita llevar a cabo este proyecto. Nos gusta ayudar a personas que cuidan la integridad familiar y este señor de esta manera lo esta haciendo al cuidar que la luz eléctrica que es indispensable en el diario vivir de toda familia.
texts.en:
José has been retired for some time now and his wife’s a housewife.  A son lives with them and helps with a certain percent of family expenses.  He’s been living in his house for more than twenty years so he needs to rewire it because he’s afraid some appliance might burn or use too much electricity which is why he needs to carry out this project.  

We at Credituyo like to help people who safeguard family integrity and this man is doing so by taking care of electricity which is indispensable for the entire family’s daily living.

loans.use: to rewire his house.

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Antoinette is married to a tailor and has six children. All of her children attend schools. She has spent eleven years in rice production. 

She has requested a Kiva loan to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, Antoinette plans to pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and support labor costs.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is a mother of three children aged between ten and seven years and has been in active farming for three years in her rural home. Her farm produces fruits, eggs, beans, and maize for the local market.

Serah has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy more poultry. She says this will boost her farming income, which she will use to venture into dairy farming. She is optimistic the numbers in her flock will enable her to enjoy the economies of scale.

Serah, however, says poultry diseases and costly feeds are the major challenges in the business.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Jubana

texts.es: Jubana es socia del Bancomunal Abejitas Trabajadoras y tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera de 1 hijo. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 2 años y  tiene un negocio de venta de carne. En todo este tiempo como socia de FINCA Perú y con ayuda a las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal  logró mejoras en su negocio y con su hijo, le gustan mucho las capacitaciones por que le enseñan a ahorrar y administrar su dinero de manera adecuada y también le gusta las campañas de salud que le brinda FINCA Perú donde ella se da un tiempo para ver cómo está su salud. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ganado para luego vender su carne.
texts.en:
Jubana’s a member of the “Abejitas Trabajadoras” (Little Worker Bees) communal bank.  She’s 28-years-old and a single mother of one son.  She’s been a member of FINCA Perú for two years and her business is selling meat.  

In all the time she’s been a member of FINCA Perú and with the training she gets in her communal bank she attained improvements with her business and with her son.  She likes the training sessions very much because they teach her to save and manage her money adequately; she also likes the health screenings FINCA Perú conducts where she takes a little time to see how her health is doing.

The loan she’s requesting will be used to buy cattle to then sell the meat.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina es socia del Bancomunal Abejitas Trabajadoras,  tiene 68 años de edad y es madre soltera de tres hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace dos años y se dedica a la fabricación y venta de yeso. Le gusta mucho ser parte de la Institución ya que obtiene facilidades de préstamo y las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal le enseñan mucho y las ponen en práctica en su vida tanto en el negocio como en su familia es por eso que este préstamo le ayudará también a apoyar a su familia en la compra de ladrillos para empezar la construcción de su casa, así ya estará cumpliendo su sueño. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de piedra para elaboración de yeso.
texts.en:
Marcelina’s a member of the “Abejitas Trabajadoras” (Little Worker Bees).  She’s 68-years-old and a single mother of three children.  She’s been a member of FINCA Perú for two years and she works manufacturing plaster.  

She enjoys being part of the Institution very much because she has the ease of obtaining loans and the training she gets in her communal bank teaches her a lot that she can put into practice both in her business and in her family.  

This loan will help her much because it will help her support her family with the purchase of bricks to start building her house so she’s starting to make her dream a reality.

The loan she’s requesting will be used to buy stone used to make plaster.

loans.use: to buy stone.

loans.name: Mabel Nely

texts.es: Mabel es socia del Banco Comunal Solución y tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y madre de 3 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 5 años y es dueña de una tienda donde vende repuestos de automóviles como llantas, pernos y otros. Le gusta  asistir a las reuniones de su Banco Comunal ya que con las capacitaciones que allí recibe aprende mucho a ahorrar, mejorar cada día en su negocio y también a como distribuir bien sus ganancias, está orgullosa de pertenecer a la institución por que le ha permitido aprender mucho y dice que en otras instituciones no brindan capacitaciones. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más repuestos para su negocio como llantas, pernos y otros.
texts.en:
Mabel is a member of the “Solución” communal bank.  She’s 43-years-old, married and the mother of three children.   She’s been a member of FINCA Perú for five years and owns a store where she sells spare parts for cars like tires, joint pins, etc.

She likes attending communal bank meetings because with the training she gets there she’s learned a lot; to save and to improve each day in her business and also how to budget her profits well.

She’s proud to be part of the Institution because it’s allowed her to learn much and she says that other institutions do not provide training.

She will use the requested loan to buy more spare parts for her store like tires, joint pins and others.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts.

loans.name: María Rocio

texts.es: María es socia del Banco Comunal Solución y tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y madre de 1 hijo. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 10 años y es dueña de una tienda donde vende jugos y también tiene un negocio donde vende materiales de construcción. Ella dice que en todo este tiempo como socia de FINCA Perú aprendió a ahorrar y gracias a ello logró comprar su terreno. Le gustan mucho las capacitaciones que le dicta su Promotora en su Banco Comunal donde aprende mucho sobre los ingresos y gastos que una persona maneja y a como distribuir bien sus gananancias, también aprendió mucho en lo personal. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción como arena, cemento, ladrillos y otros para su negocio.
texts.en:
María’s a member of the “Solución” communal bank.  She’s 37-years-old, married and the mother of a son.  She’s been a member of FINCA Perú for ten years and she owns a store where she sells juice; she also has a business where she sells building materials and supplies.

She says that in all this time as a member of FINCA Perú she’s learned how to save and thanks to this was able to buy her piece of land.  She likes the training sessions her communal bank’s advisor has where she learns much about income and expenses that a person handles and how to budget her profits well.  She also learned much on a personal level.

She will use the requested loan to buy building materials and supplies like sand, cement, bricks and others for her business.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Andre

texts.en:
Andre is married with one child. His wife is a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for one year. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to make savings and expand his cultivation.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and support labor costs.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim is 54 years old and is married with seven children, two of whom are still in need of his care. The other five are already settled in marriage and live separately. Sim owns around two hectares of farmland on which he grows rice for his daily sustenance as well as for sale. With earnings from his business, Sim can send his children to school. Recently, one of Sim’s children became employed and now helps support the family. But due to the lack of vehicle, his son has difficulties in commuting to his workplace.

Sim would like to obtain a loan of KHR 600,000 to supplement to his capital to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for his son. This will help him get to work easily and avoid paying for transportation fees. He is very grateful for unending support from lenders. He promises to pay his loan back punctually as scheduled.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for his son to commute to his workplace.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Doña Gladys de 61 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 35 a 41 años de edad, en la ciudad de Cartagena, lugar ubicado a orillas del Mar Caribe, uno de los sitios turísticos mas hermosos de Colombia y muy reconocido, pues   tiene una de las principales bases navales del país y  por su patrimonio histórico-artístico, que abarca de vestigios de época cartaginesa, romana, bizantina, edificaciones de carácter militar de época moderna y contemporánea, así como también edificios neoclásicos y modernistas. Allí en este fantástico lugar y de manera modesta se dedica a la actividad comercial; ella tiene una excelente cartera de clientes que le compran a crédito y le pagan puntualmente, su clientela la ha ido construyendo poco a poco y con mucho estudio de sus potencialidades y capacidad de pago. Entre sus mercancías más comunes, está la ropa femenina el calzado y accesorios femeninos, que promociona mediante guías  especializadas de productos a las cuales se encuentra afiliada y compra ocasionalmente a proveedores varios, cuando le ofrecen precios de oportunidad.  Doña Gladys siempre está atenta a como se mueve el mercado, para ofrecer los mejores productos a los mas bajos precios. Su meta mas adelante es tener su propio almacén, con una gran diversidad de artículos para que sus clientes se impacten, mientras ella les sirve y genera ingresos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará ropa y calzado, que son los artículos que le han encargado en esta temporada, pues debe estar comprando mercancía a la moda, porque a sus clientes les gusta el cambio y ella da a su clientela lo que ellos piden, para poder lograr la sostenibilidad financiera de su negocio y generar cada vez mas ingresos, que beneficien el bienestar personal y el de su familia..
texts.en:
Gladys, 61, lives with her husband in the city of Cartagena and has 4 children aged 35 to 41.  Cartagena is a place that is located on the shores of the Caribbean sea, and is one of the most beautiful and well-known tourist sites in Colombia.  It is also known for being home to the country's main naval bases, and for its artistic and historic heritage, which includes remains from the Carthaginian, Roman, and Byzantine eras.  It contains modern military  buildings from the contemporary era as well as neoclassical and modernist buildings.  Here, in this fantastic place, Gladys works modestly in her retail activity.  

Gladys has an excellent group of customers who buy from her on credit and make their payments punctually.  She has been building up her customer base gradually, evaluating them based on their potential and ability to pay.  Her bestselling items are women's shoes and accessories that she promotes with guidance from the companies that she is affiliated with, and at times she buys from various suppliers when they offer special sales.  Gladys is always attentive to how the market moves, so that she can offer the best products at the lowest prices.  Her goal for the future is to have her own store, with a great diversity of products to make a positive impact on her customers while she serves them and generates income.  

At this time, she is applying for a Kiva loan so that she can buy clothing and shoes.  These are the items that she has orders for in this season.  She needs to be buying merchandise in the latest styles, because her customers like change and she gives her customers what they ask for. This way, she is able to manage financial sustainability for her business and generate more and more income, which benefits her personal well-being and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Asylkan

texts.ru:
Асылкан 30 лет. Асылкан в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи,  на протяжении 10 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 14,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Асылкан в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  3 коровы с приплодом, 10 овец, 2 лошадей, продажа молока приносит около 12,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Асылкан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота на откорм.  Доходы от кредита Асылкан будет вкладывать в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Asylkan is 30 years old.  To provide the primary source of income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for ten years, having started this business with a sum of 14,000 som.  Thanks to Asylkan's hard work, today her business contains three cows with offspring, ten sheep and two horses, and the sales of milk yield about 12,000 som per month.  In order to further develop her business, Asylkan requested a loan in the amount of 135,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional livestock for fattening up.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru:
Айгуль 56 лет, вдова. Айгуль в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи,  2 года назад начала заниматься животноводством с суммы в 25,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Айгуль в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  1 корова, продажа молока приносит около 4,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айгуль обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку 10 голов овец на откорм.  Доходы от кредита Айгуль будет вкладывать в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Aigul is 56 years old and a widow.  To provide the primary source of income for her family, she became involved in animal husbandry two years ago with a sum of 25,000 som.  Thanks to Aigul's hard work, today her business contains one cow, and the sales of milk yield about 4,000 som per month.  In order to further develop her business, Aigul requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy ten sheep for fattening up.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Buan

texts.ru:
Буан 50 лет, замужем, имеет 6 детей. Буан в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи,  14 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством с суммы в 30,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Буан в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 коровы приплодом, 15 голов мелкого рогатого скота, продажа молока и мясных продуктов приносит около 20,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Буан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота на откорм.  Доходы от кредита Буан будет вкладывать в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Buan is 50 years old, married and has six children.  To provide the primary source of income for her family, she became involved in animal husbandry 14 years ago with a sum of 30,000 som.  Thanks to Buan's hard work, today her business contains two cows with offspring and 15 heads of small livestock, and the sales of milk and meat products yield about 20,000 som per month.  In order to further develop her business, Buan requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional heads of livestock for fattening up.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Felesciano

texts.en:
Felesciano is a married fisherman in living Bohol, Philippines who has been a fisherman for 45 years. He is asking for a loan to buy fishing equipment such as fishing nets and fuel for the fishing boat. 
Felesciano works hard in order to support the needs of his family. 
In the future, Felesciano wants to further reinvest in the business because he believes that it provides them the income that they need for sustenance.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment such fishing nets and fuel for the fishing boat

loans.name: Philbert

texts.en:
Philbert is married with four children aged between 12 and 27 years. His wife is a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 4 years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more outputs.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and support labor costs.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 39 years old. She is a widow and lives in a small village in Lanchkhuti District with her two sons (20 and 22 years old) and daughter-in-law. The family is busy with agricultural business. They have a milking cow. They produce cheese, part of which is used by the family and the rest is sold locally. They also own a plot of land, where cucumbers and maize are grown. They sell harvested products on the local open market. The family has a little poultry farm as well. The total average monthly income of the family is 1000 Lari.

Nino requested a loan to expand her poultry farm. She plans to purchase more chickens and raise them. They will be sold with price mark-up after several months. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income they will be able to expand their agricultural business in order to make it more profitable. Living conditions of the family will be improved.

loans.use: to expand her poultry farm

loans.name: Maria Ana

texts.es: María Ana se dedica a la costura ya que elabora vestidos y los vende, su esposo es pensionado y empacador de un centro comercial, necesitan el enjarre del techo porque presenta el problema de que se esta cayendo y la casa se moja cuando llueve, por lo que necesitan impermeabilizarla de forma inmediata. Son personas honradas y trabajadoras ya tienen mas de 30 años viviendo en su domicilio por lo que necesitan mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria Ana has a dressmaking business; she makes dresses and sells them.  Her husband has a pension and works as a packer in a shopping center.  They need to plaster the ceiling because when it rains they have a problem with water coming into the house.  For this reason, they need to weatherproof the roof right away.  They are honest and hardworking people who have been living in this house already for more than 30 years, and they need to make this repair to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to weatherproof their roof and do some plastering

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru:
Замире 41 год, замужем, воспитывает  четверых детей. В поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, после развала Советского Союза и потери работы, Замира начала свой бизнес в торговле сельхозпродукцией – овощами и фруктами. Стартовав с суммы 1,000 сом (KGS), Замира благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  в сумме 16,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря доходам от бизнеса, Замира смогла дать образование своим двум детям.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса в торговле, Замира обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на расширение ассортимента представленного товара за счет сезонных ягод - клубники и черешни.  Доходы от кредита Замира планирует вложить в  дальнейшее расширение своего бизнеса, а в будущем – планирует развивать как торговлю, так и животноводство в целях взаимного пополнения в несезонное время.
texts.en:
Zamira is 41 years old, married, and bringing up four children. After the Soviet Union had fallen apart and she lost her job, Zamira searched for a source of income for her family and launched her business selling farm produce (vegetables and fruits). Having launched her business with the starting capital of 1,000 KGS. Thanks to Zamira’s resilience and hard work, she has been able to grow her business, which now brings in a monthly income of 16,000 KGS. 

Thanks to the revenues from her business, Zamira has been able to educate two of her children.
In order to develop her commerce further, Zamira turned to “Bai Tushum & Partners” for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS for expanding her stock. Zamira plans to reinvest the resulting revenues in a further business expansion. In the future, she plans to be active in both selling produce and raising livestock so that these activities would complement each other during off-season periods.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods.

loans.name: María Hermelinda

texts.es: María es socia del Banco Comunal Delfín y tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y madre de 2 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 1 año y medio y se dedica a la venta de materiales de construcción como arena, piedra chancada y también se dedica a la fabricación y venta de muebles. En este tiempo como socia de FINCA Perú aprendió a ahorrar su dinero, ella dice que le gusta asistir a las reuniones de su Bancomunal por que gracias a las capacitaciones que allí recibe aprendió a generar sus propios ingresos con mucha facilidad y a organizar sus gastos compartiendo sus experiencias con las demás socias. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción como cemento, ladrillos, arena y piedra chancada, para así venderlos a terceras personas que quieran construir su casa y otros.
texts.en:
María’s a member of the “Delfín” (Dolphin) communal bank.  She’s 43-years-old, married and the mother of two children.  She’s been a member of FINCA Perú for a year and a half.  She sells building supplies like sand, crushed stone and she also manufactures and sells furniture.

In the time she’s been a member of FINCA Perú she’s learned to save money.  She says she enjoys her communal bank meetings because thanks to the training she gets there she’s learned to generate her own income easily and to organize her expenses sharing experiences with other members.

The loan she’s requesting will be used to buy building materials and supplies like cement, bricks, sand and crushed stone to sell to third parties who want to build their house and others.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga es socia del Banco Comunal Solución, tiene 39 años de edad y es madre soltera de 7 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú 12 años y se dedica a la venta de gelatina. En  este tiempo como socia de FINCA Perú aprendió a ahorrar y con ello brinda una mejor educación a sus hijos, su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales, le gusta asistir a las reuniones de su Banco Comunal por que allí aprende a como educar a sus hijos y también como mejorar las ganancias de su negocio, y dice que ha aprendido mucho de ello. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de vasos y suministros para la preparación de sus gelatinas como azúcar, frutas, gelatina en polvo, leche.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the Solución Community Bank. She is 39 years old and a single mother of seven children. A member of FINCA Peru for 12 years, Olga earns her living selling jello treats. While she has been with FINCA Peru, she has learned how to save money and has used her savings to provide her children with a better education. Her dream is to see her children get good jobs.

Olga enjoys the meetings put on by her Community Bank because she is learning about bringing up her children and improving the income from her business. She says she has learned a lot about that.

The loan she is seeking will be used to buy glasses and ingredients such as sugar, fruit, jello powder, and milk.

loans.use: to buy glasses and ingredients such as sugar, fruit, jello powder, and milk

loans.name: Pinares Hierva Buena 1 Group

texts.es:
Don Jose Danilo, tiene 51 años de edad, es casado, tiene 5 hijos, vive en una aldea del municipio de San Miguelito, Intibucá.
El tiene 22 años de dedicarse al cultivo de papa, maíz y frijoles, ha sido su fuente de ingresos en su vida a la cual le dedica todo el tiempo necesario. Esta solicitando ya un segundo préstamo con ODEF, este es por 6,993.20 Lempiras, para comprar semillas de papas y para comprar los fertilizantes necesarios para el cultivo. Con este préstamo él quiere complementar el proyecto de ampliar sus cultivos para lograr mejores ingresos y mejorar el  nivel de vida económico familiar.
Pertenece a un grupo solidario que se llama Pinares Hierva Buena 1, que está formado por 5 miembros en la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda esta Justo, seguidamente esta Juan, luego Alfonzo, sigue Jose y a la derecha esta Lucia, todos se dedican al cultivo de papas y viven en la misma comunidad.
texts.en:
José Danilo, 51, is married and has five children; he lives in a village in the municipality of San Miguelito, Intibucá.

He’s been growing potatoes, corn and beans for 22 years.  It’s been his life’s source of income and he dedicates all the time necessary to it.  He’s asking for his second ODEF loan.  This one is for 6,993.20 lempiras to buy potato seeds and to buy fertilizer needed for the crops.  With this loan he hopes to complement the project and expand his crops to attain better income and to improve his family’s standard of living.

He belongs to a communal bank that’s called “Pinares Hierva Buena 1” that has five members.  In the photo they can be identified thus: On the left is Justo, then Juan, then Alfonzo, then José and Lucia is on the right.  All of them grow potatoes and live in the same community.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Esther  Rebeca

texts.es: Esther es socia del Banco Comunal Delfín y tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y madre de 7 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 3 años y es dueña de una tienda de abarrotes. Ella en todo este tiempo como socia de FINCA Perú aprendió a ahorrar y a generar más ingresos para su negocio, de esta manera puede sustentar los gastos de su hogar, también gracias a las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal aprendió a educar mejor a sus hijos y también a incrementar su negocio. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su tienda de abarrotes como sacos de arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche y entre otros.
texts.en:
Esther’s a member of the “Delfín” (Dolphin) communal bank.  She’s 45-years-old, married and the mother of 7 children.  She’s been a member of FINCA Perú for three years and she owns a grocery store.

In her time as a member of FINCA Perú she’s learned how to save money and to generate more income for her business and is able to meet household expenses this way.  Also, thanks to training she gets in her communal bank she’s learned how to better educate her children and also how to increase her business.

The loan she’s requesting sill be used to buy merchandise for her grocery store like sacks of rice, sugar, oil and milk among others.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Areli Noemi

texts.es:
Areli es una mujer de 23 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus padres y hermanos, ella siempre ha sido una persona muy alegre, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; con mucho empeño culminó sus estudios secundarios, lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos no pudo cursar una carrera profesional, pero sueña con poder estudiar la carrera de Administración de Empresas que tanto desea; en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Gracias al apoyo de su madre y a su deseo por salir adelante, desde hace un año Areli puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de frituras, tales como hamburguesas, papas rellenas, pollo broaster, salchipapa, tequeños, entre otros; Areli dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 11 horas diarias a su negocio y puede atender un promedio de 40 clientes, ella se encuentra a gusto en su negocio y cree que le va bien ya que sus clientes la recomiendan por su buena sazón y buena atención.
Areli se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un mostrador y una mesa los cuales le servirán para acondicionar su negocio; asimismo, podrá realizar el pintado de un pequeño bote que le heredó su Padre para que pueda utilizarla para generar ingresos económicos;  de esta manera Areli podrá incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos económicos, con los cuales en un futuro no muy lejano desea poder utilizarlos para terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Areli is a 23-year-old woman living in the city of Pisco with her parents and siblings.  She’s always been a very cheerful, hardworking, enthusiastic person who very much wants to improve.  With much dedication she completed secondary education but unfortunately because she had to go to work to cover her expenses she was unable to study a professional career.  However, she dreams with being able to study Business Administration.  In her free time she enjoys playing sports and sometimes cooks a delicious “Arroz con Pato” [Rice with Duck] to share with her family.

Thanks to her mother’s support and her wish to get ahead, a year ago Areli started a small business selling fast-food like hamburgers, stuffed potatoes, Broasted chicken, ‘salchipapas’ [fried potatoes with fried sausages], ‘tequeños’ [deep-fried, cheese-stuffed dough], among others.  Areli spends about 11 hours daily at work and can take care of 40 customers on average.  She’s happy with her business and believes she does well because her customers recommend her because of her tasty preparations and the good service.

Areli is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to buy a counter and a table to equip her business and will also be able to paint a small boat she inherited from her father so she can use it to generate income.  In this way Areli will be able to increase sales and income that she can use in the future to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy a counter, a table and to paint the boat.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 24 years old and still single. He has been in mixed farming for two years, producing and selling sorghum, maize, eggs and chicken to the local market. He also works as a computer technician, giving people help with computer maintenance and giving short training on applications.

Charles has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds. He hopes this will boost his income and help him build a strong foundation for his future. He expects his output to double and he hopes to be able to assist his parents and siblings with their basic needs.

Charles remains grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for the support to smallholder farmers.

loans.use: To buy more poultry birds

loans.name: Goretti

texts.en:
Goretti is a widow who has two children and all of them attend school. She has spent eight years in the rice production business. She has requested a Kiva loan to buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, she plans to pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers andpay labor costs.

loans.name: Gulomjon

texts.en: Gulomjon is a man who likes to work very much. He is intelligent, brainy and good-natured. He always tries to find new ways to earn income. 17 years ago, he began own business. He has his own car and works as taxi man. He has many customers. All his customers are glad for his work and character. He has a son and loves him very much. He wants to develop his business but his income isn't enough to repair his car. He is asking for a loan to repair his car. He waits for your help and mercy. Please, help him if you can to do it.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Albert Antonio

texts.es: Albert con su nueva máquina estampadora empezó su proceso de estampado de Mugs, él esta ofreciendo mejores productos con una calidad inigualable en el acabado y todo esto fue gracia a su credikiva. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo crédito, mediante el cual comprará una maquina estampadora de botones publicitarios que solicitan mucho para cumpleaños y en empresas para el ejercicio de su publicidad. Así se lo han solicitado sus clientes y ella se está abriendo a nuevas oportunidades de servir en su mercado. Por eso dice a sus financiadores de Kiva “Gracias por apoyar la microempresa. “
texts.en:
With his new printing machine Albert started printing on mugs.  He’s offering better products of unsurpassed quality and all of this was made possible by his Kiva loan.

He’s currently applying for a new loan to buy a machine to make buttons that are in very high demand for birthdays and by firms that use them to advertise themselves.  His customers have requested this and he’s opening up new market venues for more opportunities which is why he says to his Kiva lenders:  “Thanks for supporting micro business.”

loans.use: to buy a button making machine.

loans.name: Teresa Jesus

texts.es: Teresa es socia del Banco Comunal Brillantes y tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y madre de 9 hijo. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 5 años y se dedica a la venta de tubérculos y menestras. Ella dice que las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal son buenas por que le enseñan y le dan ideas de como administrar su negocio, como ahorrar y también como mejorar en su hogar, y dice que en otras instituciones no lo hacen. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de tubérculos y menestras como papa, camote, yuca, olluco, arveja, habas y otros.
texts.en: Teresa is a member of the Brillantes Communal Bank. She is 50 years old and is married with 9 children. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for the last 5 years and she runs a business selling root vegetables and stewing vegetables. She says that the Communal Bank provides her with good training opportunities which educate her and give her ideas about how  to run her business, such as how to save money and also how to improve the running of her home. This doesn't happen with other institutions, she says. She plans to invest this loan in purchasing root vegetables and stewing vegetables, such as potatoes, sweet potatoes, cassavas, ullucos, peas, broad beans and other items.

loans.use: To buy root vegetables and stewing vegetables such as potato, sweet potato, cassava, ulluco, peas, broad  beans and other items.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo es socia del Banco Comunal Brillantes y tiene 56 años de edad, es casado y padre de 6 hijos. Es socio de FINCA Perú hace 1 año y medio y es dueño de una carpintería donde fabrica muebles y los vende a personas que tiene sus tiendas de mueblerías para así ellos revenderlos a terceros, también fabrica muebles a pedido. Le gusta asistir a las reuniones de su Banco Comunal porque gracias a las capacitaciones que allí recibe aprendió a ahorrar, así también él invitó a su hijo para que pueda participar en su Banco Comunal y que también escuche las capacitaciones y ahorre. El préstamo que  solicita lo invertirá en la compra de madera para la fabricación de muebles que ya tiene pedidos.
texts.en:
Guillermo is a member of the Brillantes Community Bank.  He is 56 years old, married, and has six children. He has been a member of FINCA Peru for one and a half years. 

Guillermo is the owner of a carpentry workshop where he makes furniture and sells it to furniture stores to sell on to their customers. He also takes orders for furniture. He enjoys attending the meetings put on by his Community Bank because of the useful training sessions where he has learned about saving money. He also invited his son to participate, listen to the training, and learn about saving.

The loan Guillermo is seeking will be used to buy wood to make the furniture for which he already has orders.

loans.use: To buy wood to make furniture

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es: Erlinda es socia del Banco Comunal Brillantes y tiene 20 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 1 hijo. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 3 años y se dedica a la venta de cereales. En este tiempo como socia de FINCA Perú ha aprendido a ahorrar y a generar sus propios ingresos y recursos para progresar al lado de su familia. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en su negocio con la compra de cereales como trigo, maca, avena, quiwicha.
texts.en: Erlinda’s a member of the “Brillantes” communal bank.  She’s 20-years-old and the mother of one son.  She’s been a member of FINCA Perú for three years.  She sells grains.  In her time as a FINCA Perú member she learned how to save and to generate her own income and resources to make progress alongside her family.  She will use the requested loan to buy grains like wheat, maca [a root vegetable], oats and amaranth.

loans.use: to buy grains.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma lives with her husband and five children. Her youngest was born this year. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Four years ago, of her own initiative, she started a business selling foodstuffs at the market. Over the years, thanks to her hard work, the business has grown and she meets other needs of her clients, getting into the sale of a variety of foods such as dumplings, peas, etc.

Her main priority is supporting her kids in their education.  This is her second loan. She came to Yehu through a reference from a friend.

Fatuma has a small stall in a strategic place at the market where she keeps an inventory of her products and works in the morning, after preparing some of the foods to sell. Her business supports their household expenses, along with her husband's work. 

She is taking a loan of KSH 25,000 to purchase wheat flour, oil, and sugar.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, oil, and sugar.

loans.name: Athanasie

texts.en:
Athanasie is a widow. She has been a rice grower since 2009. She has requested a Kiva loan to buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs to get the best harvest. She wants to save her profits.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en: Parviz is 22 years old and a single man. He has been doing animal husbandry and field crop cultivation for the past five years as a main source of income for his family. Because of his hard work, Parviz now has one cow, one hectare of land with clover and sells milk, which brings around 200 manats a month. His father helps him with the business and they work hard to provide a better living for the family. Parviz obtained this loan of 1200 AZN to buy livestock in order to refill his working capital and expand his business. This is his first loan from Aqroİnvest and Kiva and he relies on your kindness and help.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Junior Jose

texts.es: Junior es un joven de 28 años de edad,  casado, padre de dos hijos pequeños. Su esposa trabaja como operaria. Junior a mucho esfuerzo logro terminar su carrera en ingeniería en sistema, hoy en día es docente de una universidad así mismo ha mantenido un puesto de refresquería, que le ayudado en sus gastos. Lo que ha querido ampliar y contar con un freezer grande para hacer más frescos en varios sabores. Siendo posible esta compra con financiamiento en Afodenic, lo que espera aumentar sus ventas, captar clientela y salir adelante junto con su familia.
texts.en: Junior, 28, is married and the father of two small children.  His wife works as a laborer.  With much effort he managed to complete his career as a computer programmer and today teaches in a university.  At the same time he’s had a soft-drink shop that has helped him meet expenses.  He’s wanted to expand it and to have a large freezer to make more refreshments in various flavors.  With financing from Afodenic this purchase is possible.  He hopes to increase sales and win over more customers in order to get ahead with his family.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition and registration fees.

loans.name: Donathile

texts.en:
Donathile is married to a farmer and they have seven children, six of whom attend school. She has spent four years in the rice production business. She has requested a Kiva loan to buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, she plans to renovate the house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Luke

texts.en:
Luke is 56 years old and married. She has two children who are 22 and 20 years old and both attend university. Their family lives in the northeastern part of the country. Luke has been VisionFund Albania’s client for a long time and she has gained all the respect from our institution and the people in the region who have known her. 

Luke was educated under the communist era and worked as a lathe machine operator. Very rare in Albania then and now and specifically in her region to see women doing such jobs that were considered “the male domain”. Yet, Luke was a strong woman who broke the taboo and she accepts this proudly.  For the past 20 years, she has been doing just that, operating the lathe machine she has owned for all the past years and making parts for agricultural machinery. Her services are high in demand among agricultural farmers. She is the only one in the entire region to make such parts and the only person in her family to support it financially in every aspect. 

Luke is now requesting a Kiva loan to buy a new tool rest part for the machine and she wants to thank all lenders at KIVA for their understanding in this matter.

loans.use: To buy a part for the lathe machine

loans.name: Anorqul

texts.en: Anorqul has worked on a collective farm as a tractor and excavator driver for 35 years. He is very kind and clever. He likes his work very much and tries to do the best to develop his work. He makes his work perfectly. Now, he works as a driver of a tractor and an excavator on a different plantation of local people. He has a friendly family. His sons help him in his work. His wife works as a farmer. Their house is in bad condition and that’s why they decided to repair it. He is asking for a loan to buy building materials. His family needs to repair this house. Please, help him. He waits your help and support.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Ugiloy

texts.en: Ugiloy has gotten a loan from Imon International Organization twice before. She is a very good client because she is a clever and successful business woman. She is the only wage earner in the family because her husband went to Russia to find a job. She decided to develop her business as her children become older. Her business is to care for cattle. She buys cattle, cares for them, and then sells them to local people. In the local market she has many customers as her cattle are fat and well cared for. She is asking for a loan to buy young cattle for developing her business. She awaits your help and mercy.

loans.use: to buy young cattle.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a 30-year-old single woman who lives in her own house with her one child who attends school.

For the past 7 years, Mwanasha has been involved in the sale of maize and wheat flour, sugar, rice, etc. in a kiosk. In addition, she operates a grocery store where she sells a variety of fruits and vegetables. Her main challenges are the rise of prices and the low quantity of goods. She started this business with help from her husband who gave her money, and she learned her grocery business from her mother. Mwanasha has requested this loan to purchase maize flour, sugar, rice, and fruits and vegetables for her businesses. She hopes to open a wholesale in the future.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, sugar, rice, and fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en: Fatma is 39 years old and a very hard-working person who works in farming. She lives with her husband and two children, who are all in school. Fatma has many customers that purchase her fruits at good prices and sell it in different bazaars. She usually earns 350 manats per month. With the help of Aqroinvest, which she joined last year (this is her second loan), Fatma was able to obtain more fruit to sell because of the 1500 manats loaned to her. Someday, she hopes to earn much greater revenue to allow for business expansion.

loans.use: to obtain more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Dayana

texts.es: Dayana  de 25 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y tiene 1 hijo de un año de edad, en la ciudad de Cartagena, lugar ubicado a orillas del Mar Caribe, uno de los sitios turísticos mas hermosos de Colombia y muy reconocido, pues   tiene una de las principales bases navales del país y  por su patrimonio histórico-artístico, que abarca de vestigios de época cartaginesa, romana, bizantina, edificaciones de carácter militar de época moderna y contemporánea, así como también edificios neoclásicos y modernistas. Allí en este fantástico lugar y de manera modesta se dedica a la confeccionar ropa y tiene también el negocio de vender mercancía variada. Ella dese muy niña vio a su madre como cortaba las telas y producía ropa, esta actividad formó parte de su rutina diaria y cuando ella creció e inclino en continuar con esa tradición y porque además porque en la universidad, cuando empezó a estudiar encontró un mercado que potencializó y lo hizo parte de su clientela. Su meta mas adelante es tener un punto comercial donde ofrecer la ropa que ella misma diseña y confecciona. Su mayor desafío es no contar con el capital de trabajo suficiente para el cumplimiento de su sueño. En la actualidad está aplicando un credikiva, con el cual comprará telas, hilos, accesorios para producir vestidos para damas que es su especialidad y accesorios femeninos,  pues atenta a la moda, quiere impactar su mercado ofreciéndole lo que su juvenil clientela necesita y desea adquirir.
texts.en:
Dayana, 25, lives with her spouse and one-year-old son in the city of Cartagena, located on the shores of the Caribbean Sea, one of Colombia’s best-known tourist sites because it has one of the country’s main naval bases and its historical-artistic heritage encompasses Carthaginian, Roman and Byzantine military styles from both modern and contemporary ages as well as neo-classical and modern buildings.

In that fantastic place and very modestly she works sewing clothes; she also has a business selling assorted merchandise.  When she was a little girl she’d watch her mother cut fabric and produce clothes.  This activity became part of her daily routine and when she grew up she was inclined to continue with that tradition and also because while attending university and starting to study she discovered a potential market there which she took advantage of and included in her clientele.

Her goal for later on is to have a point of sale where she can sell clothes designed and made by her.  Her greatest challenge is not having sufficient working capital to reach this dream.  She’s currently applying for a Kiva loan she’ll use to buy thread, fabric and accessories to make dresses for women which are her specialty as well as women’s accessories because being aware of fashion she wants to impact the marketplace offering what her youthful clientele needs and wants to buy.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es: El señor Roberto habita en una comarca de la cuidad de telica Departamento de león , donde vive con su familia, actualmente no le tienen hijos solo su esposa es soltero, el señor Roberto se dedica al trabajo de ebanistería donde tiene su taller propio donde procesa muebles de todo estilo al gusto del cliente el que tiene 17 años de ejercer en conjunto con su papa, pero con la época lluviosa el está presentando un problema bastante agudo como es el techo que está en mal estado y la compra de materiales como madera junco , zinc, alfajillas, pilares, clavos y cemento, los que utilizaría para la construcción del techo y cumplir con la demanda existente de productos elaborados, por tal razón se decidió visitar las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un crédito y ser beneficiado  para lograr el objetivo y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Roberto lives in a district in the city of Telica in León Department with his family; he currently has no children, just his wife.  He’s single.
Roberto works as a cabinet maker.  He has his own shop where he makes furniture in all styles according to his customers’ wishes.  He’s been in business 17 years and works with his father.  However, during the rainy season he has a serious problem because the roof is in bad shape and he will buy supplies like reeds, metal sheets, window and door frames, posts, nails and cement that he’ll use to build the roof and to meet demand for manufactured goods.  Because of this he decided to visit the Ceprodel offices to request a loan to be able to reach his objective thus improving his conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Veronica Hilaria

texts.es: La señora Verónica es originaria de una comarca del municipio de quezalguaque jurisdicción de león, actualmente se dedica a impartir clases de primaria en un colegio de la misma localidad con 28 años de efectuar tan noble labor, es una maestra que por vocación le gusta la relación con los niños, y también le sirve como guía para también apoyar a su hijos los que tiene en niveles universitarios, y son a los que tiene el deber de proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo profesional, la señora verónica   hoy en día tiene la necesidad de ser apoyada con un financiamiento .para lograr el objetivo deseado como todo padre quiere lo bueno para sus hijos, por eso tomo la decisión de visitar a ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito y de esa manera  lograr el objetivo planteado y mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en: Veronica hails from a sub-district in the town of Quezalguaque, in León. Currently she teaches primary school classes in a school in the same area, and she has worked in this noble profession for the last 28 years. She was born to be a teacher, and she loves the relationship she has with the children. She has also acted as a guide for her own children, financially supporting those of her children that are at university. She is charged with the task of providing them with the right conditions for their professional development. Today, it is Veronica who needs support in the form of a loan in order to achieve what every parent wants for their child: to give them the best that she can. Consequently, she decided to visit CEPRODEL to apply for a loan and, as such, she will be able to achieve her planned objective and improve her living conditions and her standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for a university module and to repair a wall and her roof.

loans.name: Minelda Aricela

texts.es:
La joven Minelda de 28 años de edad, vive con sus dos hijos y su esposo en la aldea el Tular  en Nacaome al sur de Honduras, dedicándose desde hace ya vario tiempo  a la ambulante de Ropa en los barrios y colonia de San Lorenzo y Nacaome.
Minelda el préstamo que esta solicitando es de 20,000.00 lempiras, y lo necesita para comprar ropa interior, y ropa americana (Fardos), con las ganancias de este préstamo ella pretende seguir aumentando su capital de trabajo y seguir mejorando su condición de vida.
Con apoyo del préstamo Minelda desea lograr su objetivo de llegar a  tener su propia casa que es su sueño y seguir luchando para crecer en su negocio.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2012
texts.en:
Minelda is a young woman of 28 who lives with her two children and husband in the community of El Tular in Nacaome in the south of Honduras. She earns her living as a street vendor selling clothing in the neighbourhoods and towns of San Lorenzo and Nacaome, a job she's had for some time now. 

Minelda is seeking a loan of 20,000 lempiras which she needs to buy underwear and bundles of secondhand clothing from North America.  With the money she earns she hopes to increase her working capital and continue improving her standard of living. As well she wishes to fulfill her dream of owning a house and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy underwear and bundles of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery selling buisness

loans.name: Alba Nubia

texts.es: En el municipio de Quezalguaque departamento de León, La señora Alba, se dedica a impartir clases como maestro de primaria, en un pequeño colegio del municipio, dedicándose a esa labor desde hace 16 años, es Casada con 1 hijo al que tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo, ya que está estudiando, y parte del financiamiento va dirigido a los estudios y mejoramiento de su vivienda,  Una de las necesidades que la  señora  Alba  atraviesa, es de garantizarle las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo académico y de mejoramiento de vivienda, por lo que se decidió  de acudir a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para lograr el objetivo  de apoyar a su hijo y de efectuarles las mejora de techo y pared de su vivienda. Ya que esto le ayudara a darle mayor seguridad a su hijo.
texts.en: In the town of Quezalguaque, in the department of León, Alba has been teaching primary school classes in a small school in the town for the last 16 years. She is married with 1 son who she must provide with the conditions required for his development, as he is already studying. Part of this loan will be put towards paying for his studies as well as improving her own home. She hopes to guarantee her son the best conditions for his academic development and for the improvements to their home; consequently, she decided to come to CEPRODEL to apply for a loan to help support her son. She also hopes to carry out improvements to the roof and walls of her home as this will help her to provide her son with greater security.

loans.use: pay university costs and to buy blocks, cement, sand, metal sheeting and laborers.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma
Isla Chira
1000.000


	Vilma tiene 44 años y vive con su compañero y sus hijas en la Isla de Chira en el Golfo de Nicoya en la provincia de Puntarenas. La clienta se presenta como una persona trabajadora, tiene una amplia experiencia en la actividad pesquera, al pertenecer a la Asociación de Mujeres Sembradoras de Pianguas de Chira y contar con su propio negocio de venta de pescado y camarón en la zona. Este negocio le ha permitido apoyar a sus hijas en el estudio y convertirse en profesionales. Además junto a su compañero generan empleo en una zona con limitaciones en esta área. Han logrado generar los ingresos para mantener a su familia y apoyar por este medio a otras familias en Isla Chira.
