	Con su experiencia en la actividad y por medio del proyecto de Piangua (marisco de la zona) empezó con su negocio. Con el paso del tiempo y las ganancias ha comprado los equipos para la actividad pesquera. En esta ocasión desea cambiar los trasmallos (redes) utilizados para la pesca.

	La actividad tiene un período de trabajo de 9 meses al año, dada la situación de veda (prohibición de pesca para recuperar las especies) en el Golfo de Nicoya por esta situación se otorga un mes de período de gracia. Cuenta con 4 pescadores, más el bote propio, que le proveen el pescado y camarón el cual vende a un centro de Acopio en la zona de Colorado de Abangares, contando con la cadena completa para su negocio. 


	La microempresa cuenta con el equipo para hacer frente a la pesca en la Isla de Chira, cuenta con 4 proveedores de producto y un centro de acopio donde reciben el camarón y pescado, obteniendo un precio de mercado competitivo,  ya que no vende a un intermediario. Entre sus metas esta el instalar un centro de acopio en la propia Isla y ayudar así a más familias a obtener el sustento. Se recomienda el apoyo a esta actividad ya que cuenta con los equipos necesarios, genera empleo, permitiendo a muchas personas en Isla Chira cubrir sus necesidades y apoyar a sus hijos en el estudio.
texts.en:
Vilma is 44 years old and lives with her companion and daughters on the Island of Chira in the Gulf of Nicoya, Puntarenas province. She is a worker with ample experience in the fishing industry, as a member of the Association of  Women Seeders of Pianguas [a local shellfish] of Chira. And she has her own business selling fish and shrimp in the zone. The business has enabled Vilma to help her daughters study to become professionals. In addition, together with her companion, she has generated employment in a zone where it has been limited.  They have also managed to generate income to maintain their family and by this means, to help other families on the Island of Chira.

With experience in fishing, and by means of the local Piangua project, Vilma began her business. Over time, and using her earnings, Vilma has bought fishing equipment. On the present occasion, she wishes to replace her fishing nets. 

Vilma's activity has a working period of 9 months out of the year, given the current restrictions (a prohibition against fishing, allowing the species to recuperate) in the Gulf of Nicoya. In the present situation, a grace period of 1 month is granted. She has 4 fishermen, plus her own boat, bringing in the fish and shrimp which she sells at the collection center in the Colorado de Abangares zone, where the chain of her business is completed.

Vilma's micro-enterprise works with a team that manages fishing around the Island of Chira. There are 4 marketers of their products at this single collection center where the shrimp and fish are received, and a competitive market price is obtained. There is no selling to intermediaries. Among their goals is to install a collection center on the island proper and thus, help more families obtain sustenance. It is recommended that assistance be provided for this activity, since the necessary conditions are available to generate employment, permitting many people on Chira Island to provide for their necessities and help the children in their studies.

loans.use: to buy new fish nets for her shrimp and fishing business.

loans.name: Zevar

texts.en:
Zevar has fifteen years of experience in agriculture and is successful. She and her husband grow potatoes and earn additional income from animal husbandry. 

Her colleagues know her as good-natured, hardworking, and cute. She has a lovely husband and one child. She tries to do the best for her son. 

Zevar wants to develop her business further, but her income isn't enough. She is asking for a loan to buy cattle and mineral fertilizers for the land she works.

loans.use: to buy cattle and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Tural

texts.en:
Tural is 22 years old and a first-year student of Azerbaijan Technology University. His years for studies are 2011-2015. 

He is on the faculty of Consumer Products Technology and Marketing. His parents are working and Tural studies all the time. He has no time for a job, but he needs to pay for his education. Hence for this purpose he applied for 1,200 AZN to pay his second-year tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay his higher education tuition fee.

loans.name: Engjell

texts.en:
Engjell is in his early fifties and married. He has two children, ages twenty-three and seventeen years old, one of them attending university and the other in secondary school. They live in a village not far from a major city. 

Engjell has been in the livestock business for the past five years. He has been selling milk to neighboring dairy farms. The profit has been okay according to him, yet having to pay tuition fees and supporting all his family financially has not been easy at all for him. 

Every time he tried to put some money aside to buy cows, something else came up that was urgent. He was on the waiting list at VisionFund Albania for some time until the staff contacted him, asking about the possibility of posting his profile on Kiva. Engjell literally buzzed with excitement.

The loan he is requesting now is to buy cows to expand his business. This way he will be able to finance his children’s tuition fees. 

Engjell could not hide his appreciation for KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Andrea Maricela

texts.es: Maricela no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder proteger su casa con un portón que le esta haciendo mucha falta y le preocupa que los robos a casas están siendo cada vez mas frecuentes. La señora Maricela es divorciada y tiene dos hijos adolecentes bajo su responsabilidad y desea que su familia y patrimonio estén seguros de la delincuencia. Doña Mary  labora como maestra de una escuela federal y nos dice es una labor tan bonita el educar y servir para que con el paso del tiempo esas personas se superen.
texts.en: Maricela does not have sufficient capital to be able to protect her house with a gate. She needs it very much, and it worries her that home robberies are becoming more and more frequent. Maricela is divorced and has two adolescent children in her care, and she wants her family and her personal possessions to be safe from crime. Mary is a teacher at a federally-funded school, and she tells us it is such beautiful work to educate and serve so that with time those people succeed.

loans.use: to install the gate in her entryway

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new cart for her business selling fruits and local drinks.

loans.name: Murad

texts.en: Murad is 48 years old, very honest, and an attentive father and husband. He is working in order to provide for his family. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Murad has engaged in cattle breeding for 10 years. Of course, his family supports him in his business, especially his wife. His wife is a housewife; that’s why she has time to take care of housework and also help her husband. His primary goal is to develop his business, which is why he asked for a loan of 1000 manats. He will utilize the loan funds to buy livestock. He is grateful for your help.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 39 and has ten solid years in active farming in her home area of Murang’a in Central Kenya. Her farm produce includes tea, maize, and milk which she sells to the local market. She is divorced with one child aged 16 years old. She also runs a retail business. Cereals are her main products.

She has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to boost her farming by buying hybrid seeds to plant and boosting her cereals business. She reiterates her cereals business usually runs with cereals sourced from her farm as well as from other farmers. 

Virginia says seasonal production which results in drastic price fluctuations is her major challenge and requires better storage facilities for farmers to get value for their produce.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Rahmon

texts.en: Rahmon has many friends and loves them very much. He is also a good father and business man. He tries to do the best for his children as they haven’t got a mother. He has been in the animal husbandry business for more than 6 years. He has big and small cattle. His business has been developing year by year as he has experience in business. He wants to develop the business further and that’s why he is asking for a loan to buy small cattle. He and his children await your help. Your kindness will make these motherless children happy.

loans.use: to buy small cattle.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 48 years old, a married man and a resident of Sana`a, Yemen. He has 10 children. He is an employer and has a car. He has been operating a clothing store. 

He is hardworking and has many clients. He is applying for a loan of 300,000 YER from AMB to purchase new clothes to sell. Ali's aspiration is to open another business, and he believes this can be achieved in the short term.

He plans to trade in the new business using the extra income obtained from this business. His dream is to own a wholesale shop where he can sell clothes.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes to sell

loans.name: Abdulhamid

texts.en: Abdulhamid is a man who likes to work very hard. He always tries to find new ways to make an income. He has a big family and that’s why he needs more money as he is the only breadwinner in his family.  He decided to organize his own business. He is a tailor. He is smart and hardworking. He applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy men`s fabrics for his business.

loans.use: to buy men`s fabrics for his business

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred is currently applying for another Kiva loan because he wants to strengthen his business more each time and plans to use this loan to purchase a refrigerator, install electricity at his house, and add to his food stock for his cafe. With his Kiva loan he will make the investment successful and this is why he’s very competitive when he sells his cooked food and earns more each time.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator, install electricity and add to his stock of food.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a 40-year-old married woman. She has four children and two are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Ali and he works in a school as a patron. 

Mwanasha operates a soup business. She makes her soup from livestock heads and legs and later sells it at the market. She's worked in this business for two years. Her primary customers are the community. 

Mwanasha's other source of income is her spouse's contribution. She describes her greatest business challenge to be debt defaulters and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mwanasha will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy stock (three cow heads as well as cow legs) from the slaughterhouses. Mwanasha aspires to open a restaurant in the future.

loans.use: to buy cow heads and legs for her soup-making business

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна замужем. У нее два сына. Татьяна имеет собственный бизнес. 

Татьяна торгует детской одеждой и обувью в популярном торговом центре города. Этим бизнесом она занимается более 4 лет. Татьене нравится это направление в торговле. Она трудолюбивая и ответственная.

Татьяна просит предоставить ей ркедит на сумме 15000 гривен на закупку сезоннного летнего товара. Кредит поможет ей увеличить доход семьи.
texts.en: Tatyana is married and has two sons.  She has her own business.  She sells children's clothing and shoes at a popular shopping center of the city.  She has been in this business for over four years.  Tatyana likes this particular focus in retail sales.  She is hardworking and responsible.  Tatyana is requesting a loan in the amount of 15,000 hryvnia to buy seasonal, summer merchandise.  The loan will help her to increase the family's income.

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a resident and a farmer in Murang’a, Central Kenya. He is 52 and married with four adult children and one minor child. He has been in farming for twenty years and currently produces coffee and milk for the local market.

Simon has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to boost his dairy business by building a modern dairy unit. He adds that the increase in milk production will meet family requirements and provide income to educate his last born child. His focus is continuing to improve the quality of his breeds consistently.

He is glad these loans are empowering farmers and making them self-reliant.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha has a cafe that she established over four years ago. She sells foodstuffs such as flat breads, dumplings, rice, beans, etc. She says that the previous loan helped her to pay school fees for her child who is now getting on well with his studies. Mwanasha begins her work very early morning in order to serve her customers and generate daily income to help cover a few household needs.

This is her third loan with Yehu in the amount of 30,000 KES, which will be invested in the purchase of more products such as beans, rice, sugar, meat, and other items so that she can restock her business. By increasing her inventory, her earnings will improve. Her goal is to have the necessary capital to help her children continue with their studies. Thanks to Kiva and Yehu for the loans given.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, sugar, meat, and other items

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is twenty-nine years old and educated. She lives in Northeast Albania.  Yet, despite the fact that she holds a degree, unfortunately she has not been able to find a job in her field and for this reason she started a business of her own a year or so back. She opened a store in the village where she currently resides and sells brand new clothes, each item less than 500 LEK. 

So far, the business has been going well, and now she is planning to expand her business by buying more inventory items. Elsa has been able to establish a good clientele, thanks to her good service, and she is positive that by adding more items geared towards almost every age, she will be able to attract all ages and of course increase the profit and be helpful to locals as well. 

This is Elsa’s second time requesting a loan from VisionFund Albania with the previous one being already paid off. Please note that she built up the store with that one.  Now, it is different for her because this will be a KIVA loan through VFA and she wants to thank in advance all lenders for their support.

loans.use: To stock up on clothing inventory

loans.name: Mgandi

texts.en: Mgandi is applying for a new Kiva loan, and it is the fifth loan he has received from Yehu Microfinance Trust. With this new investment he wants to start a water-selling business and expand his existing goat business. He will purchase water pipes and goats for meat sales, which are the main requests his customers have made of him during this season when his sales usually increase. With his other Kiva loans, he was able to increase his number of customers in Samburu. He has the following message for his financiers: “I am very grateful to Kiva and Yehu Microfinance. I hope to continue prospering with your financial support.”

loans.use: to purchase water pipes for a water-selling business and goats for meat sales.

loans.name: Everisto

texts.en:
Mr. Everisto deals in assorted consumer goods. The client also deals in agriculture to supplement his family income. He hopes to restock his shop due to the ever-increasing demand for his products. 

Everisto has 3 children and they are of school-going age. He hopes that the proceeds from the loan will increase his family income and he will be able to send his children to school. He also plans to start a small business for his wife so as to supplement their family income. He is a committed and hard-working man.

loans.use: To restock more products for sale.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 43 años, su esposo es Raúl y su hija, Luz María. Juntos viven en la casa que compró hace dos años en la localidad de Chupaca.  
Su principal actividad económica es la agricultura. Todas las mañanas se dirige a cuidar de sus sembríos de pasto, papa, lechuga y otras hortalizas, las cuales después de cada cosecha comercializa al mercado de su localidad. Su principal ingreso se centra en la venta de pasto, la cual realiza todas las mañanas, antes de ir hacia sus terrenos agrícolas. “La siembra de alfalfa, dura un promedio de 10 años, donde tienes que cortar y abonar para que continúe creciendo”, afirma. Es por ello que cuando no corta toda la alfalfa que sembró, tiene que comprar a otros agricultores para que pueda abastecer a sus clientes. Ahora desea mejorar su negocio, pues desea ahorrar y comprar más terrenos agrícolas. 

Este es su décimo crédito con MFP y agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe, pues podrá concretar los objetivos de su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que aprende mucho con los integrantes de su grupo.
Carmen invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de pasto para poder seguir con su negocio, además pagará el alquiler de sus terrenos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Carmen is 43 years old. Her spouse is Raúl and her daughter is Luz María. Together they live in the house that they purchased two years ago in the town of Chupaca. 

Her main economic activity is agriculture. Every morning she goes out to care for her crops of grass, potatoes, lettuce, and other vegetables, which she sells after each harvest in the market in her town. Her main income is based on the sale of grass, which she sells every morning before going to her fields. "Alfalfa lasts an average of 10 years, when you have to cut it and fertilize it for it to keep growing," she says. That is why when she doesn't cut all of the alfalfa she planted, she has to buy from other farmers so that she can supply her customers. Now she wants to improve her business, since she wants to save and buy more farmland.

This is her tenth loan with MFP, and she is thankful for the financial support she receives, since she will be able to realize her goals for the business. She also promises to be punctual with her loan repayments, since she learns a lot with the members of her group. 

Carmen will use the money from this loan to buy grass in order to be able to continue with her business. She will also pay the rent on her farmland.

loans.use: to purchase grass in order to continue selling it and to pay the rent on her farmland

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 28 years old, married, and has 4 school-aged children. As the main source of income for her family, she operates a grocery, having started her business with an initial investment of 15,000 KES. Thanks to her persistence and hard work, her business is doing well. 
In order to continue developing her business, Rehema has turned to Yehu & Partners for a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase tomatoes, potatoes, onions, other vegetables, etc. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her business, and dreams of building a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, potatoes, onions, and other vegetables.

loans.name: Mwaniki

texts.en:
Mwaniki is a farmer and a father of three children, one adult and two minors aged 17 and 14, respectively. He has been farming for 25 years and currently sells tea and milk from his farm to the local markets.

Mwaniki has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo and says this will enable him to construct a dairy unit for his growing number of dairy cows. He aspires to start dairy breeding in future since dairy farming is popular and there are no qualified breeders in the area.

Mwaniki says the major challenge he faces which is also common with other farmers is getting quality breeds since the local breeders do not keep good records. He remains focused on accumulating his income by using loans which Juhudi Kilimo has made accessible.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Abdusamad

texts.en: Abdusamad is very kind, clever, cute, and hardworking. He has worked as a business man for over 10 years. He has enough experience for developing his business. He grows watermelon, onions, corn and other kinds of vegetables. As he is very kind and careful, his family loves him very much. Abdusamad is in business to help his wife and children. He tries to do the best for his 5 children and that’s why he needs more money. To develop his business, he must buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. He and his family await your help and mercy.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 38 years old and married. Together she and her husband have two sons.Her husband provides additional income to the family

She has been in the motorcycle transport business for five years and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. She will use the loan to buy another motorbike for better service to her customers. The anticipated profits will be used to to buy shares in the stock market.

This is her second loan from KADET LTD. She has successfully repaid the previous one. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a taxi and provide quality education to her two sons.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Devota

texts.en: Devota used her previous loan to buy a water tank as a water storage facility. Today she is requesting a new loan to buy another big tank to store enough water as she anticipates a dry season which will lead to low  availability of water. This would allow her to supply water continuously to meet her customers' demand every day.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank for water storage.

loans.name: Faida

texts.en: Faida is a 43-year-old divorced woman. She has four children, two of whom are adults while the other two are in school. Faida sells mnazi (local brew) and sells her brew in a club. She's worked at this business for seven years and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She is a very hardworking mother despite her advanced age. Faida will use the KES 20,000 loan to add more brew to satisfy her clients' rising demands. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to add more brew for resale

loans.name: Abdulhamid

texts.en: Abdulhamid is 25 years old and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is single man. He has been running an electrical shop.  He has a good relationship with all of his customers. He started his business with a small amount of capital that allowed him to open his business. Due to bad situations in Yemen, he couldn't restock his business with electrical parts. So he is applying for a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy electrical parts like lamps, wires, screwdrivers and fans, since his clientele is increasing. He hopes to continue improving his business and pleasing his customers.

loans.use: to buy electrical parts like lamps, wires, screwdrivers and fans for his business

loans.name: Vitore

texts.en:
Vitore is in her mid-fifties. She is married and has three children whose ages range from 21 to 9 years old. Her oldest child goes to university and the others attend primary and secondary school. Vitore's husband has been paralyzed for a long time and she has been the only financial provider for her family. Vitore says, “The fact that I have been the only one to do everything around home and be the main financial supporter for my family has made it very difficult for me and I can’t hide this. Yet, I feel proud of my hard work and my accomplishments as well. The hardest task for me was to raise the children almost on my own. However, it has been a privilege from God.”

Vitore’s family lives on the outskirts of a little city. For the past nine years, Vitore has owned a store where she has been selling clothes. The business has been doing all right and the clientele is growing. Vitore is applying for the first time for a Kiva loan via VisionFund Albania to purchase more inventory items and she is seeking a positive reception from Kiva lenders. She will use any profits to save for her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy clothing inventory

loans.name: Fany Margarita

texts.es:
Fany, se dedica a la venta de licuados, golosinas, bisutería, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, este negocio lo aprendió por cuenta propia, tiene un año de estar realizándolo.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de frutas para preparar los licuados como naranjas, zapotes, leche, azúcar, tambien comprara boquitas, galletas y bisutería, tambien ocupara parte del préstamo para terminar de pagar el local, con este pago seria ya propio, este préstamo le ayudara a mejorar las condiciones del negocio y a tener más productos, además estará más tranquila trabajando en lo propio.
La aspiración de Fany es ampliar el negocio y poder agregar más rubros al negocio, tambien mejorar la casa, esto le ayudara a generar mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Fany sells fruit drinks, sweets, and costume jewelry. She lives with her husband and two married children. She learned this business on her own and has worked at it for a year. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients such as oranges, zapotes [sapote plum, a regional fruit], milk, and sugar to make the fruit drinks. She also wants to buy snacks, cookies, and costume jewelry. She will use part of the loan to pay for her storefront. With this payment, it will belong to her. This loan will help her improve the conditions of her business and allow her to have more products. She will also feel more secure working in a storefront of her own. 

Fany’s aspirations are to grow her business and add more items. She also wants to improve her house. This would help her make better earnings.

loans.use: to purchase oranges, zapotes, milk, sugar, snacks, cookies, and costume jewelry

loans.name: Yulia

texts.ru:
Юлия не замужем. У нее нет детей. Юля имеет собственный бизнес.

Юлия торгует товарами для животных. Она работает в этой сфере 5 лет. Юлия знает на какой товар есть спрос. Раньше она работала реализатором в этом же направлении, но хозяйка решила сократить расходы и уволила ее. Юлия не теряя времени открыла свое дело.  Это говорит о том, что она не боится трудностей. Юлия общительная и инициативная. В будущем собирается открыть дополнительную торговую точку.

Юлия просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 21000 гривен на увеличение ассортимента сухого корма. Дополнительную прибыль вложит в бизнес.
texts.en: Yulia is not married and has no children.  She has her own business.  She sells pet food.  She has been working in this area for five years.  Yulia knows which merchandise is in demand.  She previously worked as a seller in this same area, but the owner decided to cut her expenses and laid her off.  Without losing time, Yulia opened her own business.  This tells us that she is not afraid of difficulties.  Yulia is very sociable and has initiative.  In the future, she plans to open an additional retail outlet.  Yulia is requesting a loan in the amount 21,000 hryvnia to expand the selection of dried pet food.  She will invest the additional profit into the business.

loans.use: to expand the selection of pet food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is taking out another loan of KES 20,000 to expand her existing business. With the loan, she plans to purchase more fish for sale. Since the last loan, her monthly income has really increased and she hopes this loan will make her business grow.
Her aim is to open several businesses including a retail shop. Thanks for the support given.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Javid

texts.en: Javid is a 21-year-old man who studies at Azerbaijan Technology University. He is on the third year of education studying Technology of Manufacturing Products and Expertise. He will complete his education in 2013. His father and mother are working and paying for his education. However, Javid applied for a job and plans to pay his last year himself. But now he needs 2000 AZN to pay his last bit of tuition.

loans.use: to pay university tuition fee.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella is still selling wedding flowers and clothes, and she will use the loan to buy wedding flowers and clothes for sale.

The anticipated profits will be used to diversify her business. This is her second loan from KADET LTD  and she has successfully repaid her previous loan.

Her hopes and dreams are to own tents and chairs for hire and also to open other branches outside Kamulu.

loans.use: to buy wedding flowers and clothes for sale.

loans.name: Chete

texts.en:
Chete is a very enterprising person who is always ready to take risks whenever opportunities arise. She has been working very hard to ensure that her family's needs are met. She says that her business is doing well and she hopes to open a shop in the near future.

Chete's previous loan enabled her to expand her business by buying more livestock to meet her customers' demands. Thanks to her efforts, she has been able to provide for the family's needs. Chete is requesting another loan of KES 15,000 to clear her brother's school fees balance. Thanks for your support.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Moslah

texts.en: Moslah is a 38-year-old man living in Sana'a. He is married and the father of six young children. Moslah attended high school and studied at university. He has opereated a barber salon for 12 years in order to feed his family. Moslah has applied for a loan of 80,000 YER to buy barber equipment for his business. He hopes to enroll his children in private school.

loans.use: to buy barber equipment for his business

loans.name: Haidr Group

texts.en:
This group is called Haidr and consists of three members: Nama, Asmhan and Asma. They live in Sana`a, Yemen. They are hardworking and close relations. They took out a loan of 90,000 YER. 

Nama is 50 years old, a married woman, and has nine children who live in Sana`a, Yemen.  (She is the woman sitting in the centre.) She has been selling incense and clothes for one year. She strives to offer a good life for her family. She applied for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB to buy additional incense and ladies' clothes to increase her profit for her business. She hopes to expand her business to open a perfume and incense store.

loans.use: to buy additional incense and ladies' clothes to increase her profit for her business

loans.name: Alphus

texts.en:
Alphus is 31 years old and a business man. He is married to Jacinta who is a business lady. They are blessed with two children aged five and two years old. He has been in an electrical welding business for the past two years with the monthly income of KES. 19,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Alphus will use the loan to buy welding metals and machines. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children up to university level. 

His hopes and dreams are to open an electronics shop and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy welding metals and machines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a dairy unit and buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Zoodnooma De Zongo Group

texts.fr:
Mme PINGDWENDE  SAFIATOU est responsable du groupe ZOODNOOMA DE ZONGO. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 06ans et le moins âgé a 04ans. Un va à l’école. Elle a 01 personne en charge.

Mme vend des habits et pommades depuis 02ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10. Ses clients sont les nouvelles mamans, les femmes et aussi les hommes.

Elle veut s’acheter 03 douzaines d’habits pour enfants, 05 pièces de pagnes et 20 boites de différentes pommades.
Mme veut avec ses bénéfices améliorer son activité et épargner. Elle ambitionne aider ses frères pour leur scolarité, aider son père à construire une maison.
texts.en:
Mrs. PINGDWENDE SAFIATOU is the leader of the group ZOODNOOMA DE ZONGO. She is a married mother of two children aged 4 and 6, one of them in school. She supports one person.

Mrs. PINGDWENDE SAFIATOU has been selling clothing and pomades for two years. She buys her merchandise at the market of sector 10. Her customers are new mothers, and generally men and women.

She wants to buy three dozen outfits for children, five pagnes and 20 boxes of various pomades. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and add to her savings. Her goal is to support her brothers’ education and help her father to build a house.

loans.use: to buy three dozen outfits for children, five pagnes, and 20 boxes of various pomades.

loans.name: Martha Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Martha sigue con su venta de tortillas, pues ha mantenido su clientela, palmeando los tres tiempos, siendo una mujer trabajadora, madre soltera de dos hijas  dando estudio, Martha ah venido mejorando su casa en ciclos, gracia a los préstamos obtenidos en Afodenic.
Con este nuevo préstamo es para continuar la construcción de un porche, cerrando la parte de enfrente para luego construir el resto de paredes de concretos, ya tiene un comienzo, comprara: bloques, cemento, arena y láminas de zinc, perlines, golosos para comenzar la obra, en donde está contenta por el avance y seguridad de su nueva vivienda.
texts.en:
Martha is continuing with her tortilla sales, as she has kept her clientele. Making them by hand three times a day, she is a hard working woman. She is a single mother of two daughters, for whom she provides education. Martha has come in cycle making improvements to her house, thanks to the loans she has obtained from Afodenic. 

With this new loan she will continue building a porch, enclosing the front part to then build the rest of the walls with concrete. She has already started and will buy blocks, cement, sand, corrugated roofing, roof beams and bolts/screws to begin the work. In this she is content with the advances and safety of her new house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to continue her porch.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.es:
Sherly tiene 28 años, su esposo desde hace 7 años es Luis, con quien tiene una hija de hace algunos meses de nacida. Su casa es propia y está ubicada en la localidad de Pilcomayo.
Desde joven comenzó a trabajar por sí sola, pues su lema es “progresar”.  Su principal actividad es la venta de comida. En sus inicios tenía un restaurante donde vendía comida casera, con el tiempo adquirió un lugar más atractivo, pues se ubicaba en una zona céntrica donde alquiló un espacio grande; ahí comenzó a vender tamales, café, jugos y bebidas diversas y pequeños aperitivos. Ella trabaja sin descanso, de lunes a domingo, ya que de esa manera obtendrá buenos resultados. A la par afrontó un nuevo reto, se casó y conformó una familia, la que ahora se fortaleza con la llegada de su primera hija. Su objetivo ahora es invertir en su restaurante y hacerlo conocido.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Los emprendedores” y este es su sexto crédito con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en los anteriores créditos que tuvo. Y le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque todos los integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Sherly invertirá este dinero en la compra de insumos para la preparación de sus alimentos y si el dinero le alcanza podrá colocar mayólicas en el piso de su casa.
texts.en:
Sherly is 28 years old, and has been married to her husband, Luis, for seven years. They have one daughter, who is a few months old, and they live in their own house, which is located in Pilcomayo.

When she was young, Sherly started working for herself, and her motto is "progress." She makes a living selling food items, and started out her business selling homemade food in her own restaurant. Over time, she relocated to a nicer space, and she now operates a restaurant in the central part of town, where she rents a larger space. She sells tamales, coffee, juices, various drinks and appetizers. She works tirelessly seven days a week, and has done well as a result of her hard work. A new challenge for her has been balancing marriage, a new daughter, and her work. Her goal is to invest in her restaurant and make it a well known establishment. 

Sherly belongs to the solidarity group "Los emprendedores" (The Entrepreneurs), and this is her sixth loan with MFP. She hopes that the support from this loan will help her to complete her goals. She promises to make all payments on time, as she has done with previous loans. She is grateful to be part of this organization, as all the members are responsible and solid people.

With the support from this loan, Sherly plans to purchase input items for making her food dishes. If she has enough money left over, she hopes to also tile the floor of her home.

loans.use: to purchase input items and ingredients for making her food dishes.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a hardworking and kind woman who has been selling firewood for the past several years. She is an entrepreneur. Fatuma is taking out another loan so as to expand on the existing business and even fund her newly established coconut-selling business. With the income she earned from the previous loan, she was able to increase her sales through more sales of firewood. Fatuma is requesting a loan to purchase more firewood and coconuts to expand her businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood and coconuts.

loans.name: Abdulkaream

texts.en:
Abdulkaream, 25, runs a grocery store. He started his business six years ago and has earned a decent profit. Currently it is a main income source for his family. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen.
He is taking a youth loan of 120,000 YER from AMB to buy some groceries to increase the stock of his grocery store, like canned food and soft drinks. He plans to buy a taxi.

loans.use: to buy some groceries to increase the stock of his grocery store like canned food and soft drinks for his business.

loans.name: Natiq

texts.en: Natiq is 22 years old and a student of Azerbaijan Technology University. He is in his third year of education on Standardizing and Technology Machines. His parents work and pay for his education. Now Natiq has more time to search for a job to pay for his last year of education. For this purpose he applied for 1400 AZN. He is going to pay this loan partly himself and partly with the help of his parents.

loans.use: to pay education fees.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul, 44 years old, is a livestock businessman. He is married to Petronila. a mixed crop farmer. They are blessed with three children aged 18, 16 and 12. Paul has been in the livestock trading business for the past six years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000, which he uses to support his family.   

Paul is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD, having repaid the previous loan successfully. He will use the loan to buy more goats and sheep to sell. Paul will use the anticipated profit from the business to educate his children. His hope and dream is to buy a pickup for transporting livestock to the nearby markets.

loans.use: to buy more goats and sheep to sell

loans.name: Cosmos

texts.en: Cosmos bought merchandise with his previous Kiva loan, which helped him grow. He has a store located in his home and things are going well for him. He is asking for a new Kiva loan so he can buy more food products to satisfy his customers’ needs and a second-hand motorcycle to help him in supplying his products. Having an assortment allows him to sell more and increase his working capital. His message to the Kiva lenders is, “Blessings for all of you and I wish you the best!"

loans.use: to buy food products for resale and a second-hand motorcycle

loans.name: Irungu

texts.en:
Irungu is 69 years old. A business man, he is widower with six adult children. He has been in the quarry business for the past 20 years with the monthly income of KES. 10,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Irungu will use the loan to buy another quarry plot and pay school fees for his son. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will keep goats and sheep. His hopes and dreams are to venture into the livestock keeping business.

loans.use: to buy another quarry plot and pay school fees for his son.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more stock of scratch cards (calling cards).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for renovations to her salon and purchase beauty and hair design supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for renovating her studio into a working classroom.

loans.name: Nabila

texts.en:
Nabila is a mother of four grown children from Nazareth. She has a traveling store where she sells clothing, linens and undergarments. Originally Nabila decided to try and sell products from her car. She began with household items and supplies and then started with women’s clothes, undergarments sheets and towels after customer demand proved these to be the best selling items. Nabila has built up a steady flow of clientele and become known throughout the city.

Nabila is widening her merchandise and needed this loan for larger amounts of stock. She is able to buy in bulk and thus make a respectable profit on her resale

Nabila's items are good quality and she sells at competitive prices. With the ability to buy large quantities of the bestselling items, she is able to assure low buying costs which allow for decent profits while satisfying customers. She wants to continue and strengthen her business and branch out to another mobile store one day in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of stock, including women's clothing, undergarments, towels and linens.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Sabina es socia del Banco Comunal Delfín y tiene 54 años de edad, es casada y madre de 7 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 3 años y se dedica a la venta de cereales y animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Le gustan mucho las capacitaciones que recibe en si Banco Comunal por que allí aprendió y aún está aprendiendo más a mejorar en su negocio, también le permite distraerse ya que comparte sus experiencias con sus demás compañeras, ella dice que es muy bonito asistir a sus reuniones por que su promotora les hace reír y es bien amena. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá viajando a las ferias para comprar animales menores como patos, gallinas, cuyes y también cereales como trigo, maca, quiwicha para así venderlos en el mercado.
texts.en:
Sabina is a member of the Communal Bank Delfín and is 54 years old. She is married and the mother of seven children. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for three years and makes a living selling grains and small animals like guinea pigs and chickens. She likes the training the receives much in her Communal Bank because there she learned and is still learning more to improve her business. It also allows her to be distracted since she shares her experiences with the other members. She says that it is very nice to attend the meetings because her promoter makes them laugh is very entertaining. 

The loan she is requesting will be invested in traveling to the markets to buy small animals such as ducks, chickens and guinea pigs, as well as grains such as wheat, 'maca' (root vegetable from the Andes) and amaranth to then sell them in the market.

loans.use: to buy small animals such as ducks, chicken and guinea pis.

loans.name: Janneth

texts.en:
Janneth is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya, and the mother of seven children, five of whom are adults. She has been farming for twenty years and currently runs her farm with the help of one farmhand. Janneth sells her produce, comprised mainly of maize, milk and horticultural products, to the local market. She also runs a secondhand clothes retail business and a cereal milling plant.

Janneth has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She is optimistic that her businesses will pay with better returns and assist her in paying for the education of her two children still in school. Janneth says the major challenge occurs during high production seasons; however, this is not a major challenge for milk production though it is acute for farmers producing only cereals such as maize.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is widowed and has four children, two of whom attend school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren and sister's children). Regina has operated a tailoring business for the last 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX (Uganda shillings) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more rolls of clothing materials, thread and a new sewing machine. Regina doesn’t have any other income generating activities. She works seven days a week and sells at retail to all categories of people. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.

Regina hopes to own a tailoring school and to build rental rooms. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Regina's monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing materials, thread and a new sewing machine

loans.name: Francis F.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Grafton, on the outskirts of Freetown, Sierra Leone's capital city. With the help of this loan, this group of teachers will be able to buy or invest in things that their mere salaries alone cannot let them do. And at the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for making the deductions and the repayments on their behalf.

Francis is the leader of this group.  The 55-year-old is a native of Kailahun town. He is married to a housewife and the couple has six children. Francis has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials like cement and iron corrugated zincs in order to augment his current house-building project.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like cement and iron corrugated zincs in order to augment his current house building project

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 60 años. Vive en compañía de sus inquilinos, quienes son como una familia. Su casa la compró hace 30 años y está ubicada en el asentamiento humano Justicia Paz y Vida.  
A pesar de su edad, continua trabajado muy arduo, “me siento muy ágil”, comenta. Su principal actividad consiste en la venta de gelatina, flan, leche asada y dulces en dos colegios de su localidad. Prepara los postres durante la mañana, los acomoda en una bandeja y en baldes, y se dirige a la escuela donde espera a la salida de los niños para ofrecer sus productos. Luego de vender lo necesario, se dirige a la otra escuela. Después de mucha caminata y esfuerzo termina su día, y después comienza a vender sus productos de belleza. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y espera poder tener las fuerzas para seguir haciéndolo.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe, pues podrá concretar los objetivos de su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que aprende mucho con los integrantes de su grupo.
Victoria invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de gelatinas, cucharas y vasos descartables, además de bolsas de plástico para preparar sus dulces.
texts.en:
Victoria, age 60, lives with her renters, who are like a family.  She bought her house 30 years ago, and it is located in the Justicia Paz y Vida human settlement.  In spite of her age she continues working very hard, “I feel very spry,” she says.

Her primary business activity is selling gelatin, flan, pudding, and sweets at two local schools.  She prepares the desserts in the morning.  She arranges them on a tray and in buckets.  She then heads to the school where she waits for the children to exit in order to sell her products.  After selling what she needs to, she heads to the other school.  After much walking and effort she finishes her day.

Then she starts to sell her beauty products.  She is a very hard-working woman, and she hopes to be able to have the strength to continue on this way.

This is her second loan with MFP, and she is grateful for the financial support she receives.  She will be able to achieve her objectives in her business. She pledges to be punctual with her payments since she learns a lot from the members of her group.

Victoria will use the requested money to buy gelatin, spoons, disposable glasses, and plastic bags in order to prepare her sweets.

loans.use: to buy gelatin and utensils in order to prepare her sweets.

loans.name: Rugiatu's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Calaba town, in Freetown, Sierra Leone's capital city. Teachers of this school, like their colleague teachers in all SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to request loans. These loans are very helpful in helping them solve certain financial constrains that their mere salaries alone cannot let them solve. And at the end of each month, they repay their loans using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

James is the leader of this group of teachers. James is married with six children. He has served in the teaching profession for many years now. With the help of this loan, James is going to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Allieu's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Cassel Farm in Freetown, Sierra Leone's capital city. This group of teachers have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to solicit a loan of 13,800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. And at the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for making the repayment on their behalf.

Isatu is the leader of this group of teachers. The 45-year-old is a native of Freetown. She is married and has three school-going children. Isatu has been a teacher for many years now. She has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Moijueh J.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers of a secondary school in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. This group of teachers have come to Kiva lenders, through SMT, to request a loan. With the help of this loan, they are empowered to meet their immediate finacial challenges and at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. 

Moijueh is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Kailahun about 46 years ago, he is married and has one child. Moijueh has been in the teaching profession for many years now. He has requested for this loan in order to buy household equipment.

loans.use: to buy household equipment

loans.name: James Fefegula's Group

texts.en:
Above is a photo of some primary school teachers in Rokel, on the outskirts of Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. Like their counterparts in other SMT operational areas, they have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request a loan. With the help of this loan, they are empowered to meet certain financial challenges unattainable with only their salaries. At the end of each month, they repay Kiva lenders using their monthly salaries. Their school bursar is directly responsible for making the repayments on their behalf.

James is the leader of this group. The 40-year-old is a native of Bonthe and has been serving as a teacher for many years. He is married and has 3 children. James has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials such as cement and corrugated roofing sheets for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials such as cement and corrugated roofing sheets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Roberto Juvenal

texts.es:
Roberto es un hombre de 43 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, caracterizada por su clima cálido y gente acogedora; Roberto siempre ha sido una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo por salir adelante y apoyar a su familia; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos no pudo cursar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado poder estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Civil; en sus ratos libre le gusta conducir y apreciar los hermosos paisajes de la ciudad.
Por iniciativa propia y con mucho empeño, desde hace varios años Roberto se desempeña como chofer de taxi, él cuenta con su propio vehículo el cual lo utiliza para trabajar, desde tempranas horas de la mañana Roberto sale a buscar pasajeros, él labora un aproximado de 8 horas diarias y puede atender a un promedio de 40 clientes, Roberto se encuentra a gusto realizando su trabajo y cree que le va bien debido a su buen servicio y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Roberto se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un juego de llantas y parlantes para su vehículo; de esta manera Roberto contará con un auto en buena condiciones y podrá brindar un mejor servicio, así aumentará sus ingresos económicos con los cuales en un futuro no muy lejano desea poder adquirir otro auto para sí poder comenzar su gran sueño de tener una empresa de taxis.
texts.en:
Roberto is 43 years old, single, and lives in the city of Ica, which is known for its hot climate and friendly people. Roberto has always been a kind, enthusiastic and hard-working person, who has a great desire to get ahead and support his family. Unfortunately, since he has to spend all his time working to pay his bills, he has not been able to pursue a professional career, though he would have liked to study civil engineering. In his free time, Roberto likes to drive around and take in the beautiful landscapes of his home city and region.

Of his own initiative and through his hard work, Roberto was able to start up a taxi service several years ago. He has his own car, and he starts driving early every morning to look for passengers. He works about 8 hours every day, and can attend up to 40 clients per day. Roberto enjoys his work, and believes that things are going well because he offers a good service and is kind to all he meets.

Roberto is very grateful for this opportunity, and hopes to use the support from this loan to purchase a set of tires and speakers for his taxi. By sprucing up his car, he hopes that he will be able to offer a higher quality service to his customers, and will therefore increase his income. His goal is to buy another car in the future, and to work toward his dream of owning a large taxi business.

loans.use: to purchase tires and speakers for his car.

loans.name: Ayder Luis

texts.es: El señor Ayder, es comerciante de cal empacada, actividad comercial que tiene desde hace dos años, su capital inicial fue de ahorros propios del cliente y ayuda económica de su madre, anteriormente él era conductor, su negocio consiste en vender cal empacada en el occidente de Nicaragua a productores de ganado, ferreterías y distribuidoras de la zona. También tiene clientes de una sola entrega, que posteriormente estas personas revenden el producto en zonas mas lejanas de nuestro país.
texts.en:
Ayder has been selling packaged lime powder for two years.  His initial capital came from his own savings and his mother’s financial help.  He was previously a driver.

His business consists of selling packaged lime powder in the western part of Nicaragua.  He sells to livestock producers, hardware shops, and distributors in the area.  He also has customers who receive one delivery and later resell the product in areas further away in our country.

loans.use: to buy lime powder in bulk.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, who is a mother of four children with the last born still schooling, has been an active farmer, meeting her family needs from farming income generated through sale of her cereals and milk produce to the local market.

Mary has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a power generator which will help her with pumping water for her dairy animals and  save her hours engaged in fetching water. She adds the constant supply of water will also open up her business by allowing for growing vegetables.

She is optimistic her business can provide enough income to pay for the education of her last child.

loans.use: To buy a power generator

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a mother of five children, three of whom are still school-going. She has been in farming for over thirty years producing maize, beans, bananas, coffee and milk, part of which go into meeting family requirements with more sold within the local market to provide more income.

Lucy has made a loan request of 47,250 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. This is her third loan with Juhudi Kilimo and she reiterates that the loans have improved her family living standards and educated her first three children. She is looking forward to better education for her remaining children.

She however notes the high cost of feed especially for dairy cows during dry seasons is still a major challenge.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Phidis

texts.en:
Phidis is married with five, all adult, children in her rural home in Kenya. She says farming has been her source of income for the nineteen years she has been actively farming. Her farm has been producing vegetables, maize, beans and milk which she sells within the local market for income to meet other family needs as well as expand her farming business.

Phidis has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water pump and water pipes to establish an irrigation system. She says her previous loan of the same amount really helped improve the living standards of her family and she hopes this subsequent loan will make things better still.

Phidis says harsh climatic conditions are a major limitation in her farming yield but installing an irrigation system will definitely improve the situation.

loans.use: To buy a water pump and irrigation pipes

loans.name: Sinsiria

texts.en:
Sinsiria has been in farming in Nyamira, South Rift, Kenya where she lives with her family of five children. She is aged 52 with half of her life having been spent in farming as the main source of family income. She runs her farm with the help of three farmhands. She is married with five children aged between 16 and 7 years. She now sells her produce which includes coffee, milk, tea, cabbages and sweet potatoes.

Sinsiria has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to spend in setting up a modern dairy unit for her dairy cows. She plans to have at least five dairy cows.She says the farming income will assure her children of better education and future. She reiterates that her aspiration is to provide good housing and education, among other basic needs, to her children.

Sinsiria says the major challenge mainly occurs during high harvests when a lot is produced and sold to the market at very low prices with low returns to farmers' investments.

loans.use: To construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Priska

texts.en:
Priska has been in active farming for over 20 years.  She currently produces coffee, milk, maize, and beans for the local market in her home area in Nyamira in South Rift Kenya. She runs her farm with the help of two farmhands.

Priska is requesting a loan for 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, which she will use to buy two water tanks which will help her supply water for her dairy cows. She will also use the loan to venture into farming vegetables. She says that better production of vegetables and other grocery products will boost her grocery retail business which she has been carrying out concurrently with farming. She hopes to expand her grocery business to the wholesale scale in the next five years.

loans.use: to purchse two water tanks.

loans.name: Ercilda Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Ercilda, es comerciante de cal empacada, actividad comercial que tiene desde hace 10 años, su negocio lo inicio con créditos otorgado por productores de cal de la zona de san Rafael del sur y posteriormente con pequeños créditos de algunas microfinancieras, anteriormente ella vendía gaseosas y vendía carne de cerdo, su negocio consiste en vender cal empacada en el norte de Nicaragua a productores de ganado, ferreterías y distribuidoras de la zona. El crédito que solicito con ceprodel fue para capital de trabajo con lo que se proyecta en mejorar sus niveles de ingresos sobre sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ercilda has a business selling lime in bulk. She has been engaged in this activity for the past 10 years.  She started the business using loans that were provided by lime producers in the southern area of San Rafael.  Later she made use of small loans from various microfinance institutions and also sold soft drinks and pork.

Currently she sells bulk lime in the northern part of Nicaragua to livestock farmers, hardware stores and distributors in the area.  The loan she is seeking through CEPRODEL is for working capital so that she can improve her sales and her income.

loans.use: to purchase lime in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials and equipment to make wafers.

loans.name: Mirian Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Mirian es Originaria de un poblado del departamento de león, se  desempeña como conserje de un instituto de la misma población con 24 años  de laborar, además también tiene un pequeño negocio atravez de ahorro de su salario, el que tiene 11 años de ejercerlo como es la venta de Ropa , Calzados, Pintura, Vanidad, perfume y Ropa Interior. esto en busca como tener otros ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida, su unidad familiar está compuesta por  2 hijos de los cuales 1 está bajo su cargo y estudia en el colegio de la localidad, también ha sido cliente de esta empresa desde el 2004, con 6 créditos recibidos, una de las necesidades que presenta es de comprar más productos  para incrementar su inventario de su negocio y poder satisfacer la demanda existente, por tal razón decidió visitar las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento y lograr el objetivo, los financiamientos anteriores les han sido de gran impactos en la mejoría de sus condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mariana is from a town in the department of León.  She’s been working as a caretaker at a local institution for 24 years.  She also has a small business she started with savings from her salary that’s been in operation for 11 years.  She sells clothes, shoes, paint, make-up, perfume and underwear.  She does this in order to earn extra income and improve her conditions and her standard of living.

Her family unit contains her two children one of whom is still in her care and attending the local school.  She’s been a client of this institution since 2004 and has gotten six loans.  

One of her current needs is to buy more products to increase her business inventory to meet existing demand which is why she decided to visit the Ceprodel offices to request financing to reach this goal.  Previous loans had a great impact in improving her conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Francisco Andrés

texts.es: El señor francisco, es propietario de una pulpería ubicado en la comunidad de san pablo, tiene dos años de dedicarse a esta actividad, estableció su negocio gracias al apoyo económico de sus padres, el es ingeniero en sistemas y ha decidido en trabajar por cuenta propia por la falta de oportunidad de empleo en nuestro país, sin embargo tiene un alto espíritu de supera ración y cree que este crédito le abrirá la oportunidad de seguir obteniendo financiamientos para desarrollar su actividad comercial y llevarlo a otro nivel.
texts.en: Francisco owns a grocery store located in the community of San Pablo.  He’s been in business two years.  He opened the store thanks to economic support from his parents.  He is a computer programmer but has decided to work for himself due to the lack of employment opportunities in our country.  Nevertheless, he has a strong spirit of self-improvement and he believes that this loan will open the opportunity to continue obtaining loans to develop his commercial activity taking it to another level.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Mario Donaldo

texts.es: El señor Mario, es propietario de un taller de carpintería en la comunidad de los Gutiérrez norte, tiene tres años de dedicarse a esta actividad, antes de tener su taller él era vendedor de muebles y espejos decorados patas de león, y gracias al conocimiento y a la habilidad que adquirió, decidió en invertir para comprar sus propias herramientas y establecer su propio negocio, el aprendió el oficio de la carpintería desde muy joven, lo que le permitió llegar a tener su propio local de trabajo y desarrollarse de forma independiente.
texts.en: Mario owns a carpentry shop in the community of Gutiérrez Norte.  He’s been in this line of work for three years.  Prior to having his workshop he worked selling furniture and mirrors decorated in Lion’s Paw style and thanks to the skills obtained decided to buy his own tools and open his own business.  He learned carpentry when still very young which made it possible for him to have his own place of work and to develop independently.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Jonathan Ismael

texts.es:
El trabajo de educación requiere de mucho sacrificio y seguimiento en la enseñanza aprendizaje, Consciente de esto,  El señor Jonathan  se dedica a laborar como maestro de Secundaria  un colegio técnico del departamento de león,  atendiendo a jóvenes  de varias edades en el colegio donde dignamente imparte el pan de la enseñanza,  y cuya preocupación principal es la educación en estas personas ya que son el futuro de la nación y el mejoramiento de los niveles de vida.
El acude a Ceprodel porque requiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de una Computadora la cual le ayudara a agilizar sus actividades como maestro y también en sus estudios universitarios ya que el desarrollo tecnológico permite la utilización de las mismas,  Esto con el fin de garantizar un desarrollo más avanzado de sus clases, la inversión le vendría a garantizar el nivel de Desarrollo y por ende la enseñanza misma, ya que también viene a mejorar su nivel de vida que tanto lo requiere para beneficio propio y familiar.
texts.en:
Work in education requires much sacrifice and follow-through in teaching/learning.  Aware of this, Jonathan works as a secondary school teacher at a technical school in León Department teaching youngsters of various ages in the school where he imparts knowledge with dignity.  His main concern is educating these people since they are the future of the nation and to improve standards of living.

He calls on Ceprodel because he wants to request a loan to buy a computer that will help him streamline his teaching duties and also to use in his university courses since technological development allows their use.  This is with the goal in mind of insuring a more advanced development in his classes.  The investment would guarantee his level of development thus his actual learning since he will also be improving his standard of living which he so needs both for his own and his family’s benefit.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Mary Lourdes

texts.en:
Mary Lourdes is 41 years old and lives in Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

Mary Lourdes catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for seven years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 to  purchase gasoline, hooks, nets and other fishing materials. Mary Lourdes has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Mary Lourdes hopes to save more for her family.

loans.use: To purchase gasoline, hooks, nets and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Merilou

texts.en:
Merilou is 32 years old and lives in Southern Poblacion, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

Merilou has a general store and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month. She has requested a loan of 15,000 to purchase assorted groceries like noodles, cooking oil, and shampoo.
 
Merilou has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Merilou hopes to increase her income to cover the daily expenses of her family.

loans.use: To purchase assorted groceries like noodles, cooking oil, and shampoo for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods for his used clothing business.

loans.name: Brando Angel

texts.es:
Brando es un hombre de 24 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con su amada pareja y sus 2 pequeños hijos; Brando es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos para sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos familiares no pudo cursar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado poder estudiar la carrera de Administración de Empresas; en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus pequeños y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo de su pareja, desde varios años Brando trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, él cuenta con su propio vehículo el cual adquirió con mucho esfuerzo con ahorros de trabajos anteriores, Brando trabaja un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y puede atender un promedio de 40 clientes, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a su trato amable y respetuoso.
Brando se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar  el mantenimiento y refacción de su vehículo, ya que requiere arreglar el motor de su mototaxi, el cual está consumiendo mucha gasolina; de esta manera Brando contará con un vehículo en buenas condiciones y así brindará un mejor servicio e incrementará sus ingresos económicos, con los cuales mas adelante desea adquirir un auto brindar servicios de taxi y trabajar en él y con ello desea poder cumplir su gran sueño de poder asegurar el futuro y bienestar de sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Brando is a 24-year-old man. He lives in the town of Ica, in the district of Parcona, with his beloved partner and their two small children. Brando is a very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person, who devotes all his efforts to getting his family ahead. Unfortunately, due to his need to work and pay for his family's expenses, he couldn't pursue a professional career, but he would have liked to have studied for a career in business administration. In his free time, he enjoys playing soccer with his little ones and sometimes he cooks a delicious "arroz con pollo" (chicken and rice) that he shares with his family.
On his own initiative and thanks to the support he gets from his partner, Brando has worked as a motorcycle taxi driver for many years. He has a vehicle of his own, which he purchased with a lot of effort by saving money from previous jobs. Brando works approximately 10 hours a day and he's able to serve an average of 40 customers. He feels comfortable in his work and believes that his business does well because of his friendly, respectful manners.
Brando is very thankful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he'll be able to do maintenance and renovations on his vehicle. He needs to fix the engine in his motorcycle taxi, since it consumes a lot of gasoline. That way Brando will have a vehicle in good condition and provide a better service. He'll increase his profits, which later on he'll use to purchase a car in order to work with it in providing taxi services. By doing that he wishes to achieve his biggest dream of being able to ensure his little children's future and well-being.

loans.use: to do maintenance and renovations on his vehicle.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica departamento de león, originario de una comarca aledaña  El señor Julio es Felizmente  Casado, de profesión Productor Agropecuario actividad que ejerce desde sus ancestros quienes lo enseñaron a trabajar de esa manera,  tiene 47 años de realizar dicha actividad, legado que le ha dejado a sus hijos con los que han ido trabajando a la par de él y hoy algunos ya son independientes.
Desde que inicio su negocio El señor Julio lo que es la Agricultura en pequeñas areas  se esforzó por mejorar y emprender otra actividad como es la Crianza de Ganado tanto de leche como para el trabajo agrícola, siendo las ambas de gran fortaleza económica tradicional desde sus padres y de esa manera mantener su familia la que es independiente por su propia cuenta y hoy vivir la vejez de manera satisfactoria y realizada con sus hijos formados con sus familias propias, además tiene un area de bosques las que tiene de manera  organizada una de la necesidad es la compra de un toro semental para seguir completando la actividad pecuaria..
texts.en: Julio is originally from a neighboring region of the town of Telica, in León department.  He is happily married and a farmer.  He learned the business from his ancestors and has been in this line of work for 47 years.  Julio has, in turn, taught the business to his own children who have worked alongside him.  Some of his children are now independent.  Julio has worked hard to improve his farming business and also start another business, raising cattle, both for producing milk and for farm work.  Both of his businesses have traditionally been of great financial help since his parents' time.  Julio has been able to support his family through his businesses and now he can live a decent old age as his children have formed their own families.  Julio also owns an area of woodland.  One of his needs is to buy a stud bull so that he can continue working in his agricultural businesses.

loans.use: to buy a stud bull

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por medio de catálogos, este negocio es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para salir adelante, ya que vive sola.
Desea invertir en comprar más mercancía ya que tiene varios pedidos pendientes para entregar y no quiere que sus clientas  no la quieran esperar a que les surta sus productos de belleza y ya no le compren. Este tipo de negocio abunda en la ciudad ya que deja buenos ingresos y es una forma de conocer gente y socializar de muy buena forma. Como nosotros apoyamos a este tipo de personas emprendedoras le brindamos ala oportunidad de seguir dando pasos hacia adelante.
texts.en:
Rosa sells beauty products via catalogues; this business is her source of income to get ahead since she lives alone.  She wants to buy more merchandise since she has several pending orders to fill and she does not want her customers to have to wait until she stocks up with products lest they stop buying from her.  

This type of business is rife in the city since it produces good income and it’s a way of getting to know people and socialize in a healthy way.  Because we at Ceprodel support this type of enterprising person we provide the opportunity for her to continue taking steps forward.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and pay her suppliers.

loans.name: Ramiro De Jesús

texts.es:
Ramiro de Jesús, inicia a ofertar su producto desde las 3:00 am, su mayor demanda son clientes que compran al por mayor y al detalle, cierra su negocio hasta las 7:00 pm según su movimiento y está ubicado en uno de los mercado de la ciudad de León. El señor realiza este tipo de trabajo para el sustento de su familia.


 El señor solicita este crédito que será utilizarlo para la compra de cosechas de plátanos al por mayor.

 Ramiro se siente muy conforme con el crédito que le ha brindado CEPRODEL ya que le ha permitido comprar cosechas de plátano de mejor calidad y mejorar su propia producción.
texts.en:
Ramiro de Jesús starts to sell his product at 3am.  Most of his demand comes from customers who buy at wholesale and retail.  He closes at 7pm according to how much movement there is.  He’s located in one of the markets in the city of León.  He does this type of work in order to support his family. 

He’s asking for this loan to buy entire banana harvests at wholesale.  Ramiro feels very happy with the loan Ceprodel has granted him because it’s made it possible for him to buy better quality bananas and to improve his own production.

loans.use: to buy bananas.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Felicidad es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, venta de cosméticos, venta de verduras, venta de calzados, venta de plásticos, tienda de abarrotes, costura de deportivos.

La señora Felicidad, indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia desde hace tiempo. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de prendas de vestir ella cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió  por referentes de una amiga, que anteriormente había realizado este emprendimiento.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el incremento de capital (compra de prendas de vestir) mismo que comprará de las ferias reconocidas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo venderá de forma ambulante (sin puesto fijo) en la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, ya que ella es viuda y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS” (Entrepreneurial Women) community bank are about to start their seventh loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Exaltación regional office.  This group has eight members and is run by a board of directors which has Felicidad as its treasurer.  The businesses that the members of the group are engaged in vary and include: running a neighborhood store, selling cosmetics, selling vegetables, selling shoes, selling plastic products, running a grocery store and sewing sports clothing.

Felicidad says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for three years, having joined through an invitation from a friend who has been a member for some time.  Felicidad currently has a business selling clothing.  She says that she started this business on the suggestion of a friend who used to be in the same line of work.
