Felicidad will use this loan to increase her capital.  She will buy clothing in the well-known street markets in the city of La Paz and then sell them as an itinerant street vendor (without a fixed sales location) in the city of El Alto.  This work allows her to make income to support her family.  She is a widow and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Felicidad replied that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Palerma

texts.en:
Palerma is married with four children. She is 62 years old and lives in Dullan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, Palerma has a hog fattening business. She has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 2,500. She has requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase feed and piglets. 

Palerma has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Palerma hopes to own a piggery someday.

loans.use: to purchase feed and piglets

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is married with five children. She is 54 years old and lives in Victoria, Oroquieta City.

Emelia sells fruits and vegetables to earn a living and has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase more fruits and vegetables.

Emelia has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Emelia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is married with four children. She is 30 years old and lives in Puntod, Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental.

Juliet sells a variety of snacks to earn a living and has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 14,000 to purchase flour, sugar, milk and other ingredients.

Juliet has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Juliet hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: To purchase flour, milk, sugar, and cooking oil for food production.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is married with two children. She lives in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental.

Perlita sells perfumes to earn a living and has had this business for eight years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 12,000 to  purchase perfumes for her business.

Perlita has been a member of PMPC for eight years.  In the future, Perlita hopes to engage in another business.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes for her business.

loans.name: Manishak

texts.en:
Manishak is involved in agriculture. She runs a farm, where she grows a large variety of vegetables (potatoes, beans, onions, carrots and garlic), barley, wheat and also grows many fruit trees. Manishak's husband helps her with daily agricultural activities. Manishak has applied for this loan to start the land cultivation. In particular she plans to purchase 750 kg of barley seeds, 1200 kg of potato seeds, fuel and 25 bags of fertilzier. The fuel and fertilizer will be uses not only for barley and potato cultivation, but also for autumn sowing, when she will cultivate the wheat. 

Manishak lives with her husband and school-age daughter. Her two elder daughters are married and live apart. Manishak's elder son has left to go abroad to work and support the family, and her younger son serves in the army at present. Manishak wishes to cultivate more land and start raising cattle, too. This is important her for to have enough income, so that her son will come back and get involved in agriculture, too. Manishak greatly evaluates the role of this loan for realization of her purpose.

loans.use: to pay for barley and potato seeds, fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Yeshua Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “YESHUA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Guillermina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de peluches, tejedora de chompas, confección y venta de mandiles, cerrajería, tienda de barrio, costura, venta de rellenos y sopa de fideo, ladrillera.

La señora Guillermina, indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia en la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de ladrillos, ella cuenta que empezó este negocio después de haber trabajado varios años en una fábrica de ladrillos.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la ampliación de su mercadería (compra de ladrillos) mismo que adquirirá de las distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo venderá de forma ambulante (sin puesto fijo) ofreciendo a los dueños que están edificando sus construcciones. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es separada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The “Yeshua” communal bank will start its second cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Juan Pablo Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board headed by Guillermina, the President.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of commercial activities among which we have the sale of stuffed toys, sweater knitting, apron making and selling, metal shop services, neighborhood store, sewing, sale of turnovers and noodle soup and brick making.

Guillermina indicates that she’s been a member of Pro Mujer for four years having joined thanks to an invitation from a girlfriend who’s a member of the institution.  She currently has a brick-making business.  She relates that she started the business after having worked in a brick factory for several years.

The loan she’s asking for now is to expand her merchandise.  She will buy bricks from suppliers in the city of El Alto and then will resell them from place to place (she has no permanent stand).  She sells to owners of building sites.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible since she’s separated and has two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to buy bricks.

loans.name: Cielito Tatiana

texts.es: La Sra. Cielito tiene 22 años, tiene su pareja, ella se dedica al servicio de manicurista y también maquillaje en su salón de belleza que se encuentra en la zona España, de la ciudad de Santa Cruz este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Cielito va a utilizar este préstamo  para la compra de material como esmaltes de uñas y secador de esmaltes por mayor y algunos materiales que necesita y así de esta manera incrementar  su capital de trabajo,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que necesita ampliar su negocio, la Sra. Cielito  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son tener mayor cobertura del mercado y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando materiales y mejorando su trabajo, el deseo de la Sra. Cielito es tener un salon de estetica  mas completo donde ofrezca variedad de servicios de arreglo corporal a su clientela.
texts.en:
Cielito is 22, has a partner, and works as a manicurist and makeup artist in her salon that is located in the neighborhood España, in the city of Santa Cruz.  This loan is her first cycle in the institution.  

Cielito will use this loan to purchase materials such as nail polish and polish dryer wholesale and some materials she needs and thus increase her working capital.  Her reason for requesting this loan is that she needs to expand her business.  Cielito faces challenges in her business such as having greater market coverage and will use the profits to continue to purchase materials and improve her work.  Cielito's desire is to have a more esthetic salon which offers a full range of body services to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as nail polish and polish dryer wholesale.

loans.name: Denis De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Don Denis sigue con su venta de persiana de vidrio, muy demandada por ser bonitas, atreves de los préstamo logro mejor demanda al vender más producto.
Las mejoras a su casa la ah venido haciendo con préstamo otorgados en Afodenic, lo que le ha resultado por ser a plazos, equilibrando sus gastos, aun dos de sus hijos viven con él. Con este nuevo préstamo, va a mejor su techo, ya que esta en malas condiciones por el uso de los años, pasándosele el agua, en esta temporada de invierno. Comprara láminas de zinc y pintura anticorrosiva, para hacer el cambio. Para el bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Denis continues selling glass blinds which are very much in demand because they are beautiful.  Through his previous loans, he has managed to sell more and increase demand for his products.

Denis has been making improvements to his home through loans from Afodenic because he is able to repay in installments and so balance his expenses.  Two of his children still live with him.  Denis will use this new loan to improve his roof because it has deteriorated over the years and water is seeping in during the winter.  He will buy sheets of metal and anti-corrosive paint to make the improvement.  This will contribute to his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets and anti-corrosive paint in order to improve his roof

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna is involved in agriculturue. She runs a farm, where she grows a large variety of fruits and vegetables. She keeps two green houses, where she grows peppers. Ruzanna also cultivates tomatoes and beans, and grows apricot, peach, and plum trees. It is very difficult for Ruzanna to organize the watering process of the land, as there is no special place to gather and keep much water. So Ruzanna has to water the land with a pail, which requires much time and hard work. 

Ruzanna has applied for this loan to build a hole to gather and keep water. This will make the watering process much easier and effective for Ruzanna. With the loan's help Ruzanna also plans to purchase fertilizer and medicine to exploit the land and cultivate the trees. 

Ruzanna lives with her father and daughter. Agriculture is the main source of income for her family. This loan will help Ruzanna to develop her farm and have a stable source of income for her family.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, medicine, and for construction of a hole for water storage

loans.name: Azniv

texts.en:
Azniv is involved in agriculture. Together with her family, she runs a farm, where they raise livestock and cultivate land. Azniv cultivates wheat. She also runs an orchard, where she grows apricot, peach, grape, and grenade fruit trees. Azniv also has a barn, where she bred pigs a few years ago, but had to sell them. Now Azniv would like to start pig breeding again, so she has applied for this loan to purchase young pigs. Azniv also plans to purchase chickens and forage to feed the livestock. 

Azniv lives with her husband, son and daughter. She works at the local school as a teacher, but her salary is too low to cover the family's costs, and they get the main part of their income from selling the harvest from the farm to local traders. The development of her agriculture business will allow Azniv to get more income and insure more prosperous living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to pay for young pigs, chickens, and feed

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is involved in agriculture. She runs a farm, where she keeps a cow, pigs, hens and turkeys, and also cultivates melons, watermelon, apricots, peaches, granatees, walnut trees and a grape orchard. Mariam has applied for this loan to purchase forage for cow and pigs. She also plans to purchase medicine and fertilizer to exploit the land, as well as poles for growing grape trees. Mariam will also purchase fuel to transport her harvest. This loan will greatly help Mariam with the farm and help her to ensure it can develop. 

Mariam lives with her husband, son and three daughters, two of whom are not grown-up yet. Agriculture is important for the family to generate income and make savings to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for forage, medicine, fertilizer, fuel and poles.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is married with two children.  She is 64 years old and lives in Unidos, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

Remedios sells variety of snacks to earn a living and has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase flour, sugar, milk, and other ingredients.

Remedios has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Remedios hopes to have more savings for capital.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, milk, and other snack ingredients.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 41 years old and lives in Polangyuta, Siquijor, Siquijor.  She is married with two children.  

Marlyn has a sari sari store that sells assorted canned goods and other groceries.  She has had this business for one year.  She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase assorted canned goods and other grocery items for the store. 

Marlyn has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative since last month.  Marlyn hopes and dreams that her business will succeed and grow up fast.

loans.use: To purchase assorted canned goods and other items for her grocery.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is 52 years old and lives in Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena. She is married and has 4 children. For the past 10 years, Lolita has worked in the fish industry, selling fish for a living. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase boxes of assorted fish. Lolita has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase boxes of assorted fish

location.town: Plaridel-Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occide

loans.name: Jesus Alberto

texts.es: Jesús  de oficio agricultor se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas,  el originario de Estelí es cliente Kiva, su segundo préstamo fue de gran ayuda porque pudo invertir en su siembra obteniendo mejor rendimiento y calidad en sus productos, incrementaron sus ventas generando a la vez mas ingresos para la familia. Utilizo su segundo préstamo para comprar insumos y pago de mano de obra para sembrar pepino, pero el quiere invertir aun mas en su negocio ya que la demanda de su productos a incrementado es por esta razón que hoy en día solicita de su tercer crédito Kiva al igual para comprar insumos y pago de mano de obra para sembrar tomate, el estima este préstamo será de ayuda ya que podrá mantener su negocio activo y podrá ofrecer a sus clientes un producto de buena calidad además obtendrá buenos rendimientos de su cosecha, venderá a un buen precio para generar mas ganancias que reinvertirá luego en su negocio, su siguiente paso es ampliar su parcela y diversificarse en productos para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes con el objetivo de obtener mejores ingresos y  poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en: Jesús is a farmer by trade; he grows vegetables. This Estelí native is a Kiva borrower and his second loan was of great help, because he was able to invest in his crop. He obtained improved productivity and quality in his crop, which increased his sales and, in turn, resulted in more income for the family. He used his second loan to purchase supplies and pay for labor in order to sow cucumber. However, he wants to invest in his business even more, since demand for his produce has increased. That's the reason why he currently requests his third Kiva loan, also to purchase supplies and pay for labor, so that he can sow tomatoes. He believes that this loan will be of help, because he'll be able to keep his business going and offer his customers high quality goods. Besides, he'll get good productivity in his harvest, and he'll sell it at good prices in order to get more profits that will soon be re-invested in his business. His next step is to expand his plot of land and diversify his produce so he can satisfy his customers' needs. His goal is to obtain higher profits and to be able to get himself and his family ahead.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and pay for labor in order to sow tomatoes.

loans.name: Karen

texts.es:
Karen es una mujer de 25 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con sus padres y su pequeño hijo de 3 añitos; Karen es una persona muy alegre, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos para sacar adelante a su pequeño; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos no pudo cursar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo.
Gracias al apoyo de sus padres, desde hace 2 años Karen puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de paltas, ella realiza sus ventas en el mercado de frutas de su ciudad, en algunas ocasiones adicionalmente vende diversas frutas; ella se encuentra muy a gusto realizando su labor, ya que desde niña sus padres le enseñaron esta labor.
Karen se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de frutas para su venta, especialmente compra gran cantidad de manzanas ya que se acerca la campaña para poder venderlas; de esta manera Karen podrá incrementar sus ventas e ingresos económicos, con los cuales espera poder expandir su negocio y contar con un local más amplio, y así en un futuro no muy lejano desea poder tener su casa propia y cumplir su gran sueño de asegurar el futuro y bienestar de su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Karen, 25, lives in the city of Cañete in Imperial District with her parents and little 3-year-old son.  Karen is a very cheerful, hardworking, enthusiastic person who puts all her efforts into raising her son.  Unfortunately, because she had to go to work to cover her expenses she was unable to study a professional career but would very much have liked to do so.

Thanks to her parents’ support Karen started her business selling avocadoes two years ago in her city’s fruit market.  On occasion she also sells other various fruits.  She’s very happy doing her work because her parents taught her this occupation when she was still a little girl.

Karen is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to buy fruit to sell, especially large amounts of apples since their sale season is approaching.  In this way Karen will be able to increase sales and income that she hopes to use to expand the business and to have a larger locale so that in the not too distant future she will be able to have her own house and reach her great dream of insuring her little boy’s future and wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Angoritas De Ingenio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ANGORITAS DE INGENIO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa, venta de chocolate, tejido de mantas, venta de aceite, venta de zapatos.

La señora Rosa, indica que hace año y medio que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio elaboración y venta de mantas, ella cuenta que realiza los tejidos desde hace años atrás, aprendiendo estos tejidos de un grupo de señoras que emprendieron este negocio.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la ampliación de su mercadería (compra de lana) mismo que adquirirá de las distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo venderá de forma ambulante (sin puesto fijo) en las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “Angoritas de Ingenio” (The Clever Little Goats) will start the first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center.  It has six members led by a governing board headed by Rosa who is the President.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of commercial activities among which we have clothes sales, chocolates sales, blanket weaving, oil sales and shoe sales.

Rosa indicates that she’s been in Pro Mujer for a year and a half having joined thanks to an invitation from one of the institution’s advisors.  She currently has a blanket weaving business.  She relates that she started weaving blankets years ago having learned to weave from a group of women who went into this business.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase her merchandise.  She will buy wool from suppliers in the city of El Alto that she’ll use to make blankets that she’ll subsequently sell from place to place (she has no permanent stand) in various street markets in the city of El Alto.  This way of working makes it possible for her to support her family the best she can since she’s married and has five children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Diosdado

texts.en:
This is Diosdado, who previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that he used to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand his inventory. His earnings were a big help in his personal, household and business expenditures. 

Diosdado would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy a motorcycle and to buy more stocks of products needed in his business. The more items displayed at the store, the better, and more items to sell will result in better profit. Diosdado's business profits will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs and his business expenditures. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Diosdado faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members weekly to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of supplies and products needed in his business

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en: Isidra is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. Isidra provides motorela or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 3 years. Isidra has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy tools and to pay for gasoline. Isidra has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, she hopes to improve her services for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy tools and to pay for gasoline

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.
 
Rosita is selling copra, the dried meat of coconuts, in her local community. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more coconuts for making copra.

Rosita is a new member of HSPF.  In the future, Rosita hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts for making copra.

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita is 45 years old and married, with five children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Charita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Charita has been farming sugarcane for two years, and she earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so that she can send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Danilsa Kariela

texts.es: Danilsa, tiene una pulpería desde hace ocho años, inicio su negocio vendiendo chiverías y caramelos, y durante todo este tiempo de arduo trabajo y perseverancia a logrado crecer como persona y en su actividad económica, actualmente cuenta con un local donde ofrece a sus clientes una gran variedad de productos como granos básicos, ropa, cosméticos, gaseosas, entre otros. Es el primer crédito con ceprodel, sin embargo logre observar en ella un gran entusiasmo de trabajar y desarrollar aun mas su negocio
texts.en: Danilsa has owned a grocery store for the past eight years. She started her business by selling snacks and candy, and during all this time of hard work and perseverance she succeeded in growing both as a person and in her business. She currently owns a store where she offers her customers a wide variety of merchandise such as basic grains, clothing, cosmetics and soft drinks, among other items. This is her first loan with Ceprodel, and nevertheless she displays a great deal of enthusiasm to work and further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, rice, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel es una mujer de 47 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha, se encuentra felizmente casada con su amado esposo quien es maestro de obras de construcción, tiene 3 hijos a quienes ama y desea brindarles lo mejor; Ysabel siempre ha sido una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que ha dedicado todos sus esfuerzos conjuntamente con su esposo para sacar adelante a su familia, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver noticieros y programas educativos en televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo de su familia, desde hace varios años Ysabel puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y puede atender a un promedio de 30 clientes, Ysabel se siente a gusto realizando su trabajo y cree que le va bien ya que sus clientes la buscan por sus productos, precios y buena atención.
Ysabel se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que necesita realizar refacciones a los cuartos de sus hijos, tales como el encofrado, tarrajeo, puesta de piso y otros; de esta manera Ysabel tendrá su vivienda en mejores condiciones brindando un ambiente más seguro; así ella espera poder seguir trabajando y luchando para asegurar el bienestar y futuro de sus hijos, a quienes desea poder brindarles una profesión para que sean hombres de bien y buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Ysabel is a woman of 47, who lives in the city of Chincha.  She is happily married to her beloved husband who teaches construction, and has 3 children whom she loves and wants to give the best. Ysabel has always been a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person. She has devoted all her effort together with her husband to raise her family.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of funds she could not pursue a professional career, but she would have liked to do so.  In her spare time she likes to watch the news and educational programs on television and sometimes she cooks a delicious rice dish with duck to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with support from her family for several years, Ysabel launched a small business selling groceries.  Her work starts in the early morning, she works in her business an estimated 12 hours a day and can serve an average of 30 customers.  Ysabel enjoys doing her job and believes in serving her customers well as they seek her products, pricing and good service.

Ysabel is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, and thanks to their assistance she will be able to improve her home.  She needs spare parts for the children's bedrooms, such as formwork, plaster, flooring etc.  This way Ysabel will have a home in better condition and be better able to provide a safer environment. She hopes to continue working and fighting to ensure the welfare and future of their children.  She wants to be able to give them a profession so that they will grow up to be good people and successful professionals.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 51 years old and married, with four children.

Emelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her general store.

Emelia has borrowed, and repaid, five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years, and she also earns an income from raising pigs.

Emelia aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Noeurb

texts.en:
A villager from Ek Phnom District of Battambang Province, Noeurb is a mother of three kids who still need her support as they are still in school. 

She is now 32 years old, and she has been selling fish for five years to overcome her family's hardship. Her husband has also been trying to help her via raising fish and rice farming. The main difficulty for her family is the high price of rice seed and the crop yield ruined by flood. 

Noeurb has borrowed from VisionFund four times already. The loans, which have all been successfully repaid, have  enabled her to well-manage the cash flow of her family's businesses, rice farming and fish raising. 

Now, she is confident, as a fifth-cycle client, in applying for a new loan with VisionFund in amount of KHR 2,000,000.  She will use the money not only to support her rice farm by buying fertilizers and hiring a laborer for plowing but also to support her fish raising business by purchasing fish feed and more fingerlings for breeding. 

She hopes the loan will gradually improve her businesses, as the past loans have, so she can keep her children in school until tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy farm fertilizers, fish feed, and fingerlings for breeding and to hire a laborer for plowing.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 64 years old and has eight children. She is married and has one child currently going to school.

Evangeline is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pig.

Evangeline has been fattening pigs for ten years now, and she has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed for her pig

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with five children. 

Roberto provides motorcycle services. He has had this business for seven years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for gasoline for his transportation services.

Roberto has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Roberto hopes to improve his services for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline for his motorcycle services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more textiles for making gowns and school uniforms

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is married with 2 children. She is 44 years old and lives in Puntod Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental.
Josefa sells a variety of snacks to earn a living and has had this business for 9 years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 to purchase flour, sugar, milk and other ingredients.
Josefa has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Josefa hopes to repair their house.

loans.use: To purchase flour, milk, sugar, cooking oil and other ingredients

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en: Analisa  is  45  years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Analisa has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Analisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Analisa hopes to improve her business in order to provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Kim Leng

texts.en: Kim Lang is 63 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is an art instructor. In addition, she runs a groceries store at home. She earns approximately $12 each day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $1 per day. Two of her children are dancers. They make the income of $8 daily. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Kim Leng is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce the family’s transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to expand her store and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
This is Edwin.  He previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that he used in buying more quantities of products like rice, chicken, eggs, condiments and seasonings for his food stall. His earnings are a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Edwin would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for him to purchase more ingredients and supplies needed in his business. His profits from the business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs and the educational expenses for his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Edwin hopes to grow his business in the coming years, just as he hopes to support his children's schooling up to the college level. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy raw ingredients for his food stall

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 64 years old, widowed and lives in the Philippines. 

Grace sells cakes for different occasions. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making cakes for different occasions like flour, sugar and eggs .

Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2006.  In the future, Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: by ingredients to make cakes to sell

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
This is Marites.  She previously accessed a 18,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings to sell in her store. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Marites would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses for her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marites hopes to be able to expand soon. She also hopes to send all her children to school and for them to finish college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: buy food to sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
This is Carmelita. She previously accessed a 11,000 PHP loan that she used to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Carmelita would like to apply for another 13,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profit from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses for her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Carmelita hopes to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Floripe

texts.en:
This is Floripe.  She previously accessed a 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items needed in her business. Her earnings are a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Floripe would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy more merchandise items to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on displayed and available on hand the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses for her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Floripe dreams of expanding her business and helping her children finish their studies through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy products to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fabrics to make wedding gowns

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
This is Lourdes. She previously accessed a 29,000 PHP loan that she used to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. Her earnings are a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Lourdes would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profit from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lourdes hopes to grow and expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Ruth sells buko salad in her local community. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients used in making buko salad.

Ruth has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make salad to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Juan tiene 24 años tiene su pareja con quien tienen un hijito de un años de edad, el se dedica a l servicio de radio taxis como  centralista de radio móvil que se encuentran en la zona de Fortaleza, este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Juan utilizara este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción para la conclusión de obra fina de vivienda,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital para la construcción,  Juan enfrenta retos en su negocio que son, el trabajar amanecidas y mantenerse al frente de la competencia, esta es la única actividad con la que mantiene a su familia y utilizara los beneficios para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Señor Juan is 24, and with his partner has a one-year-old little boy.  He makes a living in the radio taxi service as a mobile radio centralist in the Fortaleza area.  This loan is his second cycle with the institution.  Señor Juan will use this loan to buy construction material in order to finish the work on his home.  His reason for requesting this loan is his lack of capital for construction.  The challenges Juan faces in his business include working early mornings and staying ahead of the competition.  This is the only work with which he supports his family, and he will use the profits in order to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy construction material in order to finish the work on his home.

loans.name: Beatriz Group

texts.en:
Beatriz is the leader of a group of three women who live in Liloan, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. Although they borrow as a group, each member has their own business, which they use to support the financial needs of their families. 

Beatriz has requested a loan of 14,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase feed for her pig raising business. In the future, Beatriz and her group members hope that they can earn more income to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pig raising business

loans.name: Renante

texts.en:
Renante is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married, with four children.
 
Renante is providing motorela, or motorcycle, services. He has had this business for seven years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the services.

Renante is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Renante hopes to improve his services for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for his motorcycle services.

loans.name: Mitchel

texts.en:
Mitchel is 43 years old and lives in Polangyuta, Siquijor, Siquijor.  She is married, with two school-age children.

To earn a living, Mitchel has a grocery store business, with monthly income of about PHP 2,500 from doing this type of work.  Mitchel requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase various grocery items for her grocery store.

Mitchel is a newly recognized member of Paglaum Multi  Purpose Cooperative.  Mitchel would like to sustain her business and be able to answer the daily needs of her children in school.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her grocery store

loans.name: Theara

texts.en:
Theara is 25 years old, and her husband Samut is 32 years old. They have been married since 2008 and just have one daughter age five months old. Theara also has an elderly mother and one sister and one nephew living with her. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh.
  
Theara and her husband are garment workers. She is asking for her first loan of $1,300. She will use $700 to help her nephew to launch a business installing cell phone applications and Mp3 and Mp4 player by buying a desktop computer and materials needed in his business. 

Theara will also use $600 of the loan to fill in the land in front of her house.  There are some small ponds, so she needs to fill it in.

loans.use: To help her nephew to launch a business installing cell phone applications and to fill in the land in front of her house.

loans.name: Kosal

texts.en:
Kosal, age 40, is a construction worker. His wife, Nara, age 35, is a bartender. Kosal and his wife live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, and they have two sons. One son attends school, while the other one is still too young for school.  

Kosal is in the process of building a new house (in the photo), but the house is not finished yet. Hence, he has decided to apply for a loan in the amount of $1,500 in order to finish building his house and pay for the building fees.

loans.use: To finish building his house and pay for the building fees

loans.name: Yieng

texts.en: Yieng is a 43-year-old mother of five children. To help with her family's needs, she has been farming for 10 years on a three and a half hectare of farmland in the EK Phnom district of Battambang province. The main challenge for her family's condition is the declining crop yield due to the flood. This is the fourth loan for Yieng with VisionFund. The past loans have helped her to restore her business' loss and have improved her family's living conditions. She is now requesting a new loan of KHR 2,400,000 to purchase fertilizers and rice seeds and hire a laborer for plowing and harvesting. She hopes to earn more income for her family's sake.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and rice seeds and hire a laborer for plowing and harvesting

loans.name: Martinidad

texts.en: Martinidad is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has nine children. Martinidad has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for nine years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Martinidad has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Martinidad hopes to improve her business so that she can pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tools and pay for her motorcycle's gasoline

loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en:
Mrs Myagmarsuren, 62, sells spare parts from used cars. She has been running her business since 2002 in the auto bazaar in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She lives with her husband in her old house in the ger district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and patchy electricity. All of her children have moved out of their parents' house. Myagmarsuren is one of the many hard-working women who try to improve their lives day by day. Over the years, she has built up a lot of permanent customers and she has gained a lot of experience from her business. 

At this time she is requesting a loan to buy spare parts in large quantities so that she can increase her working capital and her sales volume. In addition, she has a plan to open her own spare parts shop in the near future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts in large quantities so that she can increase her sales

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en: Sary leads a group consisting of two members, and this is their third loan cycle. They live in the Mongkul Borey District of Battambang Province, Cambodia. She is a 37-year-old mother and is responsible for three kids who are all students. To manage her household, she grows paddy rice as the main source of income. Additionally, she also raises ducks and chickens. She has been with these businesses for more than 12 years, and she is able to earn about 21,000 KHR to support her family. Sary has taken out two previous loans with VisionFund, and she has completely repaid the loans already. The loans have enabled her to buy a new motorbike and fix her house. She is now seeking a loan of 600,000 KHR, the same amount as her group member. She will use some portion of her loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She is going to use the remaining amount to buy feed as well as build a coop for her chickens and ducks. She hopes to earn more income so that she can expand both of her businesses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, rice seeds, feed, and a coop for her chicken and duck-raising business

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is a married woman with four children. She is 47 years old, and she has had a retail business of firewood and charcoal for several years now. 

Dominga buys and sells charcoal and firewood to the people in her community. This business provides her the income she needs to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially the school expenses of their children.

Dominga joined CEVI hoping to gain access for financial support through loan grants and other services. Dominga is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more items to sell, like charcoal and firewood. She wants to augment her stock in order to reach out to a greater number of customers in their locality and to avoid shortages of supply. 

In the near future, Dominga hopes to reinvest in this retail business and to bring it to a larger scale to cater more clients. Moreover, she is persistent in sending her children to school to attain a higher level of learning, which is essential for a bright future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, like charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Sol's Group

texts.en:
Living in the village of Sangke district of Cambodia, Sol is 41 years old and the married father of four children, three of whom still depend on him.
 
Sol is a rice farmer on 12 hectares of farmland.  He has been in this business for 20 years. To earn extra income, he also works as a paid worker in a local area to support his family’s needs. Sol can earn approximately KHR 11,100 per day. The main challenge of his family's business is crop yields ruined by flood.

Sol’s group consists of two members.   They have been with VisionFund for four cycles and successfully paid back the past loans. Sol has successfully used the loans to relieve his family's burden and improve his livelihood. 

Now Sol is leading his group to apply for a loan with VisionFund of KHR 1,400,000 each. As the group leader, he is going to use his portion to buy fertilizers for his farmland. He hopes to increase his crop yields so as to increase his family's income to improve his living standard.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his farmland.

loans.name: Uuganbayar

texts.en:
Uuganbayar, 30 years old, is a driver, and he has worked for the freight transportation company since last year. He has been driving for a decade. He is one of the skillful drivers, or so his co-workers have judged him.  Currently he lives with his wife and his two children, one 3 years old and other 9 years old.  His wife Altantuya is unemployed.   She cares for the children at home. 

Uuganbayar’s monthly salary is not enough for his family; it does not usually meet his family's necessities. Therefore he wants to have his own business to increase his family income. Recently he decided to buy a car from the auto market to run a taxi beyond his job. He believes it will be very helpful for his family and stop the money shortage in the future.   As of now, he has chosen one Korean car, a popular one in Mongolia. The loan he is taking will be used to cover the cost of his buying the car to run a taxi.

loans.use: To cover the cost of his purchasing a car to run a taxi.

loans.name: Chinbat

texts.en:
Mr Chinbat, 40, is a musician who plays the violin in a drama theatre. His wife works with him and plays other instruments. They have both been doing their jobs for 19 years. Now he lives with his family in an apartment, which he bought recently. It is located in the boundary district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The apartments were built in the socialist era and they have not been repaired or renovated since they were built. Most of their rooms suffer from heat loss, emissions and lack of repair. In winter, his family feels very cold and they always have colds and flus due to heat loss through the walls and windows. 

As a result, Chinbat has decided to make repairs to his apartment. At first he will insulate the walls and replace some of the old, damaged windows. Now he needs about 2,600,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to cover the cost of the insulation materials such the foam, cement and rock wool. Please help his family to stay warm in winter.

loans.use: to cover the cost of insulation materials for his apartment such foam, cement and rock wool

loans.name: Gs El Zapote V Group

texts.es:
La joven Selbia es una persona muy emprendedora dedicada a su negocio, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en Choluteca en el sur de Honduras. Y tiene más de 3 años de tener este negocio de venta de Gallinas.
Selbia el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de maíz y gallinas y de esta manera incrementar más sus ventas. Con el préstamo espera mejorar sus ventas y así atender mejor a sus clientes. Con estos fondos espera que su negocio sea más sólido y rentable.
Selbia sus sueños es poder y darle a sus hijos una mejor educación y ayudar a su familia.
Aleyda se dedica a su negocio propio pulpería desde hace más de 7 años en el mercado de esa zona.
Betis se dedica su negocio propio compra y venta de gallinas y cerdos. Desde hace mas de 6 años en varios caseríos de la zona 
Choluteca, Honduras - Junio del 2012
texts.en:
The young woman Selbia is a very entrepreneurial person who is dedicated to her work. She lives with her husband and four children in Choluteca in the south of Honduras. She has had this business, selling chickens, for more than three years.

Selbia will invest her loan in the purchase of corn and chickens and in this way will increase her sales. With the loan, she hopes to improve her sales and thus serve her customers better. With these funds, she hopes that her business will be more solid and profitable.

Selbia's dreams are to be able to give her children a good education and to help her family. 

Aleyda works in her own business, a grocery store in the area market, which she has had for more than seven years.

Betis works in her own business, which is buying and selling chickens and pigs. She has been doing this for more than six years in various villages in the area.

loans.use: to buy corn and chickens for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
This is Vivian. She previously accessed a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 13,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory in her direct-selling business. The more items she has displayed and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Vivian hopes her business will grow and expand soon. She dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: San Andres Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento SAN ANDRES Está  compuesto por Ocho integrantes seis  mujeres y dos varones,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Silvia  tiene 47 años, tiene un hijo de la edad de 14 años en edad escolar, La Sra. Silvia se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en una zona muy concurrida de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  este préstamo es su decima secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Silvia  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas también  mesas y sillas por  mayor  y así de esta manera brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes e incrementar su capital de trabajo,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Silvia va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando utensilios para así ir mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener una restaurante  y así brindar mayor variedad de platillos a su clientela. La Sra. Silvia  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en: The San Andres Venture Capital Bank is made up of eight members, six women and two men. The bank president is Mrs. Silvia, 47 years old. She has a fourteen-year-old school-aged son. Mrs. Silvia makes and sells food from a both in a busy part of the city of Cochabamba. This loan is her tenth loan cycle with this institution. Mrs. Silvia is going to use this loan to buy goods to use to make her food and also tables and chairs purchased wholesale. In this way she can make her customers more comfortable and increase her working capital. She is asking for this loan so she can continue improving her business by purchasing these items. This is how she will improve her earnings. Her desire for the future is to have her own restaurant. With a restaurant she will be able to provide her customers with a greater variety of dishes. Mrs. Silvia is a hardworking woman. She is happy for the opportunity these loans have provided. They have helped her and her companions keep their families independent.

loans.use: to buy goods to use to make her food and also tables and chairs

loans.name: Emelio

texts.en:
This is Emelio. He previously accessed a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan that he utilized to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in his business. His earnings were a big help for his personal, household and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan that he will be utilizing to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to his inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs and his business expenditures. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Emelio hopes to expand his business someday through all his hard work in his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week, and this is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, toiletries and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Ii Group

texts.es:
El Banco de emprendimiento NUEVA ESPERANZA II
Está  compuesto por Ocho integrantes cinco mujeres y tres varones,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Victoria  vive por la zona  de Nueva Esperanza de ahí el nombre del banco ya que la mayoría de las socias viven por esta zona, la Sra. Victoria tiene 30 años, tiene tres hijos de las edades de 12, 13  y 15 años, todos ellos en edad escolar, La Sra. Victoria se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la misma zona donde vive,  este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Victoria  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas por  mayor  y así de esta manera brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes e incrementar su capital de trabajo,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Victoria va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando utensilios para así ir mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener una restaurante  y así brindar mayor variedad de platillos a su clientela. La Sra. Victoria  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en: The entrepreneurship bank Nueva Esperanza II is made up of eight members of whom five are women and three are men. The president of the bank is Victoria. She lives in the area of Nueva Esperanza from which the bank's name comes as the majority of the members live in this area. Victoria is thirty years old and has three children of the ages of 12, 13, and 15, all being of school age. Victoria makes a living making and selling food from her food stall that is located in the same area where she lives. This loan is her third loan cycle with the institution and she is going to use the loan to buy tables and chairs in bulk, in this way giving greater comfort to her customers and increasing her work capital. The reason she's requesting this loan is to continue improving her business. Victoria is going to use the profits to continue buying utensils in order to continue improving her earnings. Her desire for her business is to have a restaurant and thus offer a greater variety of dishes to her customers. Victoria is a very hardworking person who feels happy for this opportunity given to her and the members of her group since, in some cases, they alone support their families.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs in bulk.

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: Francisco jose de 34 años de edad , casado con dos hijos menores de edad , tiene por actividad ecomomica la venta de hielo , desde hace 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad, esta herramienta de trabajo la inicio como una necesidad de tener un ingreso para la mantencion de su familia, el negocio cuenta con 7 frizer ya que se encuentra en una zona pesquera tiene mucha demanda, el financimiento lo quiere para comprar   bolsas plasticas, dar mantenimiento a  los frizer, comprar termos hermeticos entre otros
texts.en: Francisco José is 34 years old. He is married and has two minor children. His business is selling ice, and he has been doing this for four years. He created this form of employment out of the need to have an income to support his family. His business has seven freezers. Since he lives in a fishing zone, he has a lot of demand. The financing that he would like will be used to buy plastic bags, maintain the freezers, and buy air-tight thermoses, among other things.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags, maintain his freezers, and buy air-tight thermoses.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is married with seven children. Lolita is 56 years old and lives in the small village of Tacloban, Siquijor, Siquijor. 
 
To earn a living, Lolita has a sari sari (general) store business. She has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase assorted canned goods and other grocery items. Lolita has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for more than one year. In the future, Lolita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase assorted canned goods and other grocery items.

loans.name: Maria Eliberta

texts.es:
Doña María Eliberta  de 54 años de edad, es soltera vive con sus dos nietos y dos hijos mayores, ambos independientes. Ella vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras. Se dedica desde hace ya varios años a la venta de abarrotaría, venta de verduras, hamacas y plásticos.
Doña María Eliberta esta solicitando el préstamo para surtir un poco su pequeña pulpería ya que necesita comprar algunos productos que no tiene en existencia como Manteca, Frijoles, Aceite, Jabones, Detergentes, Arroz, Lácteos y otros productos de consumo básico, que sus clientes le piden, con el apoyo del préstamo mejorara sus ingresos y su pulpería mejorara
Doña María Eliberta  su sueño mejorar cada día su negocio y salir adelante, para mejorar la vivienda donde vive.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2012
texts.en:
Mrs. Marîa Eliberta is 54 years old single and lives with her two grandchildren. She has two grown children who are independent. She lives in the community of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. She sells grocery items such as vegetables, hammocks and plastics goods.
Mrs. María  Eliberta is asking for this loan in order to provide a greater variety of goods in her small grocery store. She needs to buy certain products that are currently not in her inventory such as lard, beans, oil. soap, detergent, rice, milk products and other basic grocery items that her customers have requested. With the support of this loan she will be able to increase her earnings and improve her grocery store.
Mrs. María Eliberta dream is to improve her business and also improve the home where she lives.
San Lorenzo, Honduras – June 2012

loans.use: to buy lard, beans, oil, soap, detergent, rice, milk products, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Geoconda Benita

texts.es: Gioconda Benita de 40 años de edad, casada esta emprendedora tiene por actividada ecomomica la venta de mercaderia en general desde hace cinco años, esta herramienta de trabajo la inicio como una necesidad de tener un ingreso mas para el bienesta de su familia, actividad que la realiza de forma ambulante y en el domicilio, el fianancimiento lo quiere para comprar mercaderia en general como: pantalones, camisas, faldas, short, ropa interior, toallas, jugos de sabanas, entre otros.
texts.en: Geoconda Benita is forty years old and married. She is an entrepreneur who has been selling general merchandise as her work for five years. She began the tools of her trade as a necessity to have another income for her family's well-being. She carries out her work as a street vendor and at home. She wants this funding to buy general merchandise like: pants, shirts, skirts, shorts, underwear, towels, and sets of sheets, among other items.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise.

loans.name: Blanca Ofelia

texts.es:
Blanca Ofelia,  es una persona trabajadora, tiene 48 años y es bastante dinámica en las labores diarias de su negocio,   labora diario desde muy temprano hasta la tarde, los  siete días de la semana en su domicilio, su negocio venta de carbón, por saco, ella lo compra a productores ubicados en el sector y lo vende en su casa a clientes que ella tiene, Trabaja junto a su esposo quien el sale a vender de forma ambulante. también  tiene otra negocio de  agricultura como siembra de frijoles y maíz. Tiene 2 hijos que son independientes.

 Solicita el  préstamo a nuestra institución para invertir en capital de trabajo, para la  compra de carbón. Esto con el propósito de  tener mayor cantidad para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. y captar mas compradores de sus productos. En el crédito anterior lo utilizo para comprar más carbón y mejora en su vivienda.  Se siente agradecida con ceprodel y Kiva, por la oportunidad y la confianza depositada en ella, por medio de los préstamos a incrementado su negocio y  le ha permitido llevar el sustento a su hogar y tener  una  condición mejor de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca Ofelia is a hard-working person. She is 48 years old and is quite dynamic in her daily work at her business. She works in her home every day from very early until the evening, seven days a week. Her business is selling charcoal by the bag. She buys it from producers located in the district and sells it in her house to her customers. She works together with her husband, who goes out to sell as a street vendor. She also has another agricultural business, which is growing beans and corn. She has two children who are independent.

She is applying to our institution [CEPRODEL] to invest in working capital by buying charcoal, with the goal of having a greater quantity to satisfy the demands of her customers and attract more buyers for her products. She used her past loan to buy more charcoal and improve her home. She is grateful to CEPRODEL and to Kiva for the opportunity and the confidence placed in her through the loans to increase her business, and it has allowed her to sustain her household and have better living conditions for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of charcoal to distribute to her customers.

loans.name: Nandintsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Nandintsetseg, 31, lives with her husband and her son in a rental apartment in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. She is a teacher at a secondary school and has been working for five years nonstop. 

Her rental apartment has too much heat loss and emissions in the winter. She uses the furnace, which uses coal, just to stay warm at home. Her son always has flu due to the cold. So she wanted to make repairs to her apartment. She is planning to insulate the windows and the wall corners. She will recover some broken and bad parts of the walls with cement and foam. It will reduce the heat loss, and she will pay less for coal. Using the coal is very harmful for her family's health and the environment, as she knows.  

Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world. This is due to the long and cold winters where temperatures frequently go below -40C (-40F), even in the cities. Also, in winter, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snowstorms. Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm. As well, the extremely toxic smoke from the cars is one of the main reasons for Mongolian air pollution. In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss, improve heating systems and buy the cars that run on the natural gas. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to buying some building and insulation materials for her home repair.

loans.use: To buy some building and insulation materials for her home repair.

loans.name: Antonio Guadalupe

texts.es: Antonio Guadalupe de 43 años de edad con dos hijos bajo su cargo todadivia ya que estan estudiando el se desempeña como guarda de seguridad de su localidad , el simpre ha sido un hombre muy eforzado, trabajdor, con ganas de seguir luchando para el bienestar de su familia, el fiannciamiento lo quiere para comprar material de construccion como: zin, cemento, perlines, clavos, alambre ya que la mejoras son cambiar el techo de su casa que se encuentra en mal estado y estamos en epoca de lluvia lo cual es muy perjudicial para mi familia y necesita brindarle mejores condiciones.
texts.en: Antonio Guadalupe is 43 years old with two children under his care. The children are students. Antonio Guadalupe works as a security guard in his area. He has always been an ambitious and hardworking man with the energy to progress for the well being of his family’s finances. He would like to buy construction materials such as zinc, cement, metal supports, nails, and wire to improve the roof on his house as it is in ill repair. It is the rainy season and a good roof is necessary for his family in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy roofing materials in order to build a new roof for the rainy season.

loans.name: Hazel Yaoska

texts.es: Hazell Yaoska de  22 años de edad, casada con dos hijos menores de edad tiene por actividada ecomomica la venta de mercaderia en general, Hazell ya ha tenido credito con leon 2000 lo cual ha demostrado ser responsable, trabajadora , con ganas de superacion personal, el fiananciamiento lo solicita para hacerle mejorar a su vivienda como contruir un pared perimetrar para seguridad de su familia, ya que ha sido uno de sus mayores sueños tener terminada sus casa, el financiamiento lo quiere para comprar material de construccion como:  hierro, zinc, cemento, arena, bloque, madera, clavos, alambre entre otros.
texts.en: Hazell Yaoska is 22 years old, married, with two young children. She sells general merchandise. Hazell has had a loan with Leon 2000 and has shown herself to be a responsible, hardworking woman with the drive to move forward. The loan she is requesting will be used to improve her home. She would like to build a perimeter fence for the security of her family. To finish her house is one of her greatest dreams. This loan will be used to buy construction material such as iron, zinc, cement, sand, bricks, wood, nails and wire among other items.

loans.use: to buy construction material such as iron, zinc, cement, sand, cement block, wood, nails and wire among other items.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is 27 years old. He is the sixth born in a family of eight. He has just completed training with Mobile Transactions to finally make his dream of running his own business come true. Andrew needs a loan to make this happen.

When Andrew finished secondary school, he took a short accounting course in his hometown of Lusaka. He describes himself as a hard worker who has passed through a lot of ups and downs in his life. He says this makes him very strong and focused in whatever he does. He will use his loan to start up a business of mobile money transfers by buying a trading booth, which he can use to make transactions. He will also use the money to buy all the necessary equipment to run a successful mobile money shop. 

Andrew is hopeful that once he gets his Kiva loan, he will be able to start running his own business. He says his life will change because he will be able to earn some money and improve his standard of living and that of his siblings. He thanks the Kiva lenders.

In the video, Andrew speaks to a representative from Mobile Transactions.

loans.use: to set up his mobile money transfer shop by purchasing a trading booth and to have some working capital

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
Roberta is 60 years old. She is married with nine children, who are already adults, and presently lives in Miligan, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. Roberta earns money from her business, which is a general store, buying and selling for more than 20 years in their barangay (village).

Roberta has requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy housing materials. She has been a member of PMPC for three years and continues her good performance in the cooperative. In the future, Roberta hopes that soon and for always she will be a good member in the cooperative and earn a lot in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more housing materials.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Yenny Stand

texts.es: yenny con su  anterior credikiva hizo muchas cosas: compró  jeanes, suéteres, calzado, bolsos, materias primas con los cuales elaboró almuerzos a buen precio porque obtuvo buenos descuentos, por compras en mayor volumen  y le alcanzó hasta para comprar una bici taxi. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará un nuevo bici taxi, pues con el anterior ha logrado incrementar sus ingresos y quiere consolidar su capital de trabajo, así mismo invertirá en la compra de mercancías como ropa , cosméticos y perfumería, para coronar su inversión llevándole a sus clientes todo lo que ellos han solicitado. Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores de Kiva: “Estoy muy agradecida con aquellas personas  que desinteresadamente apoyan a nosotros los pequeños comerciantes y ojalá continúen con esta bonita labor, para seguir beneficiando a las personas que tengan negocios”
texts.en: Yenny is a previous KIVA borrower. With her loan she was able to do many things; buy jeans, sweaters, shoes and purses. She also buys ingredients to be used to make lunches at a wholesale level as she buys in volume. She is now able to buy a bicycle taxi. She is applying for this new loan from KIVA in order to buy this new bicycle taxi. With the last loan she was able to increase her earnings and consolidate her working capital. She would also like to invest the loan in merchandise such as clothes, cosmetics and perfume in order to provide her customers with the merchandise they are requesting. She would like to send the following message to the lenders at KIVA, “She is thankful to the people who, without any self-interest, support the small business owner. She hopes you continue with this wonderful contribution as it helps the people that have businesses.”

loans.use: to buy a new bicycle taxi and merchandise such as clothes, cosmetics and perfume.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more textiles to make RTW's or ready-to-wear clothes.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
This is Rosana. She previously accessed a 19,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan that she used to  buy materials and additional equipment and for maintenance of existing machines. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Rosana would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more materials and equipment needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to meet their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Rosanna dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and  draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
