* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for materials and additional equipment for her propeller business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and to pay for the gasoline for his services.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en: Marlon is 40 years of age and married. He presently lives in Don Victoriano, Misamis Occidental. He has two children. Marlon is a government employee of Don Victoriano and has a business piggery to earn income for the family. He has been doing this business for more than a year. He has requested a loan of 50,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase more sacks of feed and more pigs for the expansion of his piggery. Marlon has been a member of Paglaum MPC for almost a year. In the future, Marlon hopes that he can earn more than he needs in his business to support his finances.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of feed and more pigs for the expansion of his piggery.

loans.name: Nicefora

texts.en:
Nicefora is 57 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.  She is married with three children. Nicefora has a grocery store that sells groceries and other consumable products. She has had this business for one year. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional groceries for sale. Nicefora has been a member of PMPC just this year.  In the future, Nicefora hopes to engage in other types of businesses.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries for sale.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 30 years old, married, and lives in the Philippines. She has a food and retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. 

Juvy became a member of HSPFI this year. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Con 42,000 pesos Valentina comprará más mercancía para aumentar el inventario de su tienda de comestibles.
Valentina es casada, su esposo es oficial de policía. Juntos tienen 3 hijos de 16, 14, y 12 años que están en la escuela secundaria.
Valentina utiliza los ingresos generados por su tienda de comestibles para apoyar a su esposo en la alimentación de la familia y educación de sus hijos. Ni Valentina ni su esposo terminaron la secundaria, para ellos es muy importante que sus hijos estudien y puedan desarrollar todo su potencial.
El mayor deseo de Valentina es tener una empresa grande para así poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
With this loan of 42,000 DOP, Valentina will buy more merchandise to increase the inventory in her grocery store.

Valentina is married. Her husband is a police officer and they have three children (ages 16, 14, and 12) who are in high school. Valentina will use the income that is generated from her grocery store to help her husband with feeding their family and educating their children. Neither Valentina nor her husband finished high school, so it is very important to them that their children finish school so that they can develop to their full potential.

Valentina’s greatest wish is to have a larger business so that she can continue supporting her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Santa E.

texts.es:
Con 21,000 Santa comprará mercancía para surtir su tienda de artículos de uso personal, accesorios y ropa.
Santa es madre soltera y tiene seis hijos de 36, 35, 30, 29, 21 y 19 años. Los cuatro mayores se casaron y los dos menores viven en casa con ella. Su hija menor tiene Síndoreme de Down.
En nuestro país no hay ayuda social para padres que tienen hijos especiales, por lo que estos hijos representan un alto costo para estas familias.
Santa quiere tener la habilidad de producir el dinero suficiente para suplir a su hija menor todas sus necesidades.
texts.en:
With this loan of 21,000 DOP, Santa will buy merchandise to restock her store where she sells personal use items, accessories, and clothing.

Santa is a single mother and has six children (ages 36, 35, 30, 29, 21, and 19). The four older children are married and the two younger ones live at home with her. Her youngest daughter has Down syndrome. In the Dominican Republic, there are no social services available to help parents who have children with special needs. For this reason, these children represent a high cost for their families.

Santa wants to have the ability to produce enough income to provide her young daughter with everything she needs.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Gilna

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Gilna works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines, and earns additional income from selling food. 

Gilna has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell in her business.

Gilna hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Isabel earns additional income from selling piglets.

Isabel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy vegetables and spices to sell in her vegetable vending business.

Isabel dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, aged 42, is married and has three children who are in school. She has been in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines for 14 years now.

Jocelyn has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She is now requesting a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lucia works hard to support her family. She operates a fish pond business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fishing. Lucia is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her fish pond business.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed for her fish pond business

loans.name: Ma. Liza

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ma. Liza works hard to support her family. She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. 

Ma. Liza has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional dried fish to sell in her business.

Ma. Liza hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is married and works hard to support her family. She has had a dried fish vending business in the Philippines for the past four years.

Marilyn has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional dried fish to sell. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's financial stability.

loans.use: To buy additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Orbesa

texts.en:
Orbesa is 34 years old and is married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. Orbesa has run a general store in the Philippines for the past nine years and also earns an income from dried fish vending and fishing.

She has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. Orbesa is now requesting a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Orbesa aspires to save money to expand her business and to purchase a fishing boat engine.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Cina

texts.en:
Cina is 56 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with no dependants. Cina has a pedicure and manicure business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase additional manicure and pedicure sets. Cina has been a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, Cina hopes to engage in another type of business.

loans.use: To purchase additional manicure and pedicure sets

loans.name: Ana Editha

texts.en:
Ana Editha, aged 42, is a resident of Cavite, Philippines. She is the mother of two children who are both in high school. Ana Editha manages her own household while operating her business. She is currently working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ana Editha operates a RTW (ready-to-wear) clothing business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell them with a little profit. Her products are children’s clothes, shoes and other similar products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options that she offers. Ana Editha's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 800 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. Ana Editha will be utilizing the loan to buy RTW clothing and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Ana Editha hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy RTW clothing and merchandise items to sell in her business.

loans.name: Paulina Wanjiku

texts.en:
Paulina is applying for her fifth loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous loan. She will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will buy a dairy cow. 

Paulina's hopes and dreams are to expand her farming business by buying another farm and to educate her children to university level.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Mutemi

texts.en:
Mutemi is a 39-year-old dairy farmer who is married to Jane who is a mixed crop farmer. They are blessed with three children aged 14, 10 and eight years respectively. He has been in the dairy business for the past four years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family. 

Mutemi is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous loan. He will use the loan to buy animal feed and a heifer. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, Mutemi will support his children's education. His hopes and dreams are to own a dairy farm and to improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and a heifer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
This is Rebecca who previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. Her earnings were a big help for her grandchild's education and for their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
Rebecca would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed in her store the better as more items to sell will result in better profits. Rebecca's business profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and her grandchild's educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Rebecca hopes to be able to expand her business soon, just as she hopes her grandchild will finish schooling. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies there.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora, aged 40, is married and presently lives in San Isidro, Mahayag. She has three children. Nora is a private employee and also has had a piggery business for the past 12 years. Every quarter, Nora earns less than 20,000 PHP. 

She has requested a loan to purchase sacks of feed and pigs for her piggery. Nora has been a member of Paglaum MPC for more than a year. In the future, she hopes that she can improve her living standard with the help of Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of feed and pigs for her piggery

loans.name: Farhod

texts.en:
A man who always tries to be the best in the modern world is Farhod. Farhod from childhood was smart, clever, and cute. He worked in many places but four years ago he began his own business, which nowadays is his main source of income. His business is to serve to the local people with his electric bicycle scooter. 

Farhod helps his citizens to transport their goods. As he is hardworking, all of his customers are glad to have him. Farhod has a friendly family. He loves his wife and two children. He wants to develop business so he needs one more electric bicycle scooter. He is asking for a loan to buy an electric bicycle scooter. He awaits your help and support.

loans.use: to buy a new electric bicycle scooter.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 40-year-old food stall owner in Mtwapa, Mombasa. She is a married mother of six children. She has been selling food for the past ten years with good income.

This marks her first business loan from KADET LTD. She plans to purchase a variety of food stuffs, new chairs, tables, and serving dishes. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and also in the expansion of her business. She hopes to excel in the business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of food stuffs, new chairs, tables, and serving dishes.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a 38-year-old businesswoman who is married to Francis who is a businessman. They are blessed with two children. Helen has been running an M-Pesa (mobile money transfer service), phone and accessory outlet business for the past six years earning a monthly income of KES 20,000 which she uses to support her family. 

Helen is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. She will use the loan to buy an M-Pesa float and new phones to sell. With the anticipated profit from the businesses, she will expand her phone-selling business. 

Helen's hopes and dreams are to educate her children to university level and to improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy an M-Pesa float and new phones to sell.

loans.name: Etoile Group

texts.fr: La cliente Pose, leader du groupe d’affaire «Etoile», est  entrepreneur, âgée de 36  ans, femme vivant seule (sans mari), mère de deux enfants. L’ainé a 22 ans et le cadet a 10 ans, malheureusement tous n’étudient pas faute de moyens. Elle est  vendeuse des tomates, oignons, huile Rina, légumes, pommes de terre .environs 6 ans, elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser 11 cycles avec  crédit de Hekima. Son premier capital fut de 5$ reçu de son petit frère, ainsi, elle commença par la vente de maïs grillé au long de la route. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  5 paniers des tomates, 3 sac de pommes de terre,  et réaliser d’autres micros projets de la famille.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir  et accroitre son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
Pose, age 36, is an entrepreneur and the leader of Etoile Group. She's the mother of two children and lives alone (without husband). Her eldest child is 22, the youngest 10. Unfortunately, they don't get to study due to a lack of financial means.

Pose sells tomatoes, onions, Rina cooking oil, vegetables, and potatoes. She's been running this business for six years, and benefited from eleven loans from Kiva's partner, Hekima.

Her start-up capital amounted to $5 she received from her younger brother. With it, she started selling grilled corn on the side of the road.

This new loan will enable her to get supplies (five baskets of tomatoes and three sacks of potatoes) and realize other micro projects with her family.

In addition, she wishes to see her children grow up and expand her business. Pose thanks Hekima for its actions in favor of poor women excluded from traditional banks.

loans.use: 5 baskets of tomatoes and 3 sacks of potatoes

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Lakignon Tassi Group

texts.fr: Groupement  solidaire de 04 personnes constitués de femmes et d‘hommes, Mr Atchaki est nommé pour les diriger. Il est père de 06 enfants dont 04  scolarisés et âgé de 36ans. Il est cultivateur de profession et exerce cette activité depuis 1999 en REGION CENTRALE. Vu que sa superficie augmente, il a sollicité l’aide de 04 personnes pour lui porter main forte dans l’exécution de ses taches afin d’avoir un bon rendement et pouvoir assurer les désirs des clients. Ils sont tous dans la culture du maïs, du riz, du sorgho et une dame en plus de son amour pour la terre exerce comme métier la couture et le fait de temps en temps. Le responsable souhaite acheter un moulin pour l’exploitation commerciale, augmenter sa superficie cultivable et assurer les besoins élémentaires  de la famille.
texts.en: This solidarity group has 04 members and consists of both men and women. Mr Atchaki is their appointed leader. He is 36 years old and is father to 06 children, 04 of whom are in school. He is a farmer by profession and has been farming in the Central Region (one of the five regions of Togo) since 1999. Since his land has increased, he has sought help from 04 people in order to intensify his labour efforts so that he can perform his tasks well and get a good yield in order to satisfy the needs of his customers. All the group members are involved with the cultivation of maize, rice and sorghum. In addition, besides working the land, one lady also works as a seamstress and makes handicrafts from time to time. The leader would like to buy a mill in order to increase production, increase the area of arable land and guarantee the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy work tools

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This is Evelyn who previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child's education and for their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Evelyn would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better as more items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and her child's educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Evelyn hopes her business will grow in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies there.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 33-year-old businessman who is married to Elizabeth who is a mixed crop farmer. They are blessed with four children aged between three and 10 years old. Daniel has been running an electronics retail shop for the past six years with a monthly income of KES 19,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous loan. Daniel will use this loan to restock his business by buying more electronic products to sell. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. 

Daniel's hopes and dreams are to open another electronics shop and to improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy more stock of electronic products to sell.

loans.name: Lodovina

texts.es: Lodovina es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas y tiene 45 años de edad, es divorciada y madre de 4 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 8 años y tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y zapatos, también es dueña de una tienda en su propia casa donde vende abarrotes. Ella dice que con FINCA Perú aprendió a practicar los valores, agradece a la institución ya que logró construir su casa, también le gustan mucho las capacitaciones  que le brinda su promotora en su Banco Comunal donde aprendió mucho y está agradecida por sus enseñanzas. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de su negocio donde vende ropa y también en la compra de mercadería como casacas, chompas, polos, abrigos, pantalones y abarrotes para su tienda como arroz, azúcar, leche, harina, fideos, bebidas.
texts.en: Lodovina is a member of the Azucenas community bank.  She is 45 years old, divorced and the mother of four children.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for eight years and has a business selling clothing and shoes.  She is also the owner of a store, which is located in her own home, where she sells groceries.  She says that FINCA Peru have taught her how to practice values.  She is grateful to the institution because she managed to build her own home.  She also really enjoys the training sessions that her loan officer provides to the community bank as she has learned a lot.  She is grateful for the teachings.  Lodovina will invest the loan she has requested in maintaining her clothing business.  She will buy merchandise such as jackets, sweaters, tops, coats and pants (trousers), and groceries for her store such as rice, sugar, milk, flour, noodles and drinks.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as jackets, sweaters, tops, coats and pants

loans.name: Chia's Group

texts.en:
Chia is a 26-year-old Iraqi woman who is married and the mother of two children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Chia is one of many Iraqi woman who work from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Chia has four years' experience with her little business which she would like to improve by replacing her old sewing machine with an overlocker and an iron. To make the purchases, she took out a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "group loans" to clients unable to provide a guarantor who are thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to replace an old sewing machine with an overlocker and an iron

loans.name: Solidarite Group

texts.fr: La cliente Lenge est secrétaire du groupement  d’affaire Solidarité, elle est mariée et mère de 6 jeunes enfants. Son mari Maitre maçon constructeur. La cliente est vendeuse d’habillement et divers. Elle est colporteur. Elle commença son entreprise avec le crédit de l’IMF Hekima. Elle est au 11e cycle de crédit. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 20 pièces de pagnes a marchander . Les bénéfices de ses activités, lui permettent de payer le loyer, la scolarité, et de vivre aisément dans la ville de Goma. Dans le futur, elle ambitionne acheter une parcelle. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son appui  et autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs femmes.Il sied de signaler qu'une cliente tient son bébé.
texts.en: Lenge is the secretary of the Solidarité business group. She is married and has 6 young children. Her husband is a master builder. Lenge is a trader of clothing and other miscellaneous items. She is a street trader. She began her business with a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima. She is now requesting her 11th loan cycle. She needs this new loan in order to buy 20 pieces of traditional wrap-around cloth (known as "pagnes") for bargaining. The profits from her business enable her to pay her rent, school fees and to live comfortably in the city of Goma. In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land. For this, she would like to thank Hekima for its support and for the empowerment of female small business owners. It should be noted that one customer in the photo is with her baby.

loans.use: to buy 20 pieces of traditional wrap-around cloth ("pagnes")

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Dukure Group

texts.fr:
Samia fait partie du groupe Dukure et  habite à Gitega. C’est une orpheline de  25 ans.
Elle  a sous sa charge ses 10 petits frères   .

Elle fait le commerce des habits et des souliers  depuis 5ans. 

Elle est à son sixième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’habits et de souliers  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Les gains de son commerce,  lui permettent de nourrir ses petits frères et leur payer les frais de scolarité.
texts.en:
Samia is a member of the Dukure group and lives in Gitega. She is a 25 year old orphan.
She supports and cares for her 10 younger brothers and sisters.

She has been trading clothes and shoes for 5 years.

This is her sixth loan cycle with the microfinance institution Turame. With the loan she gets from KIVA, she plans to increase her capital and buy lots of clothes and shoes that she can sell in order to earn more.

With the profits she makes, she will be able to feed her young brothers and sisters and pay their school fees.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy lots of clothes and shoes that she can sell in order to earn more.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a farmer with twenty-five years of experience in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya. She has been producing mainly mangoes and cereals like maize and sorghum for the local market to meet the daily needs of her family of three children.

She has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy rabbits. She believes she will earn enough income to repay the loan since the number of farmers who are rabbit farming is still limited and their feeds are easily accessible and cheap compared to other animal feeds.

Evangeline says lack of capital and harsh weather conditions are the main challenges in farming.

loans.use: To buy rabbits.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 37 years old and is a fish monger in Mombasa. She is a married mother of three and has been doing this business for the last fifteen years successfully. 

This marks her first business loan after she was recently introduced to KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan to purchase more fish for her business. The anticipated profits will be used to buy more stock of fish to stabilize her business and to get more income which she will use to pay school fees for her children. 

She hopes to realize more profits from the sales and thus be able to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas y tiene 42 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 1 hijo. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 5 años y es dueña de una tienda donde se dedica a la venta de queso. Le gusta asistir a las reuniones de su Banco Comunal por que aprendió a ahorrar y a ser puntual, le gustan las capacitaciones donde le enseñan a valorarse como mujer y también a generar sus propios ingresos y ahorrar. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de quesos al por mayor para que los venda en su tienda.
texts.en: Adela is a member of the 'Azucenas' community bank.  She is 42 years old, lives with her partner and has one child.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for five years and owns a store where she sells cheese.  She enjoys attending her community bank meetings because she has learned to save and be punctual.  She likes the training sessions where they teach her to value herself as a woman, to earn her own income and to save.  She will invest the loan she is requesting in buying cheese wholesale to sell in her store.

loans.use: to buy cheese wholesale

loans.name: Gafurjon

texts.en: Gafurjon is a young and purposeful man. 8 years ago he began his own business. He is a goldsmith. He is the best master and knows all aspects of his craft very well. He always tries to do the best for clients. Gafurjon makes very beautiful rings, necklaces and chaplets (one decade rosaries). He has a friendly family. His wife is a seamstress and she tries to help him. They have 2 children and try to comfort them with all the modern conveniences. He is asking for a loan to buy raw materials. Please help this hard-working master to develop his business. We await your help and mercy.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for developing his business.

loans.name: Armando De Jesus

texts.es:
Armando, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, debido a la temporada que se acerca en la siembra de maíz, su objetivo es comprar a los insumos con este dinero para prevenir a la plantación de las posibles plagas y para fortalecer la producción, compra da semilla mejorada, fertilizantes, herbicidas, entre otros según sea la necesidad en el proceso.

El manifiesta que la siembra de la temporada anterior fue bastante efectiva, el préstamo que se le brindó se invirtió en la compra de los materiales que ayudaron a tener dicha producción.
texts.en:
Armando is requesting a new loan for the corn-sowing season which is now approaching.  His goal is to use this money to buy supplies so that he can prevent pests from settling in his crops and strengthen his production.  He will buy improved seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and other supplies he needs for this process.  

Armando says that his previous sowing season was pretty effective.  He invested his previous loan in buying materials to help him with his production.

loans.use: to buy improved seed, fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir en los materiales necesarios para continuar en la producción de pupusas, como lo es el maíz, quesillo, chicharrón, aceite, condimentos, que le permitan mantener su producción en la venta, ya que esto le ayudará a contar con un buen número de clientes.

El préstamo anterior le ayudó para el fortalecimiento también del negocio, aumentando las posibilidades de continuar en la venta de las pupusas, esto también ha permitido tener una fuente de trabajo estable.
texts.en:
Reina is requesting a new loan to invest in the supplies she needs to continue producing pupusas.  She will buy corn, 'quesillo' (soft cheese), 'chicharrón' (cooked, ground pork), oil and seasonings which will allow her to maintain her production and sales.  This will help her to have a good number of customers.

Reina's previous loan also helped her to strengthen her business, increasing her possibilities of continuing to sell her pupusas.  It has also allowed her to have a stable source of work.

loans.use: to buy corn, soft cheese, cooked pork, oil and seasonings

loans.name: Nikson

texts.en:
Nikson is a 30-year-old farmer who lives with his father, Cornelis, 60 years old, and his mother, Yuliana, 57 years old. Nikson plants and sells vegetables like tomatoes, chilies and basil. He harvests the vegetables almost every week then sells them at the traditional market. The income from selling vegetables helps him in meeting his family's needs. 

In order to support his business, Nikson would like to buy a water pump to help him in watering the farm. He would also like to plant more vegetables and therefore needs more capital to buy more seedlings and fertilizer. To implement his plan, Nikson is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 5,000,000. Nikson is hoping that the loan will help him in improving the business.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 40 years old and a business lady in Mombasa. She sells calling cards, a business she has been doing for the past five years successfully. She is married with two children.

This is Caroline’s first business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more calling cards for resale. She will use the proceeds from her expanded business to buy land to build rental houses. She hopes to excel in the business and to have a happy, comfortable family.

loans.use: to purchase more calling cards.

loans.name: Obet

texts.en:
Obet (35) is a married man. He has a baby, namely Vensitiona (4 months), from his marriage to Sarmolina, a 32-year-old lady. Obet covers his family needs by running a tailoring business. He used to work with a senior tailor, but after becoming ready to work independently, Obet decided to resign and initiate his own business at home last year. The business was run with limited capital that he had, which resulted in a small income. 

Incidentally, one of Obet’s relatives offered him a business place located at the edge of a main road. By having a new business place, Obet believes that he would be able to earn a bigger income as well as to reach more customers than before. To make his dream come true, Obet then applied for a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 3,000,000. This loan would enable him to pay the rental fee for the business place for 5 years.

loans.use: to pay the rental fee for the new business place for 5 years.

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Rama is 33 years old and a married businessman in Kilifi. He buys and sells building bricks, a business he has done for the past four years. His business is doing great.

This marks his second borrowing from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase more building bricks to resell to his customers. He will use the anticipated profits to plow back into the business so as to realize more profits. 

He hopes to have a well-established business.

loans.use: to purchase more building bricks.

loans.name: Marvin Otoniel

texts.es:
El señor Marvin Otoniel es una persona trabajadora, labora diario desde las seis de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde, los siete días de la semana en unos de los mercados capitalinos, su negocio venta de productos plásticos, melanina y aluminio, su línea es utensilios del hogar como: platos, vasos, tazas, cucharas. Tiene tres años de tener ese negocio anteriormente era de su mama, la cual le dejo ese negocio para que el se dedicara a esta actividad. Vive con ella y no tiene hijos.

 Solicita el  préstamo a nuestra institución para invertir en capital de trabajo, para la  compra de artículos de melanina y plásticos como (cucharas, platos, vasos, tazas). Esto con el propósito de  ofrecer variedad a sus clientes. Y captar más compradores de sus productos. Se siente agradecido con ceprodel y Kiva, por la oportunidad y la confianza depositada en el, por medio de los prestamos a incrementado su negocio y  le ha permitido llevar el sustento a su hogar y tener  una  condición mejor de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Marvin Otoniel is a hard-working person who works every day, from six in the morning until five in the evening, seven days a week.  He works in one of the markets in the capital city.  His business is selling plastic, melamine and aluminum products.  He sells household utensils such as plates, cups, spoons..  He has been in this business for three years.  The business used to belong to his mom but she left it so that he could have it.  He lives with his mom and does not have any children.

Marvin Otoniel is requesting a loan from the institution to invest in working capital and to buy melamine and plastic products such as spoons, plates and cups.  His aim is to offer his customers more variety and to attract more buyers.  He feels grateful to Ceprodel and Kiva for the opportunity and for the trust that they are placing in him.  Through loans, he has increased his business.  This has allowed him to provide for his household and both he and his family have been able to enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy inventory for his business selling kitchen products and other housewares

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia, aged 58, is a widow with 10 adult children. For eight years, she has been a mixed crop farmer for her primary business and involved with buying and selling goats as a secondary business. She uses the monthly income of KES 6,000 to support her family members. 

Cecilia is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd. after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. She will use the loan to buy more goats to sell. With the anticipated profit, she will boost her farming business. 

Cecilia's hopes and dreams are to supply her goats to the nearby butchers' shops and to improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy more goats to sell.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 29 years old and a businessman. He is married to Sophia who is a mixed crop farmer. They are blessed with two children. For the past two years, Michael has been running a hardware shop as a primary business and a mixed crop farm as a secondary business, with the monthly income of around KES 8,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Michael will use the loan to buy a stock of metal hardware and to boost the farming business. With the anticipated profit from the businesses he will educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to expand his two businesses and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy a stock of metal hardware and to boost the farming business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 34 years old and a business lady who sells stationery in Kiembeni, Mombasa. She is married and a mother of two children. She has been operating this business for the last three years with great success. 

This marks her second business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more textbooks, exercise books, geometrical sets and printing papers.

She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business further. She hopes to have a bigger and more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase more text books, exercise books, geometrical sets and printing papers

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
This is Elvira. She previously accessed a 13,000 PHP loan that she used to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan this time of 15,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Elvira hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Firuza is a very beautiful and smart woman. If you meet with her and talk with her, you like her at once, but this wonderful young woman has a difficult life. Her parents died and she is also a widow. That’s why she must improve her life alone. 

Her parents were jewelers and Firuza has skills about business. Now, she wants to organize her own business. She decided to be engaged in the selling of children's clothes because she loves children very much, and her dream is to be a mother and comfort them with all the conveniences.  

She is asking for a loan to buy goods for organizing her business. She awaits your help and support.

loans.use: To buy goods for organizing her business.

loans.name: Fida

texts.en:
Fida is a 28-year-old young woman. She is married and a mother to one son and one daughter. Her husband is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs. For the past four years, Fida has been raising and selling sheep and sheep products, which has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to cover the costs.

Fida is requesting a 2,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing more sheep and expanding and improving the herd's condition. This will increase sales and improve the family's income. 

Fida is photographed among the herd.

loans.use: To purchase more sheep and expand the herd.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is 22 years old, and a boutique owner in Kilifi. She is married, and a mother of one child. She has been doing the boutique business for the past five years successfully.
 
This is Carolyne’s second business loan from KADET Ltd. to finance her business. She plans to purchase more shirts, blouses, trousers and handbags to sell to her customers. 

She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and educate her child. She hopes to own a bigger, more profitable boutique shop.

loans.use: to purchase more shirts, blouses, trousers and handbags.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy different fruits for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her grandchildren and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan of 25,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more fruits needed for her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her grandchildren. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Susan dreams of being able to grow her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of fruit needed in her business.

loans.name: Alvaro David

texts.es:
Álvaro es un joven de 33 años de edad, casado, padre de dos hijos, hoy en día trabaja en un grupo mariachis cristiano, tocando la trompeta, pues tiene ocho años de trabajar alegrando corazones con su música. Inicio estudiando tres años en el palacio nacional, así mismo estudio mecánica y albañilería con el objetivo de ejercer trabajos al instante, ya que solo por la noche ejerce más su música.
Atraves de este financiamiento que es viable por ser a plazos, construirá la mejora a su casa, siendo parte de concreto y zinc, en la mejora en mejorar dos cuartos, teniendo mejor privacidad y seguridad para su familia, materiales a comprar, bloques, arena, cemento hierro y comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Álvaro is a young man of 33.  He is married and the father of two children.  He currently works as a member of a Christian Mariachi band, playing the trumpet.  He has been working, gladdening hearts with his music, for eight years.  He started by studying three years at the Palacio Nacional.  He also studied mechanics and building with the aim of doing jobs right away.  Only at night does he further practice his music.

Through this loan, which is manageable as it can be repaid in installments, he will make improvements to his house which is part concrete and part metal sheets.  He will improve two rooms which will give his family better privacy and security.  He will buy blocks, sand, cement and metal and start the job.

loans.use: to buy building supplies for improving two rooms

loans.name: Iroldo

texts.es: Iroldo de 29 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 2 a 6 años, en el municipio de Soledad, a 15 minutos de la ciudad. Allí tienen un negocio,  mediante el cual ofrece servicios de mantenimiento y reparación  automotriz,  que inició desde hace 7 años, al quedar desempleado de una empresa de procesamiento de lácteos y con la necesidad de generar ingresos para sostener a su familia. Esta fue la razón por la cual acudió al montaje se su taller, que ha crecido poco a poco y en el que ofrece servicios de mantenimiento a motocicletas, vehículos de carga ligera, pesada etc. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y sus compras también, pero no compra la cantidad suficiente para ganarse el descuento que le ofrecen sus proveedores, porque su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para lograr esta meta. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará masilla, fibra, pintura, resina, un equipo de oxigeno y una pulidora.  Su credikiva supone convertirse en una inversión exitosa, en cuanto ampliará su capital de trabajo, mejorará su capacidad de compra, ganará descuentos y responderá más efectivamente a su clientela, la que cada día crece.
texts.en: 29-year-old Iroldo lives with his wife and their three children who are between 2 and 6 years old.  They live in Soledad municipality, 15 minutes from the city.   Iroldo has a business there in which he services and repairs vehicles.  He started the business seven years ago when he became unemployed from a job with a company that processed dairy products and needed to make income to support his family.  He set up his workshop which has grown gradually.  Iroldo services motorcycles, light vehicles and heavy vehicles.  He makes both his sales and his purchases with cash but does not buy in large enough quantities to earn the discounts that are offered by his suppliers because he does not have enough working capital.  For this reason, he is requesting a Kiva loan (his first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo) to buy putty, fiberglass, paint, resin, an oxygen tank and a polisher.  His Kiva loan will prove to be a successful investment as it will increase his working capital, improve his buying capacity, earn him discounts, and he will be able to respond more effectively to his growing customer base.

loans.use: to buy putty, fiberglass, paint, resin, an oxygen tank and a polisher

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides

loans.name: Jose Adan

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, porque se le presenta la necesidad de invertir para la compra de una motocicleta y transportarse con su venta de medicina a las diferentes zonas del departamento, este préstamo ayudará a complementarse el gasto  y poder realizar la compra, con ello estará trasladándose de una manera más rápida hacia las zonas en las que necesita estar presente.

El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue la ayuda a incrementar el negocio en la compra de medicamentos, le ha permitido crear una buena cartera de clientes y mejorar su situación económica en la familia.
texts.en:
José is asking for a new loan because he needs to invest in the purchase of a motorcycle for transportation for selling medicine in different areas of the department. This loan will help pay for the expense and make the purchase. With it, he will be transporting in a faster way to the areas where he needs to be. 

The effect that the previous loan had was to help him grow his business by buying medications. It has allowed him to create a good clientele and improve his financial situation in his family.

loans.use: to complete the purchase of a motorcycle for his business.

loans.name: Julio Orlando

texts.es: Julio tiene 47 años viviendo en Playas, su casa es de ladrillo y cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz. Desde los 21 años empezó aprendiendo la soldadura en Guayaquil, actualmente realiza sus labores en su vivienda ubicada cerca de los muelles, este cambio fue favorable para el ya que sus clientes son en su mayoría los dueños de los barcos pesqueros. Realiza la soldadura de las embarcaciones las cuales se deterioran por el paso de tiempo y el uso que tienen en alta mar. Lleva trabajando en este sector desde el 2004 de lunes a sábado desde las 8 am hasta las 5 de la tarde gozando de mucha clientela. Con el crédito que solicita Julio va a comprar metales para la soldadura, es un poco caro ya que se compra en planchas. Su meta a futuro es mejorar su vivienda y el negocio para así poder brindar una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Julio is 47 years old and lives in Playas.  His house is made from bricks and he has both water and electricity.  He started learning welding in Guayaquil at the age of 21 and now works from home, near the docks.  This location is favorable to him because most of his customers are fishing boat owners.  He carries out welding work on boats that have deteriorated with the passage of time and through the wear and tear they sustain on the high seas.  Julio has been working in this area since 2004.  He works Monday to Sunday, from 8.00am to 5.00pm, and has a lot of customers.  He will use his loan to buy metals for his welding.  It is a little expensive as they are bought in sheets.  His future goal is to improve his home and his business so that he can provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy metals

loans.name: Eblin Armando

texts.es:
Eblin, debido a la necesidad de invertir en el negocio está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poderse comprar los insumos agrícolas, pues en esta temporada se dispone a realizar la siembra de granos básicos, para esto deberá tener a su alcance el abono, insecticidas, pesticidas, que son los que le permiten prevenir la maleza y las plagas en el cultivo.

El considera que el préstamo anterior le permitió crecer y tener mejores cosechas, logrando vender parte de ella para poder crear ingresos económicos a su familia, cambiando sus condiciones con el sustento diario para todos ellos.
texts.en:
Eblin, due to the necessity of investing in his business, is asking for a new loan to buy agricultural materials. It is the season to start planting basic grains. To do this he needs to have fertilizer, insecticides,and  pesticides at his disposal. These will allow him to control weeds and pests in his crops.

He considers that the previous loan allowed him to grow and have larger harvests. He was able to sell a part of them to create financial income for his family, changing the conditions of their daily support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Las Ovejas De Cristo Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal la Ovejas de Cristo esta conformado por 10 intregrantes todos son personas, trabajadoras, responsables,luchadoras,  los cuales se agruparon por la necesidad que tenian de tener una herramienta de trabajo para tener un ingresos para sus familias, las integrantes son: Erika Patricia Cristina, Claudia Vanessa, Reyna Elizabeth, Pablo Mariano, Mariela Mercedes, Constancia Amparo, Santos Javier Mercedes, Contancia Amparo es la cordinadora del banco la cual se encarga del bue funcionamiento y responsabilidad de los integrantes, Constancia Amparo tiene por actividad economica  la elaboracion de tortillas, por la tanto esta solicitando el financiamiento para comprar : Maiz, leña, comal, cal, entre otros.
texts.en: The 'Las Ovejas de Cristo' community bank has 10 members who are all hard-working, responsible, tenacious people.  They joined together through the need that they had to have work in order to make income for their families.   The members are: Erika Patricia, Cristina, Claudia Vanessa, Reyna Elizabeth, Pablo Mariano, Mariela Mercedes, Constancia Amparo, Santos Javier and Mercedes. Constancia Amparo is the group coordinator and she is in charge of ensuring the smooth running of the group and the responsibility of its members.  Constancia Amparo's business is making tortillas.  She is requesting a loan to buy corn, firewood, a tortilla pan, lime, etc.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, a tortilla pan, lime, etc.

loans.name: Elmer Antonio

texts.es:
Elmer, comienza su nuevo proceso agrícola en la siembra de maíz y ajonjolí, esto le ha ocasionado volver a invertir  un préstamo que le permita o le facilite los recursos económicos para comprarse su materiales como el abono y fertilizantes que son necesarios en todo el proceso de la siembra.

Para él estos préstamos le permiten poder realizar su trabajo de una manera más ordenada, asegurando una buena productividad de granos básicos, con el anterior logró tener un aumento en la cosecha, considera que estos créditos kiva le han mejorado y le han estabilizado su situación como agricultor y a su familia.
texts.en:
Elmer is beginning his farming process by planting corn and sesame. This has resulted in a need to invest a loan that will allow him or will help him have the financial resources to buy materials such as manure and fertilizers, necessary in every planting process. 

For him, these loans help him do his job in a more orderly way, ensuring good productivity with basic grains. With the previous loan, he was able to increase his harvest. He considers these Kiva loans to have imprand stabilized his situation as a farmer and in his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Efrain Enrique

texts.es: Efrain con su anterior credikiva compró lienzos, chancletas, artesanías y los vendió oportunamente, rotando su capital más rápidamente y ganando un poco más. Hoy está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará mercancía que sus clientes le han encargado como ropa masculina, sandalias y bisutería. Con su nueva inversión una vez mas aumentaría su capital de trabajo y así poco a poco se fortalece su negocio. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Estoy muy agradecida por el apoyo y la buena atención que me han brindado, espero me sigan apoyando. “
texts.en: Efrain used his previous Kiva loan to buy canvases, thongs (flip flops) and handicrafts.  He sold them all, turned over his capital more quickly and earned a little more.  He is now applying for a new Kiva loan which he will use to buy merchandise that his customers have ordered such as men's clothing, sandals and costume jewelry.  With this new investment, he will once more increase his working capital and gradually strengthen his business.  His message to Kiva lenders is as follows:  "I am very grateful for your support and kind attention.  I hope that you will continue supporting me".

loans.use: to buy men's clothing, sandals and costume jewelry

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy  es madre de un niño de 11 años de edad y que vive al sur de la ciudad, donde tiene una miscelánea y vende artículos cosméticos al detalle, papelería, útiles escolares, accesorios femeninos etc... Ella está vinculada a la Fundación santo Domingo desde el año 1996, organización con la cual ha recibido 26 financiamientos. Inicialmente se dedicaba a vender productos mediante guías especializadas de negocios, pero poco a poco fue comprando artículos de promoción y con ello vitrinas para ordenar sus inventarios y hacer una exhibición efectiva, como la que actualmente tiene. Con el apoyo de la Fundación, Nancy ha logrado ampliar su estructura comercial de clientes, diversificar su oferta, adicionar otros servicios a sus instalaciones, como el de fotocopiaje e implementar un nuevo negocio de reciclaje de plástico y cartón. Nancy es profesional de la contaduría pública y se caracteriza por su emprendimiento y por el apoyo y bienestar que ella sola, ha logrado ofrecer a su hijo, en el tema de educación y un techo donde vivir seguro. Adicionalmente a sus negocios, ofrece el servicio de asesoría contable a diversas empresas con las cuales tiene contratos de servicios. En la actualidad está aplicando un credikiva, con el cual comprará en un mayor volumen, detalles femeninos, artículos de papelería, cosméticos, bolsos, calzado, con los cuales actualizará sus inventarios, ofreciendo moda a sus clientes y respuesta efectiva en mercancías variadas de su preferencia. Su meta principal es ofrecerle educación especializada a su hijo y dejarle su legado empresarial que es todo por lo cual trabaja una buena madre.
texts.en: Nancy is a mother of an 11 year old son and lives in the southern part of the city. There she has a variety store where she sells cosmetics, paper products, school supplies, and women's accesories. She is connectes to the Fundación Santo Domingo since 1996. She has received 26 loans from this organization. At first, she sold products via specialized business catalogues,but little by little she started buying items on sale and then display cases to organize her inventory and display it effectively, as she does now. With the support of the Fundación, Nancy has been able to expand her clientele, diversify her stock, and add more services, such as photocopying and a new business recycling plastic and cardboard. Nancy is a certified public accountant and is characterized as being enterprising and as being supportive and attentive to her son's wellbeing. She has given him and education and a home where he can live safely.  In addition to her businesses, she offers accounting services to different businesses with which she has service contracts. Right now she is applying for a Kiva loan. With it she will buy women's accesories, paper products, cosmetics, bags, and shoes in greater volumes. In this way, she will update her inventory, offering her customers fashion and an effective response with varied merchandise of their preference. Her main goal is to offer her son specialized education and leave him a business legacy. That is all a good mother works for.

loans.use: to buy women's accesories, paper products, cosmetics, bags and shoes.

loans.name: Leidy Yamileth

texts.es:
Leidy, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir nuevamente en el negocio, con la ecepcion que hoy sra invertido en prendas de vestir con nuevos estilos en blusas, camisas y ropa interior para damas y caballeros, esto le permitirá tener más variedad en la mercadería, esta negocio lo atiende al mismo tiempo que las frutas y verduras.

Con el préstamo anterior considera que mejoró su negocio creciendo en la variedad de mercadería con frutas frescas, también le permitió atender un mayor número de clientes, gracias al crédito con la institución ha logrado estabilizar su situación en el negocio y su condición en la familia.
texts.en: Leidy decided to take out a new loan in order to invest in her business again, with the difference that this loan will go towards buying clothes in the modern fashion such as blouses, shirts, and underwear for ladies and gents. This will enable her to offer a wider variety of items to sell: she tends to this business while still selling fruits and vegetables. With the previous loan, she says that she was really able to improve her business by offering a greater variety of fresh fruit. It also enabled her to serve more customers. Thanks to the loan with the field partner, Leidy managed to stabilise her business as well as her family's economic situation.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, and underwear for ladies and gents.

loans.name: Mwajumbe

texts.en:
Mwajumbe Suleiman is a 42-year-old tailor in Mombasa. She is a married mother of four children. She has been sewing clothes for her customers for the past 20 years. Her business is doing very well. 

This is Mwajumbe Suleiman’s third business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase a new sewing machine, spools of thread and fabrics. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and repay her loan. 

In the future, she hopes to employ people to assist her in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, spools of thread and fabrics.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is married and has one child. Rosemarie is 34 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Rosemarie sells dried fish to earn a living. She has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

Rosemarie has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Rosemarie hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: To buy additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
This is Anita. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in paying for their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Anita would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Anita hopes her business will grow in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her family a good future. She would also like to provide a high-quality education for her children through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed for her store.

loans.name: Olympia

texts.en:
Olympia is 49 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children. 

Olympia has a grocery store where she sells groceries and other consumable products. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to be used in purchasing additional groceries for sale.

Olympia has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Olympia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional groceries for sale.

loans.name: Rollen

texts.en:
Rollen is married and has one infant child. He is 22 years old and lives in Cang-inte, Siquijor.

Rollen is a farmer who grows assorted vegetables to earn a living. He has been doing this for 10 years. He has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for his farming business.

On November 22, 2011, Rollen became a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and received a loan of 3,000 PHP. He is a good client and was never late on his payments for the previous loan. As of now, Rollen dreams of acquiring additional land for the expansion of his business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides for his farming business.

loans.name: Cinthia

texts.es:
Cinthia tiene 24 años, es una trabajadora y valiente madre soltera. Vive en compañía de su hija Alison, en casa de su madre ubicada en la localidad de Hualahoyo.  
Aprendió la costura hace algunos años y gracias a su habilidad trabajó con una señora que vendía forros para guardar planos y reglas para los ingenieros. Posteriormente comenzó su propio negocio, adquirió la máquina de coser que ahora tiene y con eso empezó a realizar los forros que ahora vende con mucho éxito. Cuenta que los meses de agosto y marzo tiene mayor entrada, por esa razón contrata a otras muchachas que le ayudan en el trabajo. Más ahora desea seguir progresando y vender todos los forros posibles, por ello desea comprar más máquinas de coser especializadas para forros gruesos, pues su madre le ofreció un espacio grande para poner su taller. 

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe, pues podrá concretar los objetivos de su negocio. Promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que aprende mucho con los integrantes de su grupo.
Cinthia invertirá este dinero en la compra de una máquina industrial, que le ayudará en la elaboración de los forros.
texts.en:
Cinthia is 24 years old.  She is a hard-working, courageous single mother who lives together with her daughter, Alison, in her mother's house, in the town of Hualahoyo.

Cinthia learned how to sew some years ago and, thanks to her skill, she worked with a lady who sold cases in which engineers keep their plans and rules.  She later set up her own business, acquired the sewing machine that she has now, and started making the cases that she sells very successfully.  She says that she makes her best sales in August and March and so she hires other girls to help her with her work.  Right now, she would like to continue making progress and sell as many cases as possible.  She would like to buy more specialized sewing machines for making thick cases as her mother offered her a large space for her workshop.

This is Cinthia's first loan from MFP and she is grateful for the financial support that she is receiving because it will enable her to realize her business goals.  She pledges to be punctual in making her loan repayments as she learns a lot from her fellow group members.

Cinthia will invest this money in buying an industrial machine which will help her in making her cases.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas y tiene 32 años de edad, es conviviente  y madre de 2 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 3 años y es dueña de un puesto en el mercado donde vende ropa.  Ella nos cuenta que con FINCA Perú logró su sueño de tener su propia tienda grande  de venta de ropa donde es conocida por la gente y ahora puede abrir más sucursales, le gustan las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal ya que aprendió a ahorrar y a valorarse como mujer. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para su tienda como pantalones, buzos, polos, camisas, blusas, casacas.
texts.en: Carmen, 32 years old, is a member of the Azucenas communal bank and lives with her two children. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 3 years and is the owner of a stand at the market where she sells clothes. Carmen tells us that with FICA Peru, she was able to achieve her dream of having her own large clothes store. She is known by the people and now she can open more branches. She likes the training she receives at her communal bank; she learned to save and value herself as a woman. The loan she is requesting will be invested in buying clothes for her store such as pants, sweaters, polos, shirts, blouses, and jackets.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her store such as pants, sweaters, polos, shirts, blouses, and jackets.

loans.name: Velmys Patricia

texts.es:
Velmys, trabaja con su esposo en el cultivo de maíz y arroz, solicita un préstamo para poder invertir en los materiales necesarios para este tipo de cultivo, la compra será en abonos y venenos para plagas, esto le permitirá poder cultivar el maíz y el arroz de una manera más segura previendo los posibles riesgos.

Con el credito anterior tuvo una buena experiencia, obteniendo una mejor cosecha de granos básicos que le permitió aumentar su rentabilidad, ya que logró vender parte de la cosecha, esto le ha dado los recursos económicos para su familia manteniendo una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Velmys works with her husband growing corn and rice.  She is requesting this loan so that she can invest in buying the materials she needs for her crops.  She will buy fertilizers and pesticides.  This will allow her to grow her corn and rice more safely, anticipating possible risks.  

Velmys' previous loan was used successfully.  She obtained a better harvest of basic grains which allowed her to increase her profitability as she was able to sell some of her harvest.  This provided her with money for her family and she was able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Robiya

texts.en:
Robiya is very kind and smart. Some years ago she had a very difficult life, so to improve her life she decided to organize her own business. 

For more than 15 years she has been busy with her store. She sells all the things people need for living. Robiya has a lot of experience running this business. Her husband is a pensioner and can’t help her. 

Robiya wants to develop her business and that’s why she is asking for a loan to buy goods to widen the assortment she sells. She awaits your help.

loans.use: To buy a wider assortment of goods for resale.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
This is Gina. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Gina hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married with two school-age children. She is 37 years old and lives in Tacloban, Siquijor, Siquijor.

Jocelyn sells tempura to earn a living and has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase assorted ingredients for her tempura-making business.

Jocelyn has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for more than one year. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase assorted ingredients for her tempura-making business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy different fruits for preparing her juices

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is 36 years old, and he is single. He has been in the poultry business for three years and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000.The loan will be used to buy feed for the the poultry. The anticipated profits will be used to expand his business.

This is his second loan from KADET LTD, and he has successfully repaid his previous loan. His hopes and dreams are to rear chickens on a large scale and also to be a large-scale distributor of poultry within and outside of Kamulu.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 35 years old and from Kilifi. She is a married mother of four. She sells vegetables and fruit, a business she has been doing for the past 14 years with success.

This marks her third loan from KADET LTD to expand her business. She plans to purchase more cabbages, spinach, oranges, tomatoes and kale. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to start other businesses.

She hopes to see her family lead a comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase more cabbages, spinach, oranges, tomatoes and kale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to perform maintenance and general repairs on his mototaxi.

loans.name: Gino Eduardo

texts.es:
Gino es un joven de 21 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de chincha la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano y sus pobladores se caracterizan por tener una buena sazón para la preparación de platillos típicos. Gino en sus tiempos libres disfruta de comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo Arroz chaufa con wantan frito.  Se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Ambiental y con su trabajo se apoya con lo gastos de sus estudios.

Con mucho entusiasmo Gino trabaja en la municipalidad de su distrito realizando trabajos de saneamiento ambiental, el trabaja alrededor e de 8 horas al día, le gusta mucho trabajo y por ello el cree que le va bien porque trabaja con responsabilidad y sobre todo con ganas de salir adelante.

Gino está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales de estudio como libros, calculadoras científica, y podrá realizar la reparación de su computadora ya que actualmente no funciona y le es muy necesario para realizar sus trabajo de universidad, de esta manera podrá tener los útiles necesarios para sus estudios y seguirá luchando para convertirse en un buen profesional y ser el orgullo de sus padres y sobre todo apoyarlos así como lo han apoyado a él.
texts.en:
Gino is 21 years old, he lives in Chincha, a town characterized by its warm and welcoming climate, as well as for being the birthplace of great Peruvian sportspeople, and its inhabitants are known for the tasty flavors used in the preparation of their typical dishes. In his free time Gino likes eating one of his favorite dishes, the delicious “Arroz Chaufa with fried wonton”*. He is studying Environmental Engineering and thanks to his job he pays for his education expenses.

Gino works with great enthusiasm in the town of his district providing sanitation services. He works around 8 hours a day; he likes his job very much and he thinks things are going well for him because he works with responsibility and above all with a great desire to progress in life.

Gino is deeply grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their support he will be able to buy items he need for his studies such as books and a scientific calculator, on top of having his computer fixed: it is currently out of order, but he really needs it to prepare his university projects. He wants to have all the things he needs for his education and to keep on studying hard to become a good professional; he also wants to be the pride of his parents and, above all, to be able to provide for them as they have provided for him.

*Arroz Chaufa with fried wonton is a rice dish with chicken, bacon and ham accompanied by friend wonton.

loans.use: To buy books, a scientific calculator and to have his computer repaired.

loans.name: Judith Silvetra

texts.es:
Judith  es una joven de 21 años de edad, ella vive en la ciudad de Chincha, chincha la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano y sus pobladores se caracterizan por tener una buena sazón para la preparación de platillos típicos. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho escuchar música y sobre todo comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es la riquísima “Carapulcra con sopa seca”.  Actualmente Judith se encuentra estudiando la carrera de derecho  y ya va cursando el decimo ciclo.

Día a día Judtih trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa y productos de belleza y cosméticos, ella trabaja alrededor  de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes diariamente; ella cree que el va bien en su negocio porque es muy dedicada y amable con los clientes.

Judith está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como ropa para invierno en especial pantalones, chompa, casacas, asi como tambien productos de belleza, entre otros, así de esta manera ella podrá ofrecer mayor variedad de productos y mejorara sus ingresos, para así seguir luchando y cumplir su más grande sueño.” Terminar su carrera”.
texts.en:
